column4: director of U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services
column5: sits during an interview in Los Angeles. The U.S. government agency that oversees immigrants' applications to become citizens is starting an office tasked with stripping naturalized Americans of their citizenship if they cheated to get it. Cissna said in an interview Friday
column8: that his agency is hiring several dozen lawyers and officers to review the cases of immigrants who were ordered deported and are suspected of using fake identities to later get green cards and naturalize. (AP Photo/Reed Saxon

column1: LOS ANGELES (AP) — The U.S. government agency that oversees immigration applications is launching an office that will focus on identifying Americans who are suspected of cheating to get their citizenship and seek to strip them of it.

U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services Director L. Francis Cissna told The Associated Press in an interview that his agency is hiring several dozen lawyers and immigration officers to review cases of immigrants who were ordered deported and are suspected of using fake identities to later get green cards and citizenship through naturalization.
ADVERTISEMENT
Cissna said the cases would be referred to the Department of Justice
column2: whose attorneys could then seek to remove the immigrants’ citizenship in civil court proceedings. In some cases
column3: government attorneys could bring criminal charges related to fraud.

column1: Until now
column2: the agency has pursued cases as they arose but not through a coordinated effort
column3: Cissna said. He said he hopes the agency’s new office in Los Angeles will be running by next year but added that investigating and referring cases for prosecution will likely take longer.

column1: “We finally have a process in place to get to the bottom of all these bad cases and start denaturalizing people who should not have been naturalized in the first place
column2: ” Cissna said. “What we’re looking at
column3: when you boil it all down
column4: is potentially a few thousand cases.”

column1: He declined to say how much the effort would cost but said it would be covered by the agency’s existing budget
column2: which is funded by immigration application fees.

column1: The push comes as the Trump administration has been cracking down on illegal immigration and taking steps to reduce legal immigration to the U.S.
Immigrants who become U.S. citizens can vote
column2: serve on juries and obtain security clearance. Denaturalization — the process of removing that citizenship — is very rare.

column1: The U.S. government began looking at potentially fraudulent naturalization cases a decade ago when a border officer detected about 200 people had used different identities to get green cards and citizenship after they were previously issued deportation orders.
In September 2016
column2: an internal watchdog reported that 315
column3: 000 old fingerprint records for immigrants who had been deported or had criminal convictions had not been uploaded to a Department of Homeland Security database that is used to check immigrants’ identities. The same report found more than 800 immigrants had been ordered deported under one identity but became U.S. citizens under another.

column1: ADVERTISEMENT
Since then
column2: the government has been uploading these older fingerprint records dating back to the 1990s and investigators have been evaluating cases for denaturalization.

column1: Earlier this year
column2: a judge revoked the citizenship of an Indian-born New Jersey man named Baljinder Singh after federal authorities accused him of using an alias to avoid deportation.

column1: Authorities said Singh used a different name when he arrived in the United States in 1991. He was ordered deported the next year and a month later applied for asylum using the name Baljinder Singh before marrying an American
column2: getting a green card and naturalizing.

column1: Authorities said Singh did not mention his earlier deportation order when he applied for citizenship.
For many years
column2: most U.S. efforts to strip immigrants of their citizenship focused largely on suspected war criminals who lied on their immigration paperwork
column3: most notably former Nazis.

column1: Toward the end of the Obama administration
column2: officials began reviewing cases stemming from the fingerprints probe but prioritized those of naturalized citizens who had obtained security clearances
column3: for example
column4: to work at the Transportation Security Administration
column6: director of the Migration Policy Institute’s office at New York University law school.

column1: The Trump administration has made these investigations a bigger priority
column2: he said. He said he expects cases will focus on deliberate fraud but some naturalized Americans may feel uneasy with the change.

column1: “It is clearly true that we have entered a new chapter when a much larger number of people could feel vulnerable that their naturalization could be reopened
column2: ” Chishti said.

column1: Since 1990
column2: the Department of Justice has filed 305 civil denaturalization cases
column3: according to statistics obtained by an immigration attorney in Kansas who has defended immigrants in these cases.

column1: The attorney
column2: Matthew Hoppock
column3: agrees that deportees who lied to get citizenship should face consequences but worries other immigrants who might have made mistakes on their paperwork could get targeted and might not have the money to fight back in court.

column1: Cissna said there are valid reasons why immigrants might be listed under multiple names
column2: noting many Latin American immigrants have more than one surname. He said the U.S. government is not interested in that kind of minor discrepancy but wants to target people who deliberately changed their identities to dupe officials into granting immigration benefits.

column1: “The people who are going to be targeted by this — they know full well who they are because they were ordered removed under a different identity and they intentionally lied about it when they applied for citizenship later on
column2: ” Cissna said. “It may be some time before we get to their case
column3: but we’ll get to them.”"	APNewsBreak: US launches bid to find citizenship cheaters	2018-06-12 02:16:47+00:00	['Amy Taxin']	['agency'

column7: a very popular hand game that has no clear origin
column8: and is played by making a circle with your thumb and index finger and then placed below the waist like this:

column1: If someone looks at the finger circle

column1: After showing the officer the finger circle

column3: “I was tired of that damn circle. Back in middle school some kid knocked me out because I looked at it”.

column1: Pablo will reportedly spend New Year’s day inside jail until his $5000 bail is paid.

column12: 'https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/wonk/wp/2015/07/20/this-153000-rattlesnake-bite-is-everything-wrong-with-american-health-care/?utm_term=.11f92a7af1dc']	https://www.cbsnews.com/news/rattlesnake-selfie-results-in-a-153k-medical-bill/	https://www.cbsnews.com/	"For a man in San Diego
column13: getting bitten by a rattlesnake was just the beginning of his problems. The life-threatening encounter was followed by a shocking medical bill: $153

column1: Todd Fassler was bitten earlier this month
column2: reportedly while trying to pose for a selfie with the snake.

column1: Like most snake bite victims
column2: Fassler needed many doses of the antivenom CroFab
column3: the only current drug available to counteract the potentially deadly snake venom. Bites from less poisonous snakes can require as little as three doses
column4: but the most toxic poisonous snake bites can take dozens of doses. A California boy bitten by an highly toxic snake in 2012 required 42 vials of antivenom
column5: and some patients need even more.

column1: The only effective treatment is antivenom
column2: Dr. Keith Boesen
column3: director of the Arizona Poison & Drug Information Center
column4: told CBS News. ""There's blood tests we can do to determine the effect of the venom. Hospital bills can always be worked out or negotiated
column7: the loss of part of your hand or your arm.""

column1: Boesen said he knew of one snake bite victim in Arizona who required 74 vials of antivenom. The wholesale rate that hospitals pay to the manufacturer is $2
column2: 500 per vial and the markup to patients and insurance is much higher.

column1: Fassler's bill included a line item of $83
column2: 341.25 for ""pharmacy"" to cover the antivenom
column3: as reporter Dan Haggerty of KGTV in San Diego posted on Twitter. According to the original report
column4: Fassler used up the antivenom supply from two hospitals.

column1: Remember the Rattlesnake bite story I did Monday? Guy just sent me this pic of his bill. Uhhhhhhh..... pic.twitter.com/ahK2W9KxVg — Dan Haggerty (@10NewsHaggerty) July 16
Part of the reason the bill is large for most snake bite victims is because there is only one manufacturer and limited supply of the antivenom. In addition
column2: a snake bite requires emergency room treatment
column3: a few days in the hospital intensive care unit and sometimes therapy to recover function of the damaged body part.

column1: Between 7
column2: 000 and 8
column3: 000 people are bitten by venomous snakes in the U.S. every year
column6: about 5 will die. The vast majority of people seek and have access to medical attention where they quickly receive antivenom
column7: also known as antivenin. New antivenoms are in development including one recently approved by the FDA called Anavip

column1: Boesen calls Arizona the ""evenomation capital of the country"" because they treat so many poisonous reptile and insect bites. The problem may become even more common as snakes become bolder searching for water in drought-stricken states in the West. He said the longer snake bite victims wait before receiving the antivenom
column2: the more damage they will sustain.

column1: For a person who is bitten
column2: a snake bite start simply as puncture wounds
column3: then the swelling and tissue die-off visibly creeps up the extremity. At the same time
column4: the venom prevents the blood from clotting
column5: causing bleeding problems and pronounced bruises. All those responses can cause serious and permanent damage to the bitten area.

column1: You'll see it progress an inch an hour. It's almost at a visible pace where you're watching your arm swell. We'll give antivenom to make that swelling stop
column2: so it will stop progressing
column3: said Boesen. ""There is no drug that can reverse the damage
column4: we can only prevent it from getting worse.""

column1: Death is very rare since antivenom has been available in the U.S. since the 1950s
column2: he noted. But faster treatment will mean less damage and less time for the substantial recovery process
column3: which can take weeks to months.

column1: So if someone
column2: for example
column3: doesn't have any insurance and is afraid of a hospital
column4: I would be much more afraid of losing my hand or my arm than an expensive hospital bill

column1: https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/fox-new-zealand-mosque/	the government of new zealand pulled sky news australia off the air in march 2019.	mostly false	['']	2019/03/25	Dan MacGuill	['http://archive.is/jgD8g'
column2: 'http://web.archive.org/web/20190325141828/https://thinkprogress.org/new-zealand-pulls-murdochs-sky-news-australia-off-the-air-over-mosque-massacre-coverage-353cd22f86a7/']	http://web.archive.org/web/20190325141828/https://thinkprogress.org/new-zealand-pulls-murdochs-sky-news-australia-off-the-air-over-mosque-massacre-coverage-353cd22f86a7/	http://web.archive.org/	"Rupert Murdoch’s 24-hour Sky News Australia has been pulled off the air by independently-owned Sky New Zealand. The decision was made after Murdoch’s channel refused to stop showing graphic video footage shot by the man who killed 49 people at two mosques in Christchurch
column3: New Zealand

column1: This was despite calls from the police urging anyone broadcasting the disturbing footage to stop circulating it. “Police are aware there is extremely distressing footage relating to the incident in Christchurch circulating online
column2: ” the New Zealand police said in a statement. “We would strongly urge that the link not be shared. We are working to have any footage removed.”

column1: On Saturday
column2: the New Zealand broadcaster announced the decision to pull the channel off the air. “We stand in support of our fellow New Zealanders and have made the decision to remove Sky News Australia from our platform until we are confident that the distressing footage from yesterday’s events will not be shared
column3: ” it said in a now-deleted Tweet.

column1: Soon after in a new Tweet
column2: the broadcaster changed its message saying
column3: “We stand in support of our fellow New Zealanders and are working with our colleagues at @SkyNewsAust to ensure coverage doesn’t compromise ongoing investigations in NZ. We made the decision on Friday with Sky News Australia to replace their live news with sport.”

column1: Advertisement
In a statement Friday
column2: a Sky News Australia spokesman said: “Sky News in line with other broadcasters ran heavily edited footage that did not show the shootings or the victims.”

column1: Sky News Australia didn’t air in New Zealand for five days
column2: returning on Wednesday
column3: March 20
column4: according to Sky New Zealand. In the interim
column5: the networks worked to change the perception created by Sky New Zealand that Sky News Australia had been forced off the air. Sky New Zealand emailed ThinkProgress on March 21
column6: saying that it “would like to take the opportunity to correct statements made by us on Saturday.”

column1: Sky New Zealand spokesperson Chris Major said in a statement that the networks decided together to pull the coverage shortly after the attacks. “It was a proactive and precautionary decision taken by both parties to ensure any live coverage or commentary taking place in Australia
column2: outside of the NZ jurisdiction
column3: did not compromise the NZ investigations and legal process

column1: Friday’s mass shooting was streamed to Facebook live video by the shooter for at least 17 minutes. YouTube
column2: Reddit
column3: Facebook
column4: and Twitter have since been working to remove footage of the massacre
column6: new copies of the video continue to be uploaded.

column1: Officials in the U.K. have also called on the tech companies to stop the spread of this footage. “Online platforms have a responsibility not to do the terrorists’ work for them
column2: ” British Home Secretary Sajid Javid wrote in an article for The Daily Express on Saturday.

column1: Advertisement
The alleged shooter was a self-described terrorist who wrote a manifesto about white supremacy
column2: in which he praised President Donald Trump
column3: calling the president a “symbol of renewed white identity and common purpose.” The manifesto also included mention of conservative pundits and other white supremacist killers.

column1: But when asked whether he thought white supremacy was a growing danger around the world
column2: Trump said he did not.

column1: Meanwhile
column2: Murdoch’s Fox News channel in the U.S. has aired several segments in which it positions conservatives as the victims
column3: fearing the Friday massacre is being used as an attempt to limit their free speech.

column1: “Already tonight
column2: you are hearing calls in this country for curbs on free speech in response to the New Zealand massacre

column2: florida homeowners were unable to use solar panels during irma to generate electricity.	false	['florida'
column3: 'free energy'
column17: 'http://thefreethoughtproject.com/florida-illegal-solar-home/']	http://thefreethoughtproject.com/florida-illegal-solar-home/	http://thefreethoughtproject.com/	"In Florida it’s Illegal to Power Your Home with Solar Panels—Thanks to Lobbying

column1: Spread the love
With roughly 1.5 million Floridians initially without electricity from the damage inflicted on Florida’s energy infrastructure
column2: many in the Sunshine State are now questioning why it’s so difficult for people to utilize solar energy.

column1: The simple answer is that one of the major electrical suppliers in the state – Florida Power and Light (FPL) – has utilized a massive lobbying campaign
column2: directed at state lawmakers
column3: to create legal barriers to disallow people from powering their own homes with solar panels without being subject to power companies.

column1: In fact
column2: current Florida state law makes it illegal.

column1: This is the definition of crony capitalism. Companies lobby government officials
column2: who then vote in favor of the corporate position — often for a quid pro quo in the form of financial support for the officials’ reelection campaign.

column1: Any solar panels erected on a home must be connected to the local electrical power grid.
So
column2: if you want to build an off the grid home – it is illegal to install solar panels on your home.

column1: Just ask Robert Tarr who
column2: according to WFTV
column3: spent more than $60
column4: 000 for a system of 32 solar panels for his roof. But even though his house can generate enough electricity to run indefinitely without being hooked to a power company
column6: he still has to be connected and pay the Leesburg Electric Department for power he doesn’t even need.

column1: “So you can be completely free of the grid?” Channel 9’s Jamie Holmes asked.
“Yes
column2: ” Tarr said.

column1: “But they make you attach to the grid
column2: ” Holmes asked.

column1: “Yes
column2: ” Tarr said. “I have a problem with it
column3: OK? I think if I want to be totally independent of them
column4: I should be allowed to be

column1: If Tarr were to stop paying his electric bill
column2: reports WFTV
column3: he said Leesburg would shut off his power. City officials could also revoke his certificate of occupancy for not being hooked up to the system.

column1: So
column2: if this family wanted to defy the power company and remove his solar from the control of the power company
column3: the government could revoke his certificate of occupancy—making it illegal for anyone to live in the home!

column1: Rest assured that any attempt to resist one’s removal from said home would be met with police force and violent escalation.
The extreme crony capitalism at work in Florida is astounding
column2: and nothing less than draconian.

column1: With roof-mounted solar panels becoming an increasingly inexpensive means of producing cheap renewable energy
column2: the fact that the state panders to the old energy dinosaurs to stifle consumer-friendly innovation is nothing less than infuriating.

column1: In fact
column2: Project Drawdown
column3: which is a broad coalition of researchers
column9: business leaders and activists that have assembled to find and present the best available information on climate solutions in order to describe their beneficial financial
column10: social and environmental impact over the next thirty years has found that widespread solar use would save $3.5 trillion dollars and reduce carbon dioxide emissions by 24.6 billion tons over the next 30 years if utilized.

column1: Ironically
column2: solar panels would make for a completely self-sustaining method of energy production if the local electrical grid were to fail during a crisis — like a hurricane.

column1: Make no mistake
column2: the old energy oligarchy simply refuses to be cut out of potential profits
column3: which is what happens when you no longer need to rely on them for power needs and possess the ability to power your own home.

column1: Instead of owning their greedy intentions
column2: companies like FPL
column3: instead
column4: attempt to rationalize their actions through absurd explanations.

column1: “Operating your renewable system without the bi-directional meter can result in an inaccurate meter reading causing your bill to increase
column2: ” FPL claims
column3: which essentially means that for proactively approaching your energy needs
column4: it could result in a potential glitch in their system that will charge you more money on your electrical bill.

column1: They also recommend that all homes powered by FPL
column2: that have solar panels
column3: be connected through the same electrical wiring
column4: and “the [renewable] system must shut down when FPL’s grid shuts down in order to prevent dangerous back feed on FPL’s grid. This is required to protect FPL employees who may be working on the grid.”

column1: Ironically
column2: FPL is basically saying that their workers could potentially be electrocuted if they’re doing maintenance on the grid during an inadvertent or scheduled shutdown
column3: while completely ignoring the fact that there would be NO risk to those workers if the home wasn’t legally required to be connected to the grid!

column1: If Florida residents were not forced to have their solar panels connected to the electrical grid
column2: which FPL lobbied state lawmakers to require
column3: there would be absolutely no problem.

column1: Aside from the clear environmental and security benefits of producing your own energy
column2: becoming a leader in the solar industry would be a boon for the economy in the Sunshine State.

column1: Sadly
column2: it’s these crony capitalist policies that leave states like Florida in the dark.

column1: Short-sighted policies like these have definitely not served the people of Florida
column2: to which the 1.5 million Floridians without power can most certainly attest.

column1: Please share this story to expose how governmental corruption picks the winners and losers and decimates a free market that could much better serve the people!

column1: https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/did-ben-carson-purchase-a-31000-dining-set-and-charge-it-to-hud/	hud secretary ben carson bought a $31
column2: 000 dining set and billed taxpayers for it.	true	['']	2018/03/01	Bethania Palma	['https://www.cnn.com/2018/03/01/politics/carson-dining-room-canceled/index.html']	https://www.cnn.com/2018/03/01/politics/carson-dining-room-canceled/index.html	https://www.cnn.com/	"Washington (CNN) Housing and Urban Development Secretary Ben Carson is requesting that the order for a $31
column3: 000 dining set be canceled
column4: according to a statement provided exclusively to CNN by longtime adviser Armstrong Williams.

column1: I was as surprised as anyone to find out that a $31
column2: 000 dining set had been ordered
column3: Carson said in the statement. ""I have requested that the order be canceled. We will find another solution for the furniture replacement.""

column1: Carson also said his wife
column2: Candy Carson
column3: had ""asked if used furniture was an option
column4: the first time there's been an indication that she was involved in the process. ""My wife also looked at catalogs and wanted to be sure that the color of the chair fabric of any set that was chosen matched the rest of the decor

column1: I made it known that I was not happy about the prices being charged and that my preference would be to find something more reasonable
column2: he added.

column1: The $31
column2: 000 dining set includes a table
column3: sideboard
column4: breakfront -- all in mahogany -- and 10 mahogany chairs with a blue velvet finish

column1: https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/swiss-army-life/	switzerland issues firearms to adult men and provides training in their use.	true	[]		David Mikkelson	['http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/1566715.stm']	http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/1566715.stm	http://news.bbc.co.uk/	"Guns are deeply rooted within Swiss culture - but the gun crime rate is so low that statistics are not even kept.
The country has a population of six million
column2: but there are estimated to be at least two million publicly-owned firearms
column3: including about 600

column1: This is in a very large part due to Switzerland's unique system of national defence
column2: developed over the centuries.

column1: Instead of a standing
column2: full-time army
column3: the country requires every man to undergo some form of military training for a few days or weeks a year throughout most of their lives.

column1: Between the ages of 21 and 32 men serve as frontline troops. They are given an M-57 assault rifle and 24 rounds of ammunition which they are required to keep at home.
Once discharged
column2: men serve in the Swiss equivalent of the US National Guard
column3: but still have to train occasionally and are given bolt rifles. Women do not have to own firearms

column1: Few restrictions
In addition to the government-provided arms
column2: there are few restrictions on buying weapons. Some cantons restrict the carrying of firearms - others do not.

column1: The government even sells off surplus weaponry to the general public when new equipment is introduced.
Guns and shooting are popular national pastimes. More than 200
column2: 000 Swiss attend national annual marksmanship competitions.

column1: But despite the wide ownership and availability of guns
column2: violent crime is extremely rare. There are only minimal controls at public buildings and politicians rarely have police protection.

column1: Mark Eisenecker
column2: a sociologist from the University of Zurich told BBC News Online that guns are ""anchored"" in Swiss society and that gun control is simply not an issue.

column1: Some pro-gun groups argue that Switzerland proves their contention that there is not necessarily a link between the availability of guns and violent crime in society.
Low crime
But other commentators suggest that the reality is more complicated.
Switzerland is one of the world's richest countries
column2: but has remained relatively isolated.

column1: It has none of the social problems associated with gun crime seen in other industrialised countries like drugs or urban deprivation.
Despite the lack of rigid gun laws
column2: firearms are strictly connected to a sense of collective responsibility.

column1: From an early age Swiss men and women associate weaponry with being called to defend their country."	Switzerland and the gun	2001-09-27 13:19:25	[]	['gun'

['Important If True']		David Mikkelson	['http://web.archive.org/web/20011130173041/http://www.creators.com/opinion_show.cfm?columnsName=ema']	http://web.archive.org/web/20011130173041/http://www.creators.com/opinion_show.cfm?columnsName=ema	http://web.archive.org/	"
by Ellen Makkai FOR RELEASE: TUESDAY
column2: NOVEMBER 27

column1: HARRY THE WIZ IS THE WRONG BIZ
There is a peculiar people out there -- anti-Harry Potter parents.

J.K. Rowling's highly readable and imaginative Harry Potter series -- about a young wizard's tutelage and mastery of the black arts -- is a publishing phenomenon. But these parents see him as Satan's secret agent sent to surreptitiously ensnare souls.
The world has morphed into Planet Potter. The series has been translated into 42 languages
column2: including Zulu. Kids wear Potter PJs
column3: eat from Potter plates and sleep on Potter pillows.

column1: Young witch/wizard wannabes wait in 'round the block lines for the film version of Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone. ""I want to be a wizard
column2: responded the two young sons of actor Rob Lowe when asked what they gleaned from the movie.

column1: San Diego movie critic Holly McClure lauds the movie's excellence but says bluntly both print and celluloid versions ""Lay it out there; it's about witchcraft.""
Carol Rookwood
column2: head teacher in a Church of England school
column3: banned Potter saying
column4: ""The Bible is clear about issues such as witchcraft
column6: the devil and the occult. It says clearly from Genesis to Revelation that they are real
column7: powerful and dangerous ... (we) should have nothing to do with them.""

column1: But for parents vexed by video games
column2: Harry Potter is the Holy Grail. Kids once hunched in front of Sony Play Stations now curl up with Harry
column3: reading the voluminous texts for hours on end.

column1: The IRS recognizes certain witchcraft sects as religions but church/state issues have been jettisoned here. Public school teachers read Harry Potter aloud as captivated students sit transfixed. Thomas Jefferson Middle School in Port Washington
column2: Wis.
column3: sent 500 students to the film.

column1: Still
column2: headlines read
column3: ""Parents Protest Potter."" According to a July 2000 Gallup Poll
column4: Harry gets nixed by 8 percent of parents with children under 18. ""The books have a serious tone of death ... of evil
column9: when addressing the state Board of Education.

column1: To some
column2: Harry is a Trojan horse -- a clever vehicle able to implant a sort of satanic receptor in the human soul -- making youngsters vulnerable to demonic activity and possible infestation. Who can forget Linda Blair in ""The Exorcist""?

column1: The power of Satan ... is very dangerous
column2: and our children have gone into it
column3: says Caryl Matrisciana
column4: occult expert and producer of the video ""Harry Potter: Witchcraft Repackaged.""

column1: Potter fans argue that Harry cavorts in a realm similar to that in C.S. Lewis' Chronicles of Narnia. But the Lewis' allegory draws readers to the beneficent Judaic/Christian God
column2: whereas Harry has no sovereign governing his use of self-seeking manipulative power.

column1: Contrast Harry Potter and ""Idylls of the King
column2: Alfred Lord Tennyson's poetic masterpiece interpreting Arthurian Legend. Tennyson's sorcery is recognized as mythological evil while much of Harry's hocus-pocus -- packaged as harmless fantasy -- is genuine. Necromancy
column3: blood sacrifice

column1: There is a tremendous smoke screen in the (Potter) PR machinery
column2: Matriciana says. ""Does being packaged as 'fantasy' mean we're not to question content?""

column1: Rowling exhaustively researched the occult to better animate her characters' skills. According to Iowa Licensed Master Social Worker
column2: William Schnoebelen
column3: former Church of Satan member
column4: Potter characters execute satanic ceremony and technique as practiced today.

column1: Schnoebelen
column2: also a former instructor of witchcraft
column3: says Potter imitators are blind to the entities that respond from ""an unknown beguiling arena. It seems so enchantingly fun and innocent
column4: but they are trafficking in evil spirits. The books definitely draw kids to witchcraft.""

column1: High Priest Egan of The First Church of Satan in Salem
column2: Mass.
column3: celebrates Harry's contribution
column5: ""Harry is an absolute godsend ... we've had more applicants than we can handle lately.""

column1: Former Satanic mystic
column2: Johanna Michaelson
column3: says
column4: ""There is a beautiful side of evil -- deceptive
column6: adorned with all manner of spiritual refinements
column7: but no less from the pit of hell than that which is blatantly satanic.""

column1: Witchcraft and sorcery permeate Rowling's books and parents would do well to attempt the impossible; steer kids clear of Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.
At the very least
column2: children determined to explore Harry Potter's realm should be grounded in a flame-retardant faith
column3: that enables them to ride the lightning and still walk away unscathed.

column1: https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/alex-smith-died-couldnt-afford-insulin/	a 26-year-old man named alex smith of minneapolis died because he had aged out of his mother's health insurance and couldn't afford insulin.	true	['big pharma'
column2: 'diabetes'
column3: 'health insurance'

column1: On June 27
column3: my son Alec was found dead
column4: alone in his Minneapolis apartment. It shouldn’t have happened.

column1: Alec had Type 1 diabetes
column2: a serious condition that is manageable with access to insulin and proper supplies. But Alec turned 26 years old on May 20 of last year
column3: which meant that his coverage under my health insurance policy ended a few days later. Alec had a full-time
column5: like a lot of US workers
column6: he did not have good health insurance offered through his employer.

column1: For Alec and others with diabetes
column2: this presents a deadly situation. Many people with type 2 diabetes need regular access to insulin to live; all persons with Type 1 do. Insulin is a 95-year-old drug whose discoverers sold their patents for $1 each
column3: but its price has increased over 1
column4: 000 percent since the late 1990s. A vial of the same insulin that was once sold for around $25 can now cost patients like Alec nearly $300
column5: and many people need multiple vials per month to survive.

column1: The pharmaceutical companies that sell insulin won’t disclose any details
column2: but it is likely that this same vial is manufactured for just a few dollars. Which means that those companies are making huge profits and paying huge CEO salaries. The three insulin manufacturers have raised their prices in lockstep for many years now
column3: prompting a class-action lawsuit and criminal investigations into collusion. Additionally
column4: the insurance industry is also complicit in the drug pricing scheme.

column1: For Alec
column2: this meant that his insulin and supplies cost almost $1
column3: 300 a month. He and I together researched for months in advance about his health insurance options. They weren’t good. The best plan we found would cost him $450 a month for the premium with a whopping $7
column4: 600 deductible. That deductible meant he would be paying out-of-pocket for his medicine for many months anyway
column5: so he decided to go without the plan until he could find a different job with benefits.

column1: With the cost so high
column2: Alec tried to ration his insulin. I have since learned that this is not uncommon. Globally
column3: half of the people who need insulin can’t reliably get access to it. With 6 million people in the US insulin-dependent
column4: and nearly 40 percent of Americans uninsured or facing high deductibles that leave their medicine costs uncovered
column5: the crisis is occurring right here

column1: Endocrinologists here in the US report that as many as one in five of their patients are not able to afford their insulin. For many persons with diabetes
column2: that means they land in the emergency room with diabetic ketoacidosis. For others
column3: like Alec
column4: they never get there. Just 27 days after his coverage under my insurance ended
column5: I received the call no parent ever wants to get.

column1: As you would imagine
column2: my family and I are still grieving. But I’ve decided that sharing our story may help prevent someone else from going through what Alec did. There are a lot of proposals to increase access to affordable health coverage and to lower the price of medicines
column3: including forcing drug companies to be transparent about their research costs and profits
column4: and allowing Medicare to negotiate down the price it pays for prescription drugs. To me
column5: they all boil down to one theme: Access to insulin

column1: The inventor of insulin
column2: Frederick Banting
column3: believed that. When he was asked why he gave away his patent for $1
column5: “Because insulin does not belong to me. It belongs to the world.” That spirit is being violated today
column6: where there are thousands of GoFundMe pages devoted to people like Alec
column7: desperately trying to cobble together the money they need for their monthly insulin.

column1: There are a lot of good people working to change this
column2: including US lawmakers. But it seems clear to me that significant movement toward universal access to essential medicines will only come when the affected patients and their loved ones help lead the way.

column1: So I was happy to see that people with diabetes in Nevada were able to help push through a law that requires transparency in insulin pricing there. And that is why I support the patient group T1International’s demand that insulin manufacturers disclose the profits they are making off of each vial and reverse their unjustified price increases. That is why I shared Alec’s story at a recent demonstration led by Type 1 diabetes patients outside the headquarters of insulin manufacturer Eli Lilly and Company
column2: demanding increased transparency and lower prices.

column1: As I told the patients and activists gathered there
column2: my Alec was the best son anyone could ask for. He was loved by so many and I am so proud to have been his mom for the short 26 years I had with him. But he should still be here. I should not have buried my son at 26 because he couldn’t afford the one thing in life that was created to keep him alive."	I Had to Bury My 26-Year-Old Son Because He Couldn’t Afford Insulin	2018-02-01 05:00:00+00:00	['Nicole Smith-Holt'
column3: 'Margaret Flowers'
column20: a serious condition that is manageable with access to insulin and proper supplies.

column1: But
column2: like a lot of US workers
column3: he did not have good health insurance offered through his employer.

column1: Many people with type 2 diabetes need regular access to insulin to live; all persons with Type 1 do.
He and I together researched for months in advance about his health insurance options.
Globally
column2: half of the people who need insulin can’t reliably get access to it."

column1: Russian scientists developed the so-called «antidote» based on a 1959 scientific research published under the title “Organizing action of prenatally administered testosterone propionate on the tissues mediating mating behavior in the female guinea pig” by Charles H. Phoenix
column2: an American researcher.

column1: The study concluded that “INAH [part of the hypothalamus] is dimorphic with sexual orientation
column2: at least in men
column3: and suggests that sexual orientation has a biological substrate”.

column1: Iran
column2: China and Saudi Arabia have been the first countries to show interest in the new discovery.

column1: «Xenoestrogen are a type of estrogen mimickers found in synthetic or natural chemical compounds. Synthetic xenoestrogens such as PCB’s
column2: BPA and phthalates have been also been found to have estrogenic effects on living organisms and to disrupt the endocrine system» explains Dr. Yuri Krutchev
column3: who took part in the experiment. «Injecting specific quantities of testosterone helps to

column1: «Injecting specific quantities of testosterone helps to upset this artificial biological unbalance which occurs mostly in part because of environmental pollution and an excess of estrogen mimickers in our modern environment» he adds.
The new discovery has attracted much criticism from lesbian
column2: gay

column4: yet a few country leaders have outspokenly shown support and interest for the research. Iran
column6: and Saudi Arabia have been the first countries to show interest in the new discovery.

column1: https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/quaranturkey/	hundreds of thousands of thanksgiving turkeys have been contaminated with ebola.	false	['ebola'
column2: 'Fearbola']		David Mikkelson	['http://dailybuzzlive.com/texas-turkey-farm-contaminated-ebola-holiday-turkeys-infected/']	http://dailybuzzlive.com/texas-turkey-farm-contaminated-ebola-holiday-turkeys-infected/	http://dailybuzzlive.com/	"Texas Turkey Farm Contaminated With Ebola
column3: Over 250

column1: A Texas turkey farm employee is now under quarantine after he tested positive for the Ebola virus. Texas Prime Turkey Farm
column2: the largest supplier of turkeys in the United States
column3: has been ordered by the CDC to quarantine over 250
column4: 000 holiday turkeys. The CDC has confirmed 3
column5: 000 turkeys have tested positive for the virus since Friday’s incident.

column1: According to investigators
column2: long time employee Philip Canseco was seen vomiting in the facilities restroom three days prior to the incident on Friday. “I was passing by the restroom
column3: when I heard somebody throwing up inside
column4: ” said one Texas Prime Turkey Farm employee. “I opened the door and looked inside and saw Canseco throwing up in one of the urinals. I asked him if he was okay
column6: and I left. I didn’t want to get close to him and get sick.”

column1: Management confirmed that Canseco worked three full work days at the facility with flu-like symptoms
column2: before passing out unconscious with a fever of 106°. Due to his symptoms
column3: he was rushed to a local hazmat tent where he tested positive for the Ebola virus. The CDC reports an additional 7 coworkers are being quarantined and tested. However
column4: they have not released those results as of yet.

column1: The facility has been ordered by the CDC to burn their entire flock of turkeys
column2: over 250
column3: 000. Texas Prime Turkey Farm is requesting permission from the state of Texas to send the shipment of incinerated turkey ashes to Veolia’s Port Arthur environmental waste facility. This facility has already accepted one shipment of Ebola waste from household goods where Thomas Eric Duncan had stayed. Duncan was the first man to die of Ebola on US soil.

column1: Activists are protesting the shipments of contaminated Ebola waste to their community. “We feel every precaution should be taken to protect our community
column2: our children and our elderly. We are not a dumping ground for the nations
column3: or the world’s bio waste.”

column1: Plant manager Mitch Osborne said on Saturday that even though no contract has yet been signed
column2: the plant will likely receive the second shipment of contaminated Ebola waste. “It is a safe and sound process
column3: ” Osborne said. “I am not going to place my employees in harms way
column4: or the community. The company is here to improve the environment and I believe we are doing a pretty darn good job of that. I believe we are doing the right and safe thing.”

column1: A spokesperson for Texas Prime Turkey Farm said there is a good chance Ebola turkeys may have already shipped out to major suppliers for distribution. Each retailer will have to perform recalls individually if they feel they have received a contaminated shipment.
CLICK HERE —> TO LIKE DAILY BUZZ LIVE ON FACEBOOK!"	Texas Turkey Farm Contaminated With Ebola

https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/social-insecurity/	president eisenhower once observed that a few texas oil millionaires wanted to abolish social security.	true	['social security']		David Mikkelson	['http://web.archive.org/web/20051124190902/http://www.eisenhowermemorial.org/presidential-papers/first-term/documents/1147.cfm']	http://web.archive.org/web/20051124190902/http://www.eisenhowermemorial.org/presidential-papers/first-term/documents/1147.cfm	http://web.archive.org/	"Dear Ed:1 I think that such answer as I can give to your letter of November first will be arranged in reverse order--at least I shall comment first on your final paragraph.

You keep harping on the Constitution; I should like to point out that the meaning of the Constitution is what the Supreme Court says it is. Consequently no powers are exercised by the Federal government except where such exercise is approved by the Supreme Court (lawyers) of the land.2
I admit that the Supreme Court has in the past made certain decisions in this general field that have been astonishing to me. A recent case in point was the decision in the Phillips case.3 Others
column2: and older ones
column3: involved ""interstate commerce.""4 But until some future Supreme Court decision denies the right and responsibility of the Federal government to do certain things
column4: you cannot possibly remove them from the political activities of the Federal government.

column1: Now it is true that I believe this country is following a dangerous trend when it permits too great a degree of centralization of governmental functions. I oppose this--in some instances the fight is a rather desperate one. But to attain any success it is quite clear that the Federal government cannot avoid or escape responsibilities which the mass of the people firmly believe should be undertaken by it. The political processes of our country are such that if a rule of reason is not applied in this effort
column2: we will lose everything--even to a possible and drastic change in the Constitution. This is what I mean by my constant insistence upon ""moderation"" in government. Should any political party attempt to abolish social security
column3: unemployment insurance
column4: and eliminate labor laws and farm programs
column5: you would not hear of that party again in our political history. There is a tiny splinter group
column7: that believes you can do these things. Among them are H. L. Hunt (you possibly know his background)
column8: a few other Texas oil millionaires
column9: and an occasional politician or business man from other areas.5 Their number is negligible and they are stupid.

column1: To say
column2: therefore
column3: that in some instances the policies of this Administration have not been radically changed from those of the last is perfectly true.6 Both Administrations levied taxes

column1: But in all governmental fields of action a combination of purpose
column2: procedure and objectives must be considered if you are to get a true evaluation of the relative merits.

column1: You say that the foreign policy of the two Administrations is the same. I suppose that even the most violent critic would agree that it is well for us to have friends in the world
column2: to encourage them to oppose communism both in its external form and in its internal manifestations
column3: to promote trade in the world that would be mutually profitable between us and our friends (and it must be mutually profitable or it will dry up)
column4: and to attempt the promotion of peace in the world
column5: negotiating from a position of moral

column1: No matter what the party is in power
column2: it must perforce follow a program that is related to these general purposes and aspirations. But the great difference is in how it is done and
column3: particularly

column1: A year ago last January we were in imminent danger of losing Iran
column2: and sixty percent of the known oil reserves of the world.7 You may have forgotten this. Lots of people have. But there has been no greater threat that has in recent years overhung the free world. That threat has been largely
column3: if not totally
column4: removed. I could name at least a half dozen other spots of the same character.

column1: This being true
column2: how can anyone be so unaware of what is happening as to say that this Administration has conducted foreign affairs under the same policies as did the former Administration? As a matter of fact
column3: if you will press any individual who brings to you all these strictures and comments
column4: I venture that your experience will be the same as mine. That experience is that these individuals have no idea of what the ""foreign policy"" of the previous Administration was and what the present one is. They have heard certain slogans
column5: such as ""give away programs."" They have no slightest idea as to what has been the effect of these programs in sustaining American security and prosperity. Moreover
column6: they have no idea whatsoever as to comparative size of them now as compared to even two or three years ago.

column1: You say that these critics also complain about the continuance of ""controls
column2: presumably over our economy. There is nothing in your letter that shows such complete ignorance as to what has actually happened as does this term. When we came into office there were Federal controls exercised over prices
column3: wages
column5: as well as over the allocation and use of raw materials. The first thing this Administration did was to set about the elimination of those controls. This it did amid the most dire predictions of disaster
column7: and so on and so on. We were proved right
column8: but I must say that if the people of the United States do not even remember what took place
column9: one is almost tempted to regret the agony of study
column10: analysis and decision that was then our daily ration.

column1: You also talk about ""bad political advice"" I am getting. I always assumed that lawyers attempted accuracy in their statements. How do you know that I am getting any political advice? Next
column2: if I do get political advice
column3: how do you know that it is not weighted in the direction that you seem to think it should be--although I am tempted at times to believe that you are just thrashing around rather than thinking anything through to a definite conclusion? So how can you say I am getting ""bad"" advice; why don't you just assume I am stupid
column5: and leave our Constitution in tatters?

column1: I assure you that you have more reason
column2: based on sixty-four years of contact
column3: to say this than you do to make the bland assumption that I am surrounded by a group of Machiavellian characters who are seeking the downfall of the United States and the ascendancy of socialism and communism in the world. Incidentally
column4: I notice that everybody seems to be a great Constitutionalist until his idea of what the Constitution ought to do is violated--then he suddenly becomes very strong for amendments or some peculiar and individualistic interpretation of his own.

column1: Finally
column2: I must assure you again that I am delighted to get your own honest criticisms
column3: particularly if you will only take the trouble to lay down the facts on which you reach what seem to me to be some remarkable conclusions. But the mere repetition of aphorisms and political slogans and newspaper headlines leaves me cold.

column1: I am sorry you are not going to be at Abilene.8 It would be easier to tell you these things than to write them--except that by this method I hope to make you do a little thinking rather than devote yourself just to the winning of a noisy argument. As ever
P.S. I attach a paragraph and a cartoon that came to me in the same mail as did your letter. At least it represents a different viewpoint. Incidentally
column2: it comes from one of the most successful businessmen in the nation.9"	Presidential Papers
column3: Doc#1147 Personal and confidential To Edgar Newton Eisenhower
column4: 8 November 1954. In The Papers of Dwight David Eisenhower		[]	['supreme'

column1: In an unusual bid to quit smoking
column2: a 42-year-old man in the western province of Kütahya has begun wearing a helmet-like wire cage on his head
column3: locked on two sides.İbrahim Yücel
column4: who is trying to kick a 26-year habit of smoking two packets of cigarettes per day
column5: gives the keys of his head cage to his wife and daughter when he leaves home every day. In this way
column6: he is unable to open the cage to smoke during the day
column7: even if he craves a smoke.He says he was inspired to create the helmet-like head cage by observing motorcycle helmets
column8: after trying without success to quit smoking several times in the past. His father died of lung cancer caused by smoking some years ago.Since donning the head cage two days ago
column9: Yücel has not smoked a single cigarette.At first shocked by the extraordinary contraption
column10: his family now supports Yücel's determined bid to stop smoking."	Turkish man wears helmet-like head cage to quit smoking		[]	['yücel'

column1: https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/we-stand-by-you/	u.s. naval officer's letter describes a 'manning the rails' ceremony performed by a german destroyer.	true	['9/11 attacks']	2001/11/09	David Mikkelson	['http://web.archive.org/web/20011008091129/http://www.chinfo.navy.mil/navpalib/news/news_stories/pentstruck19.html']	http://web.archive.org/web/20011008091129/http://www.chinfo.navy.mil/navpalib/news/news_stories/pentstruck19.html	http://web.archive.org/	"Washington
column2: D.C.
column3: Sept. 26
column4: 2001 — More than two weeks have passed since the Sept. 11 terrorist attack on the World Trade Center and the Pentagon. Reaction to the attacks and expressions of support for the United States continue to be received.

column1: What follows is a first-person account of a day at sea aboard one of the Navy's newest guided missile destroyers
column2: USS Winston S. Churchill (DDG 81) in the days following the attacks. This account was in an e-mail sent home by one of Churchill's officers.

column1: We have seen the articles and the photographs [of the attacks]
column2: and they are sickening. Being isolated as we are
column3: I don't think we appreciate the full scope of what is happening back home
column4: but we are definitely feeling the effects.

column1: About two hours ago the junior officers were called to the bridge to conduct Shiphandling drills. We were about to do a man overboard when we got a call from Lutjens (D 185)
column2: a German warship that was moored ahead of us on the pier in Plymouth
column3: England.

column1: While in port
column2: Winston S. Churchill and Lutjens got together for a sports day/cookout on our fantail
column3: and we made some pretty good friends. Now at sea they called over on bridge-to-bridge
column4: requesting to pass us close up on our port side
column5: to say goodbye. We prepared to render them honors on the bridge wing
column6: and the captain told the crew to come topside to wish them farewell.

column1: As they were making their approach
column2: our conning officer ... announced that they were flying an American flag. As they came even closer
column3: we saw that it was flying at half-mast. The bridge wing was crowded with people as the Boatswain's Mate blew two whistles — Attention to Port.""

column1: Lutjens ""came up alongside and we saw that the entire crew of the German ship were manning the rails
column2: in their dress blues. They had made up a sign that was displayed on the side that read ""We Stand By You"". Needless to say there was not a dry eye on the bridge as they stayed alongside us for a few minutes and we cut our salutes. It was probably the most powerful thing I have seen in my entire life and more than a few of us fought to retain our composure.

column1: It was a beautiful day outside today. We are no longer at liberty to divulge over unsecure e-mail our location
column2: but we could not have asked for a finer day at sea. The German Navy did an incredible thing for this crew
column3: and it has truly been the highest point in the days since the attacks. It's amazing to think that only a half-century ago things were quite different
column4: and to see the unity that is being demonstrated throughout Europe and the world makes us all feel proud to be out here doing our job.

column1: After [Lutjens] pulled away and we prepared to begin our man overboard drills
column2: the Officer of the Deck turned to me and said ""I'm staying Navy.""

column1: DDG 81 is named in honor of Sir Winston Spencer Churchill (1874-1965)
column2: best known for his courageous leadership as British prime minister during World War II.

column1: Back in Washington
column2: D.C.
column3: in its daily accounting Monday
column4: the Department of Defense has listed a total of 34 Navy personnel — 15 officers
column6: four DoN civilians and two contractors — have been confirmed killed in the Sept. 11 attack on the Pentagon by terrorists. The Navy personnel are part of the approximately 125 persons killed or unaccounted for as listed by the Department of Defense.

column1: As recovered
column2: remains are being transported to the Department of Defense mortuary at Dover Air Force Base
column3: Del.
column4: where they will be formally identified. To date
column6: search and rescue continue at the Pentagon.

column2: 'Aci'
column3: 'Technology Integration'

column1: https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/final-reward/	charles ramsey said that the captive women he helped rescue
column2: and not he
column3: should receive a reward.	true	[]		David Mikkelson	['http://cnnpressroom.blogs.cnn.com/2013/05/07/transcript-video-charles-ramsey-ac360-exclusive-invu/']	http://cnnpressroom.blogs.cnn.com/2013/05/07/transcript-video-charles-ramsey-ac360-exclusive-invu/	http://cnnpressroom.blogs.cnn.com/	"EXCLUSIVE: Anderson Cooper interview with Charles Ramsey

column1: Tonight on AC360°
column2: Charles Ramsey – the man who freed Amanda Berry
column3: Georgina DeJesus and Michele Knight

column1: Ramsey tells Cooper that his neighbor of about a year was “cool
column2: he was no freak of nature” but yesterday he heard a girl scream “like a car had hit her kid.” Amanda Berry told him “I’ve been trapped in here and he won’t let me out. It’s me and my baby.” Berry
column3: he tells Cooper “was well-groomed. She didn’t look like she was kidnapped… That’s what threw me off.”

column1: Ramsey says he doesn’t feel like a hero
column2: and when asked about a rumored reward
column3: he shows Cooper his paycheck and says “give it to them (the girls).”

column1: Video link to the interview and rough transcript below. Please credit all usage to Anderson Cooper 360°
THIS IS A RUSH FDCH TRANSCRIPT. IT MAY NOT BE IN ITS FINAL FORM AND MAY BE UPDATED.
COOPER: Well
column2: I just came back from interviewing Charles Ramsey just a short time ago. Here’s some of that interview.

column1: (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)
COOPER: And so you moved in about a year ago. You’d seen Ariel Castro around
column2: right?

column1: CHARLES RAMSEY: When I moved there
column2: only because he was my neighbor.

column1: COOPER: Right.
RAMSEY: You know what I mean?
COOPER: What was he like?
RAMSEY: Cool. He wasn’t no freak of nature. He was like me and you
column2: because he talked about the same things you talk about.

column1: COOPER: Right.
RAMSEY: You talk about you. You know what I mean? You know
column2: regular stuff
column3: bro.

column1: COOPER: So yesterday
column2: what happened?

column1: RAMSEY: I’m going to tell it all. Around 3:00
column2: I was on my porch and the mailman put his mail in my mail. I looked at it like here’s his mail when he come home. Couple of minutes later
column3: he pulled up. He checked the mailbox
column4: grabbed his paper. Before he went in the house

column1: https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/schools-removing-analog-clocks/	schools are removing analog clocks because students no longer know how to tell time.	mostly false	['']	2018/05/08	Kim LaCapria	['https://www.telegraph.co.uk/education/2018/04/24/schools-removing-analogue-clocks-exam-halls-teenagers-unable/']	https://www.telegraph.co.uk/education/2018/04/24/schools-removing-analogue-clocks-exam-halls-teenagers-unable/	https://www.telegraph.co.uk/	"Schools are removing analogue clocks from examination halls because teenagers are unable to tell the time
column2: a head teachers’ union has said.

column1: Teachers are now installing digital devices after pupils sitting their GCSE and A-level exams complained that they were struggling to read the correct time on an analogue clock.
Malcolm Trobe
column2: deputy general secretary at the Association of School and College Leaders (ASCL)
column3: said youngsters have become accustomed to using digital devices.

column1: “The current generation aren’t as good at reading the traditional clock face as older generations
column2: ” he told The Telegraph.

column1: “They are used to seeing a digital representation of time on their phone
column2: on their computer. Nearly everything they’ve got is digital so youngsters are just exposed to time being given digitally everywhere.”

column1: Mr Trobe
column2: a former headmaster
column3: said that teachers want their students to feel as relaxed as possible during exams. Having a traditional clock in the room could be a cause of unnecessary stress

column1: He said that schools are trying to make everything as “as easy and straightforward as possible” for pupils during their exams.
“You don’t want them to put their hand up to ask how much time is left
column2: ” he said.

column1: “Schools will inevitably be doing their best to make young children feel as relaxed as the can be. There is actually a big advantage in using digital clocks in exam rooms because it is much less easy to mistake a time on a digital clock when you are working against time.”"	Schools are removing analogue clocks from exam halls as teenagers 'cannot tell the time'	2018-04-24 00:00:00	['Camilla Turner'

column1: https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/milk-bone-facebook-warning/	milk-bone dog treats cause cancer in one of every two dogs that eat them.	false	['']	2016/03/25	Kim LaCapria	['http://www.dogfoodadvisor.com/red-flag-ingredients/bha-in-dog-food/']	http://www.dogfoodadvisor.com/red-flag-ingredients/bha-in-dog-food/	http://www.dogfoodadvisor.com/	"Butylated hydroxyanisole — also known as BHA — is an antioxidant primarily used as a preservative in food
column2: animal feed
column3: cosmetics

column1: The National Toxicology Program of the Department of Health and Human Services warns that BHA is “reasonably anticipated to be a human carcinogen” (cancer-causing agent) .
According to the National Institute of Health
column2: BHA in the diet has been found to consistently produce certain types of tumors in laboratory animals .

column1: And the Office of Environmental Health Hazard Assessment of the state of California lists BHA under “Chemicals Known to the State to Cause Cancer or Reproductive Toxicity”.
Yet FDA regulations still permit its use as a fat preservative in food under the assumption it is “generally recognized as safe” in low doses .
Why BHA Matters
Here’s what concerns me. Dogs are a captive audience. They have no choice but to eat what we put in front of them.
The same potentially toxic substance added to a commercial dog food – and fed every day (twice a day) year after year is a different matter.
It’s that cumulative exposure that worries me. The additive effect of using any artificial preservative relentlessly — especially when it’s suspected of causing cancer.
Even though they may not remain as effective for as long
column2: natural preservatives are considered to be safer.

column1: That’s why today
column2: the majority of dog food companies avoid the use of these synthetic “shelf-life extenders” altogether — and why you should
column3: too.

column1: When you read on a pet food label a particular fat ingredient has been “preserved with BHA”
column2: you may want to stand aside.

column1: There’s probably a safer alternative dog food within easy reach.
Footnotes"	A Time Bomb in Dog Food?	2009-07-26 21:23:04+00:00	[]	['health'
