column3: VeggieTales Finally Introduces New Cannabis Character

column1: GLENDALE
column2: CA—VeggieTales creators are celebrating the legalization of recreational cannabis use with a new character
column3: Cannabis Carl. The character is a sign of the progress the United States has made on its views on the controversial plant. “Kids are ready for this
column5: who is overseeing production on the current series.

column1: In his inaugural episode
column2: Cannabis Carl will be at the border to the VeggieTales house property
column3: trying to cross over to start a new life
column4: only to be met by Pa Grape who is out patrolling for illegal vegetables. After Pa Grape puts Carl in custody for being an illegal plant
column5: Mayor Archibald passes a new law that Cannabis Carl is a legal citizen. Carl is welcomed by the Veggie Cast as they sing a song about old laws and new covenants
column6: drawing a powerful parallel from scripture that is easy for kids to understand. As the episode ends
column7: Cannabis Carl helps Mayor Archibald cure glaucoma in his right eye and ends up becoming roommates with Mr. Lunt
column8: buying snacks at Pa Grape’s store and living off of the town’s generous food stamp program.

column1: “Mike and I have had this character in our back pockets since college
column2: ” Phil Vischer said at a press conference. “America wasn’t ready for Cannabis Carl then
column3: but they’ve finally come around.” Mike Nawrocki
column4: the voice of Larry the Cucumber also commented with a long
column6: high-pitched giggle. His eyes appeared red.

column1: Vischer and Narwocki say they have more characters in store for when all drugs become legalized
column2: including a wizard mushroom named Morlock. “Bible college was a pretty crazy time for us
column3: but eventually God uses all things to his glory

column1: The new episode featuring Cannabis Carl will be released on the newest Netfix VeggieTales series titled “VeggieTales In the Haze.” Cannabis Carl will debut with his song “God Made All The Plants
column2: Dude” and will be voiced by actor and director Kevin Smith
column3: who is a devout Christian.

column1: Breaking: Paypal Now Available Many of you told us you wouldn't subscribe until we offered Paypal as a payment option. You apparently weren't bluffing
column2: so we finally caved and added Paypal. Now — like the unbeliever faced with God's invisible qualities displayed in nature — you are without excuse. Subscribe"	Thanks To New Laws

column1: https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/the-road-to-dell/	dell computer cancelled an order placed by weigand combat handguns because the company name triggered a security alert.	true.	['Moral Outrage']		David Mikkelson	['http://web.archive.org/web/20020305222533/http://www.jackweigand.com/Dell.html']	http://web.archive.org/web/20020305222533/http://www.jackweigand.com/Dell.html	http://web.archive.org/	"Updated 3/02/02
Please view updates at the bottom of the page.
Addressing the Dell Issue. 2/26/02
This is the letter I posted in a few Firearms Forums and sent via e mail.
This is a true account of my dealings with Dell over the past few weeks.
I am writing this because I feel every Firearms owner should know
this story.
I placed an order for a Dell notebook computer on February 13 on line
with Dell. I was given a tentative delivery date of February 21st. I
was watching the order through the Dell on line tracking system; I
also opted for the automatic email notification of when the machine
was to be shipped. Well the 21st came and went
column2: I am a Pistolsmith I

column1: know things can happen. I made a phone call on the 25th
column2: did a

column1: voice mail message for my salesman to get back to me and I was
looking for the delivery date. The 25th came and went with no
callback. On the 26th I placed another call this time to cancel the
order. After a few hours I got a call back
column2: with this amazing reason

column1: for the delay. It seems someone in Dell had already canceled my
order
column2: when I asked why I was told Dell was afraid I was going to

column1: use the machine for illegal purposes. When I asked why someone
would think that I was told it was because of the name of my
business Weigand Combat Handguns Inc.. Because I am involved in
firearms I might be doing something illegal. Now keep in mind I was
never called or informed of this decision the order was just canceled.
Many of you know me personally and know I run my business about
as squeaky clean as possible. In addition being the President of the
American Pistolsmiths Guild I am under additional scrutiny as to how I
run my business
column2: if I am not clean how can I be the President of an

column1: organization that promotes just that! I was informed by a Dell
supervisor not long after all of this the reason I was refused was
because of their post September 11th policy of screening buyers.
I would like to respectfully ask the firearms community to do the
following. If you intended to buy a Dell and because of this letter you
do not
column2: email Dell and let them know why. Feel free to distribute this

column1: account to all you know in the Firearms community
column2: I think they need

column1: to know. I for one am sick and tired of people assuming just because
we are involved with firearms that we are doing something illegal. I
also do not believe Dell deserves our business if this is how they
intend to treat us.
God Bless
Jack Weigand
President
American Pistolsmiths Guild Inc.
The above is the only letter I have written. I have written comments on email I have received (that number is now in the hundreds). I would like to add the following.
I have spoken to Dell today 2/26/02
They informed me that the reason my order was cancelled was due to the new post 9/11 screening policy. The word

Combat"" in my company name is what triggered the cancellation of my order. The cancellation was triggered automatically. When I asked why I was not called to clear this up I was told there was a breakdown in communications on Dells part.
Just for the record so everyone knows where I stand.
I have no intention of further dealings with Dell
column2: they don't deserve my business.

column1: I want nothing from Dell but I would gladly accept an apology to the Firearms community in general.
I posted this expressly to warn firearms owners of Dell policies PERIOD.

There are those that think I did this to generate traffic to my web site. All this traffic just made it hard for my customers to shop this evening. If you will notice there are no advertisements on my web so traffic is not a factor. It has also generated hundreds of email that I personally answered. Just so you all know I am not smart enough to do a publicity stunt of this magnitude on purpose
column2: LOL!

column1: I would humbly request the following.
Please
column2: please refrain from making personal attacks on Michael Dell. I have received hundreds of e mails attacking Mr. Dell
column3: please do not do this. I know we are all passionate about our right to keep and bear arms but please be as professional as possible.

column1: I thank all of those that took the time to confirm that this story was true before spreading it
column2: you all are to be commended!

column1: Update 2/27/02
After fielding hundreds of emails and dozens of phone calls today my heart felt thanks to all who responded.
I was contacted by a Dell representative this morning a Mr. John Hood. John made the following remarks.
He extended Dells sincerest apologies for the incident.
He said Dell would review and possibly change the screening policies to prevent this from happening again.
Dell offered to ship the machine I ordered to me at no charge
column2: I respectfully declined the offer.

column1: John told me he would have a statement sent to me sometime Thursday morning the 28th stating Dells position on this issue for me to post here for all to see.
I will post the statement as soon as I receive it.
2/28/02 Update Statement from Dell
To Our Valued Customers and Friends:
U.S. export laws restrict the sale of technology to terrorists and to people
in countries that support terrorism. These laws also prohibit computer sales
to people who will use the technology in developing biological or nuclear
weapons. Dell strictly complies with our country's export laws in order to
ensure the safety of our customers and citizens around the world. When there
is reasonable cause for concern
column2: we carefully review customer orders for

column1: prohibited destinations and activities.
When additional follow-up on an order is required
column2: our sales representatives

column1: ask our customers four basic questions:
1. Who is the end-user?
2. Where will the product be used?
3. What will the product be used for?
4. What type of business or industry is involved?
The answers to these questions
column2: like all customer information we gather
column3: are

column1: confidential and are not shared outside of Dell.
We recently received an order from Mr. Jack Weigand
column2: whose company name

column1: Weigand's Combat Handguns Inc."" included the word ""combat."" We cancelled
the order to give us enough time to follow up with the customer and be
assured that the sale would be in compliance with U.S. export law. However
we failed to contact Mr. Weigand
column2: and as a result
column3: we did not deliver the

column1: order as promised
column2: and the customer did not know why. Once we discovered our

column1: error
column2: we apologized to Mr. Weigand for this misunderstanding
column3: as well as

column1: the inconvenience caused by the delay. This is not the service standard that
we hold ourselves to at Dell.
We at Dell feel a strong obligation to uphold our federal law
column2: but we have

column1: just as strong an obligation to be responsive to the needs of all our
customers. We want to assure you that the company does not discriminate
against any business
column2: regardless of the products or services they sell
column3: nor

column1: do we discriminate against individual consumers. We do
column2: however
column3: sometimes

column1: make mistakes - as we did in this case.
Thank you for your support.
Sincerely
Dell Computer Corporation

column1: By Orson Scott Card October 5
Would the Last Honest Reporter Please Turn On the Lights?
An open letter to the local daily paper -- almost every local daily paper in America:
I remember reading All the President's Men and thinking: That's journalism. You do what it takes to get the truth and you lay it before the public
column2: because the public has a right to know.

column1: This housing crisis didn't come out of nowhere. It was not a vague emanation of the evil Bush administration.
It was a direct result of the political decision
column2: back in the late 1990s
column3: to loosen the rules of lending so that home loans would be more accessible to poor people. Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac were authorized to approve risky loans.

column1: What is a risky loan? It's a loan that the recipient is likely not to be able to repay.

The goal of this rule change was to help the poor -- which especially would help members of minority groups. But how does it help these people to give them a loan that they can't repay? They get into a house
column2: yes
column3: but when they can't make the payments
column4: they lose the house -- along with their credit rating.

column1: They end up worse off than before.
This was completely foreseeable and in fact many people did foresee it. One political party
column2: in Congress and in the executive branch
column3: tried repeatedly to tighten up the rules. The other party blocked every such attempt and tried to loosen them.

column1: Furthermore
column2: Freddie Mac and Fannie Mae were making political contributions to the very members of Congress who were allowing them to make irresponsible loans. (Though why quasi-federal agencies were allowed to do so baffles me. It's as if the Pentagon were allowed to contribute to the political campaigns of Congressmen who support increasing their budget.)

column1: Isn't there a story here? Doesn't journalism require that you who produce our daily paper tell the truth about who brought us to a position where the only way to keep confidence in our economy was a $700 billion bailout? Aren't you supposed to follow the money and see which politicians were benefitting personally from the deregulation of mortgage lending?
I have no doubt that if these facts had pointed to the Republican Party or to John McCain as the guilty parties
column2: you would be treating it as a vast scandal. ""Housing-gate
column3: no doubt. Or ""Fannie-gate.""

column1: Instead
column2: it was Senator Christopher Dodd and Congressman Barney Frank
column3: both Democrats
column4: who denied that there were any problems
column5: who refused Bush administration requests to set up a regulatory agency to watch over Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac
column6: and who were still pushing for these agencies to go even further in promoting subprime mortgage loans almost up to the minute they failed.

column1: As Thomas Sowell points out in a TownHall.com essay entitled Do Facts Matter? ""Alan Greenspan warned them four years ago. So did the Chairman of the Council of Economic Advisers to the President. So did Bush's Secretary of the Treasury.""

These are facts. This financial crisis was completely preventable. The party that blocked any attempt to prevent it was ... the Democratic Party. The party that tried to prevent it was ... the Republican Party.
Yet when Nancy Pelosi accused the Bush administration and Republican deregulation of causing the crisis
column2: you in the press did not hold her to account for her lie. Instead
column3: you criticized Republicans who took offense at this lie and refused to vote for the bailout!

column1: What? It's not the liar
column2: but the victims of the lie who are to blame?

column1: Now let's follow the money ... right to the presidential candidate who is the number-two recipient of campaign contributions from Fannie Mae.
And after Franklin Raines
column2: the CEO of Fannie Mae who made $90 million while running it into the ground
column3: was fired for his incompetence
column4: one presidential candidate's campaign actually consulted him for advice on housing.

column1: If that presidential candidate had been John McCain
column2: you would have called it a major scandal and we would be getting stories in your paper every day about how incompetent and corrupt he was.

column1: But instead
column2: that candidate was Barack Obama
column3: and so you have buried this story
column4: and when the McCain campaign dared to call Raines an ""adviser"" to the Obama campaign -- because that campaign had sought his advice -- you actually let Obama's people get away with accusing McCain of lying
column5: merely because Raines wasn't listed as an official adviser to the Obama campaign.

column1: You would never tolerate such weasely nit-picking from a Republican.
If you who produce our local daily paper actually had any principles
column2: you would be pounding this story
column3: because the prosperity of all Americans was put at risk by the foolish
column6: and possibly corrupt actions of leading Democrats

column1: If you who produce our local daily paper had any personal honor
column2: you would find it unbearable to let the American people believe that somehow Republicans were to blame for this crisis.

column1: There are precedents. Even though President Bush and his administration never said that Iraq sponsored or was linked to 9/11
column2: you could not stand the fact that Americans had that misapprehension -- so you pounded us with the fact that there was no such link. (Along the way
column3: you created the false impression that Bush had lied to them and said that there was a connection.)

column1: If you had any principles
column2: then surely right now
column3: when the American people are set to blame President Bush and John McCain for a crisis they tried to prevent
column4: and are actually shifting to approve of Barack Obama because of a crisis he helped cause
column5: you would be laboring at least as hard to correct that false impression.

column1: Your job
column2: as journalists
column3: is to tell the truth. That's what you claim you do
column4: when you accept people's money to buy or subscribe to your paper.

column1: But right now
column2: you are consenting to or actively promoting a big fat lie -- that the housing crisis should somehow be blamed on Bush
column3: McCain
column4: and the Republicans. You have trained the American people to blame everything bad -- even bad weather -- on Bush
column5: and they are responding as you have taught them to.

column1: If you had any personal honor
column2: each reporter and editor would be insisting on telling the truth -- even if it hurts the election chances of your favorite candidate.

column1: Because that's what honorable people do. Honest people tell the truth even when they don't like the probable consequences. That's what honesty means. That's how trust is earned.
Barack Obama is just another politician
column2: and not a very wise one. He has revealed his ignorance and naivete time after time -- and you have swept it under the rug
column3: treated it as nothing.

column1: Meanwhile
column2: you have participated in the borking of Sarah Palin
column3: reporting savage attacks on her for the pregnancy of her unmarried daughter -- while you ignored the story of John Edwards's own adultery for many months.

column1: So I ask you now: Do you have any standards at all? Do you even know what honesty means?
Is getting people to vote for Barack Obama so important that you will throw away everything that journalism is supposed to stand for?

You might want to remember the way the National Organization of Women threw away their integrity by supporting Bill Clinton despite his well-known pattern of sexual exploitation of powerless women. Who listens to NOW anymore? We know they stand for nothing; they have no principles.
That's where you are right now.
It's not too late. You know that if the situation were reversed
column2: and the truth would damage McCain and help Obama
column3: you would be moving heaven and earth to get the true story out there.

column1: If you want to redeem your honor
column2: you will swallow hard and make a list of all the stories you would print if it were McCain who had been getting money from Fannie Mae
column3: McCain whose campaign had consulted with its discredited former CEO
column4: McCain who had voted against tightening its lending practices.

column1: Then you will print them
column2: even though every one of those true stories will point the finger of blame at the reckless Democratic Party
column3: which put our nation's prosperity at risk so they could feel good about helping the poor
column4: and lay a fair share of the blame at Obama's door.

column1: You will also tell the truth about John McCain: that he tried
column2: as a Senator
column3: to do what it took to prevent this crisis. You will tell the truth about President Bush: that his administration tried more than once to get Congress to regulate lending in a responsible way.

column1: This was a Congress-caused crisis
column2: beginning during the Clinton administration
column3: with Democrats leading the way into the crisis and blocking every effort to get out of it in a timely fashion.

column1: If you at our local daily newspaper continue to let Americans believe --and vote as if -- President Bush and the Republicans caused the crisis
column2: then you are joining in that lie.

column1: If you do not tell the truth about the Democrats -- including Barack Obama -- and do so with the same energy you would use if the miscreants were Republicans -- then you are not journalists by any standard.
You're just the public relations machine of the Democratic Party
column2: and it's time you were all fired and real journalists brought in
column3: so that we can actually have a daily newspaper in our city.

https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/generals-controversial-graduation-speech/	a commencement speech by the commanding officer of fort benning touched off riots that killed 11 people.	false	[]		David Mikkelson	['http://www.duffelblog.com/2012/07/general-gives-controversial-graduation-speech-riot-ensues/']	http://www.duffelblog.com/2012/07/general-gives-controversial-graduation-speech-riot-ensues/	http://www.duffelblog.com/	"SAND HILL
column2: Fort Benning
column3: Ga. — Many soldiers and family members are angry over reports of controversial remarks from the Commanding Officer of Fort Benning at a recruit graduation.

column1: Speaking to an assembled crowd of new soldiers and their families at basic training graduation
column2: Maj. Gen. Robert Brown was reported as “extremely hostile.”

column1: His speech began with the “standard fluff” about duty
column2: country
column3: and the privileges of serving when such a small percentage of the country chooses a career in the Armed Forces. The speech took a turn
column5: when the General reached a point in his remarks

column1: “Look to your left and right towards your brothers in arms
column2: ” said Brown. “You’re all now members of a proud warrior class
column3: and heroes like your fathers before you who-”

column1: The General stopped
column2: took a deep breath and crumpled the sheet before flinging it to the ground.

column1: “Fuck it! I can’t read shit like this anymore. Listen up you little bald bastards.”
The newly minted soldiers — trying to stay awake throughout the ceremony — shifted uncomfortably in their seats at the sudden change in tone.

“Some of you fucks won’t make it past AIT [Advanced Individual Training]. You’ll wash out with the rest of the weakness that never should have been here in the first place. Most of you who do graduate will immediately go to combat units and deploy overseas. Many of you will threaten to kill yourselves to get out of real work
column2: although you wont have the balls to actually do it!”

column1: Brown’s tone got softer as he attempted to clarify.

“Don’t get me wrong here. Many of you will actually go fight and engage the enemy in close combat. For that I salute you. It takes a hard motherfucker to go kill people you’ve never met just because we say so.”
The General then resumes his “motivational speech” to what he referred to as “the rest of you shit-stains.”
“You’ll most likely spend your deployment sitting on a FOB
column2: manning guard towers
column3: or waiting to go on patrols that get cancelled. I have a reality check for you all. Not everyone in this room is a hero. I don’t give a shit what the beer commercials say. You drag your buddy out of a grape hut after you’ve stabbed two Taliban in the eyes with a broken MRE spoon then you’re a motherfucking American Hero. You clear a trench with nothing but a sack of hand-grenades and your giant brass balls
column4: then you’re a motherfucking hero! But walking through the desert for three months without hearing a shot fired in anger and posting pictures in your combat gear doesn’t make you a goddamned hero! I don’t care what your family says. They’re not heroes. Neither are your fucking wives. Hardest job in the Army
column6: I’m too old for this shit. Fuck you all.”

column1: Gen. Brown then threw up his middle finger to the crowd and stormed off the stage
column2: hustling into his waiting staff car.

column1: The silence after his speech was soon broken by wild applause from the assembled Drill Sergeants and Officers responsible for training the young soldiers over the previous ten weeks.
Less enthusiasm was displayed by the families and the new graduates
column2: who stormed the stage and attempted to destroy the auditorium to express their displeasure. The ensuing riot caused over a half-million dollars in damage
column3: and Drill Sergeants were forced to kill 11 Privates in self-defense.

column1: An Army spokesman has said that General Brown will not be scheduled as the keynote speaker for next week’s graduation ceremony."	General’s Controversial Graduation Speech Sparks Riots

https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/dust-in-the-solar-wind/	a planetdissolving dust cloud will wipe out our solar system in december 2014.	false	[]		David Mikkelson	['https://web.archive.org/web/20051003215234/http://movies.yahoo.com/mv/news/wwn/20050912/112653720013.html']	https://web.archive.org/web/20051003215234/http://movies.yahoo.com/mv/news/wwn/20050912/112653720013.html	https://web.archive.org/	"All Weekly World News Stories More from Weekly World News  Subscribe to WWN
 This week's Page 5 Girl
 WWN Web Guide PLANET-DISSOLVING DUST CLOUD IS HEADED TOWARD EARTH!
Monday September 12
By MIKE FOSTER
CAMBRIDGE
column2: Mass. -- Scared-stiff astronomers have detected a mysterious mass they've dubbed a ""chaos cloud"" that dissolves everything in its path
column3: including comets
column5: planets and entire stars -- and it's headed directly toward Earth!

column1: Discovered April 6 by NASA's Chandra X-ray Observatory
column2: the swirling
column3: 10 million-mile- wide cosmic dust cloud has been likened to an ""acid nebula"" and is hurtling toward us at close to the speed of light -- making its estimated time of arrival 9:15 a.m. EDT on June 1

column1: The good news is that this finding confirms several cutting- edge ideas in theoretical physics
column2: announced Dr. Albert Sherwinski
column3: a Cambridge based astrophysicist with close ties to NASA.

column1: The bad news is that the total annihilation of our solar system is imminent.""

Experts believe the chaos cloud is composed of particles spawned near the event horizon of a black hole (a form of what's called Hawking Radiation) that have been distorted by mangled information spewed from the hole.
A super-massive black hole lies about 28
column2: 000 light-years from Earth at the center of our galaxy
column3: explained Dr. Sherwinski.

column1: Last year the eminent physicist Stephen Hawking revised his theory of black holes -- which previously held that nothing could escape the hole's powerful gravitational field. He demonstrated that information about objects that have been sucked in can be emitted in mangled form.
It now appears that mangled information can distort matter.
Just imagine our galaxy the Milky Way as a beautiful
column2: handwritten letter.

column1: Now imagine pouring a glass of water on the paper and watching the words dissolve as the stain spreads. That's what the chaos cloud does to every star or planet it encounters.""
To avoid widespread panic
column2: NASA has declined to make the alarming discovery public. But Dr. Sherwinski's contacts at the agency's Chandra X-ray Observatory leaked to him striking images of the newly discovered chaos cloud obliterating a large asteroid.

column1: It's like watching a helpless hog being dissolved in a vat of acid
column2: one NASA scientist told Dr. Sherwinski.

column1: Ordinarily
column2: Hawkings Radiation is harmless.

column1: It's produced when an electron- positron pair are at the event horizon of a black hole
column2: Dr. Sherwinski explained. ""The intense curvature of space-time of the hole can cause the positron to fall in
column3: while the electron escapes.""

column1: But when ""infected"" by mangled information from the black hole
column2: the particles become a chaos cloud
column3: which in turn mangles everything it touches.

column1: If it continues unchecked
column2: the chaos cloud will eventually reduce our galaxy to the state of absolute chaos that existed before the birth of the universe
column3: the astrophysicist warned.

column1: Some scientists say mankind's best hope would be to build a ""space ark"" and hightail it to the Andromeda Galaxy
column2: 2.1 million light-years away.

column1: We wouldn't be able to save the entire human population
column2: but perhaps the best and the brightest
column3: observed British rocket scientist Dr. David Hall
column4: when asked about the feasibility of such a project.

column1: But even if such a craft could be built in time
column2: evacuating Earth might prove fruitless if theories about the origin of the chaos cloud are correct.

column1: A black hole at the center of Andromeda is about 15 times the size of the one in our own galaxy
column2: Dr. Sherwinski noted. ""It might be like jumping out of the frying pan into the fire.""

column1: Speaking under the condition of anonymity
column2: a senior White House official said the president's top science advisors are taking the findings in stride.

column1: This is a lot like global warming
column2: where the jury is still out on whether it's real or not
column3: said the official.

column1: The existence of this so called chaos cloud is only a theory. Americans shouldn't panic until all the facts are in.""

column1: A super-massive black hole lies about 28

column2: 'https://www.richmond.com/news/biden-we-need-to-finish-what-obama-started/article_54957b91-07f2-50f2-a964-7ad869c070d9.html'
column3: 'https://www.cbsnews.com/news/rangel-bidens-gaffe-was-clearly-about-slavery/'
column5: 'https://wtvr.com/2012/08/16/doug-wilder-on-joe-biden/']	https://thecaucus.blogs.nytimes.com/2012/08/14/biden-warns-romney-policies-would-put-crowd-back-in-chains/	https://thecaucus.blogs.nytimes.com/	"Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. created a stir Tuesday at a campaign speech in Virginia when he told the crowd that Mitt Romney’s policies would enable the banking and financial sectors to “put you all back in chains.”

column1: The remark came roughly two-thirds of the way through Mr. Biden’s 30-minute speech
column2: which was delivered to a crowd that included many African-Americans at the Institute for Advanced Learning and Research in Danville
column3: Va.

column1: “Romney wants to let the — he said in the first hundred days
column2: he’s going to let the big banks once again write their own rules
column3: unchain Wall Street
column4: ” Mr. Biden said. “They’re going to put you all back in chains.”

column1: On a C-Span video of the speech
column2: the audience does not appear to react negatively to Mr. Biden’s phrasing; indeed
column3: laughter can be heard among the crowd.

column1: President Obama and his surrogates have been campaigning heavily in Virginia
column2: and the campaign’s strategy relies in part on energizing the black vote to take the traditionally Republican state
column3: which moved to the Democratic column in the 2008 presidential election. According to the Census
column4: the population of Danville is roughly 48.8 percent white and 48.6 percent black.

column1: After Mr. Biden’s address
column2: some Republicans assailed Mr. Biden’s remark. On Twitter
column3: Ari Fleischer
column4: a former press secretary for President George W. Bush
column5: likened the comment to one made by Sarah Palin when she compared critical press coverage to “blood libel
column6: ” a term alluding to the false allegation that Jews once killed Christian children to use their blood for religious rituals.

column1: “The press pounded Palin when she talked about ‘blood libel
column2: ’” Mr. Fleischer wrote. “What will they do about Biden’s ‘chains’ remark?”

column1: Later Tuesday
column2: both presidential campaigns responded to the vice president’s remarks
column3: with Mr. Romney’s campaign calling the phrasing “not acceptable.”

column1: “After weeks of slanderous and baseless accusations leveled against Governor Romney
column2: the Obama campaign has reached a new low
column3: ” Andrea Saul
column5: said in a statement. “The comments made by the vice president of the United States are not acceptable in our political discourse and demonstrate yet again that the Obama campaign will say and do anything to win this election. President Obama should tell the American people whether he agrees with Joe Biden’s comments.”

column1: In a statement
column2: Stephanie Cutter
column3: Mr. Obama’s deputy campaign manager

column1: “For months
column2: Speaker Boehner
column3: Congressman Ryan and other Republicans have called for the ‘unshackling’ of the private sector from regulations that protect Americans from risky financial deals and other reckless behavior that crashed our economy. Since then
column4: the vice president has often used a similar metaphor to describe the need to ‘unshackle’ the middle class. Today’s comments were a derivative of those remarks
column5: describing the devastating impact letting Wall Street write its own rules again would have on middle class families. We find the Romney campaign’s outrage over the vice president’s comments today hypocritical
column6: particularly in light of their own candidate’s stump speech questioning the president’s patriotism. Now
column7: let’s return to that ‘substantive’ debate Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan promised 72 hours ago

column1: As he concluded his speech
column2: Mr. Biden confused North Carolina with Virginia
column3: where Danville is located.

column1: “With you we can win North Carolina again
column2: and if we do
column3: we win the election if we win you

column1: The city of Danville abuts the northern border of North Carolina
column2: which also went for Mr. Obama in 2008 but is considered a more challenging state for his campaign this time around.

column1: At a second appearance on Tuesday
column2: in Wytheville
column3: Va.
column4: Mr. Biden said his remarks had merely alluded to a term used previously by Republicans
column6: Representative Paul D. Ryan. In his response to Mr. Obama’s State of the Union address in 2011
column8: “We believe a renewed commitment to limited government will unshackle our economy and create millions of new jobs and opportunities for all people

column1: “And I’m told that when I made that comment earlier today in Danville
column2: Va.
column3: the Romney campaign put out a tweet
column4: ” Mr. Biden told the crowd in Wytheville. “You know
column5: tweets these days? Put out a tweet
column9: ’ I think I said instead of ‘unshackled
column10: ’ ‘unchained.’ ‘Outrageous to say that.’ That’s what we had. I’m using their own words.”

column1: “I got a message for them
column2: ” Mr. Biden continued. “If you want to know what’s outrageous
column3: it’s their policies and the effects of their policies on middle-class America. That’s what’s outrageous.”

column1: Mr. Romney addressed Mr. Biden’s original remark in a speech Tuesday evening in Chillicothe
column2: Ohio
column3: calling it an indicator that Mr. Obama’s presidency had become “angry and desperate
column4: ” according to The Associated Press."	Biden Warns Romney Policies Would Put Crowd ‘Back in Chains’	2012-08-14 00:00:00	['Rebecca Berg']	['president'

column2: 'anti-abortion'
column3: 'bunker buster news'
column12: 2017 (LifeSiteNews) — The Australian company that says it has pioneered a process to make frozen human embyros into jewelry is facing backlash after a story on it went viral last week.

column1: Baby Bee Hummingbird
column2: started by midwife Amy McGlade in 2014
column3: has “crafted” 50 pieces of jewelry from “embryo straws
column5: making an “embryo ash” that can be preserved in resin
column6: according to a report in Kidspot.

column1: “I don’t believe there is any other business in the world that creates jewelry from human embryos
column2: and I firmly believe that we are pioneering the way in this sacred art
column3: and opening the possibilities to families around the world

column1: The jewelry costs “$80 to $600
column2: depending on the piece
column3: and can be sent worldwide.”

column1: The article featured couple Belinda and Shaun Stafford
column2: who used IVF to conceive a son
column3: now four
column4: and a twin boy and girl
column5: who are almost two. They didn’t know what to do with the seven frozen embryos they had left.

column1: “Donating our embryos wasn’t an option for us and I couldn’t justify the yearly storage fee
column2: ” Belinda told Kidspot. “I’d heard others had planted them in the garden
column3: but we move a lot

column1: So they opted to have the babies made into jewelry — in this case
column2: a heart-shaped pendant.

column1: “My embryos were my babies — frozen in time. When we completed our family
column2: it wasn’t in my heart to destroy them
column3: ” Belinda told Kidspot. “ Now they are forever with me in a beautiful keepsake.”

column1: Baby Bee Hummingbird’s Facebook page says it is “offering 15 percent off all Embryo Ashes Jewelry. We hope this will make the process more affordable & easier on families.”
It’s clear the company has been dealing with backlash from the Kidspot story.

Wesley Smith decried the practice in National Review as “illustrating the crassness of our age.” Matthew Archbold wrote in the National Catholic Register that he “had to read this headline twice (or three times) because I thought it had to be a twisted joke. Sadly
column2: it's not.”

column1: Added Archbold: “The more I read the more horrified I became.”

A post on Baby Bee Hummingbird’s Facebook last Wednesday said it was “taking a small break and going offline until tomorrow” after “a very draining 48 hours.” Two days later came the following response:
• t r u t h • l o v e • r e s p e c t • Truth • Many of you would be aware of the traumatic & soul destroying week we have endured. The truth is we have received thousands of vile
column2: cruel & unimaginable emails & messages. Death threats & hate have flooded our accounts ( & yes it will take a long time to delete & filter true enquiries ). Those that have chosen to spread hate are not our people. They are not the people we would create for. They are uneducated in our craft or the many reasons behind our "" why"". We have chosen not to respond to a single word. We will continue to ban & delete. It wouldn't help or ease their destructive paths. Those that know us & understand my passion for capturing all memories are our people - you are our beloved tribe & the reason I do what I do. We will not stop. Love • We always craft & create with love. It's simple. We follow our hearts & those that seek our service. Respect • We have literally built this business from the ground. We have sacrificed & given everything we have. We are respectful to those who opinions differ. We will not respond. We will create a safe place for ourselves & the families we create for. We invite you to join our • CLOSED GROUP • This will be a highly monitored
column3: nurturing & safe environment. We truly can't thank you all enough for your words of wisdom
column4: support & love. We hope you continue to follow our journey. As of Monday we will be back doing what we love ( with some help
column5: so we can quickly filter our mail ).

column1: Comments on the page defended the company’s “exclusive concept.”
Reads one post: “Unless you've been the IVF route SHUT YOUR UNEDUCATED MOUTH! If you've no part of this journey
column2: You don't know anything. You don't know
column3: Unless you live this horrific journey.”

column1: Says another: “It’s not a baby yet
column2: it's a bunch of cells. ... I'm also infertile and relied on donor eggs for me to have my family. …I personally would rather wear my embryo around my neck then it get thrown down the sink (because that's what happens believe it or not).”

column1: And another: “How do you get the embrio's? Would we have to give you permission? I'm interested as we have 6 frosties we are still paying storage for.”
According to Pope Saint John Paul II: “A person’s rightful due is to be treated as an object of love
column2: not as an object for use.”

column1: Ultimately
column2: IVF turns the human person
column3: made in the image and likeness of God

column1: The “problem is so evidently apparent and sickening that it’s hard to know where to start
column2: ” says Marie-Claire Bissonnette
column3: youth coordinator at Campaign Life Coalition.

column1: That parents would make jewelry from the human embryos they created by in vitro fertilization is “emotional
column2: narcissistic
column3: unnatural and utilitarian

column1: “There’s no consideration for the babies
column2: just how the parents feel. This is the antithesis of parenting: killing your children and using their bodies to create frivolous tokens in the name of ‘keeping them close
column3: ’” she added.

column1: “When I consider where we are as a culture and how confused we are
column2: in the end it really is so simple. Do we believe God created each and every human being? Do we believe life is sacred? Not just important. Sacred. Priceless
column3: ” wrote Archbold.

column1: “There are no good solutions in cases like these for what to do with frozen embryos. Even when one of those solutions is on sale
column2: ” he added.

column1: Healing “comes from Christ
column2: not a keepsake.”"	Company receives backlash for turning frozen embryos into ‘jewelry’		['Lianne Laurence'
column3: 'Follow Lianne']	['frozen'

column1: Murray Richman said Tuesday that the artist
column2: whose given name is Earl Simmons

column1: TO THE CONGRESS OF THE UNITED STATES:
Madam Speaker
column2: Mr. Vice President
column3: Members of Congress
column4: the First Lady of the United States

column1: We meet tonight at a moment of unlimited potential. As we begin a new Congress
column2: I stand here ready to work with you to achieve historic breakthroughs for all Americans.

column1: Millions of our fellow citizens are watching us now
column2: gathered in this great chamber
column3: hoping that we will govern not as two parties but as one Nation.

column1: The agenda I will lay out this evening is not a Republican agenda or a Democrat agenda. It is the agenda of the American people.

Many of us campaigned on the same core promises: to defend American jobs and demand fair trade for American workers; to rebuild and revitalize our Nation’s infrastructure; to reduce the price of healthcare and prescription drugs; to create an immigration system that is safe
column2: lawful
column3: modern and secure; and to pursue a foreign policy that puts America’s interests first.

column1: There is a new opportunity in American politics
column2: if only we have the courage to seize it. Victory is not winning for our party. Victory is winning for our country.

column1: This year
column2: America will recognize two important anniversaries that show us the majesty of America’s mission
column3: and the power of American pride.

column1: In June
column2: we mark 75 years since the start of what General Dwight D. Eisenhower called the Great Crusade — the Allied liberation of Europe in World War II. On D-Day
column3: June 6
column6: 000 young American men jumped from the sky
column8: 000 more stormed in from the sea
column9: to save our civilization from tyranny. Here with us tonight are three of those heroes: Private First Class Joseph Reilly

column2: we also celebrate 50 years since brave young pilots flew a quarter of a million miles through space to plant the American flag on the face of the moon. Half a century later
column3: we are joined by one of the Apollo 11 astronauts who planted that flag: Buzz Aldrin. This year
column4: American astronauts will go back to space on American rockets.

column1: In the 20th century
column2: America saved freedom
column3: transformed science
column4: and redefined the middle class standard of living for the entire world to see. Now
column5: we must step boldly and bravely into the next chapter of this great American adventure
column6: and we must create a new standard of living for the 21st century. An amazing quality of life for all of our citizens is within our reach.

column1: We can make our communities safer
column2: our families stronger
column3: our culture richer
column5: and our middle class bigger and more prosperous than ever before.

column1: But we must reject the politics of revenge
column2: resistance
column3: and retribution — and embrace the boundless potential of cooperation

column1: Together
column2: we can break decades of political stalemate. We can bridge old divisions
column3: heal old wounds
column6: and unlock the extraordinary promise of America’s future. The decision is ours to make.

column1: We must choose between greatness or gridlock
column2: results or resistance
column3: vision or vengeance

column1: Tonight
column2: I ask you to choose greatness.

column1: Over the last 2 years
column2: my Administration has moved with urgency and historic speed to confront problems neglected by leaders of both parties over many decades.

column1: In just over 2 years since the election
column2: we have launched an unprecedented economic boom — a boom that has rarely been seen before. We have created 5.3 million new jobs and importantly added 600
column3: 000 new manufacturing jobs — something which almost everyone said was impossible to do

column1: Wages are rising at the fastest pace in decades
column2: and growing for blue collar workers
column3: who I promised to fight for
column4: faster than anyone else. Nearly 5 million Americans have been lifted off food stamps. The United States economy is growing almost twice as fast today as when I took office
column5: and we are considered far and away the hottest economy anywhere in the world. Unemployment has reached the lowest rate in half a century. African-American
column6: Hispanic-American and Asian-American unemployment have all reached their lowest levels ever recorded. Unemployment for Americans with disabilities has also reached an all-time low. More people are working now than at any time in our history –- 157 million.

column1: We passed a massive tax cut for working families and doubled the child tax credit.
We virtually ended the estate
column2: or death
column3: tax on small businesses

column1: We eliminated the very unpopular Obamacare individual mandate penalty — and to give critically ill patients access to life-saving cures
column2: we passed right to try.

column1: My Administration has cut more regulations in a short time than any other administration during its entire tenure. Companies are coming back to our country in large numbers thanks to historic reductions in taxes and regulations.
We have unleashed a revolution in American energy — the United States is now the number one producer of oil and natural gas in the world. And now
column2: for the first time in 65 years
column3: we are a net exporter of energy.

column1: After 24 months of rapid progress
column2: our economy is the envy of the world
column3: our military is the most powerful on earth
column4: and America is winning each and every day. Members of Congress: the State of our Union is strong. Our country is vibrant and our economy is thriving like never before.

column1: On Friday
column2: it was announced that we added another 304
column3: 000 jobs last month alone — almost double what was expected. An economic miracle is taking place in the United States — and the only thing that can stop it are foolish wars

column1: If there is going to be peace and legislation
column2: there cannot be war and investigation. It just doesn’t work that way!

column1: We must be united at home to defeat our adversaries abroad.

This new era of cooperation can start with finally confirming the more than 300 highly qualified nominees who are still stuck in the Senate – some after years of waiting. The Senate has failed to act on these nominations
column2: which is unfair to the nominees and to our country.

column1: Now is the time for bipartisan action. Believe it or not
column2: we have already proven that it is possible.

column1: In the last Congress
column2: both parties came together to pass unprecedented legislation to confront the opioid crisis
column3: a sweeping new Farm Bill
column5: and after four decades of rejection
column6: we passed VA Accountability so we can finally terminate those who mistreat our wonderful veterans.

column1: And just weeks ago
column2: both parties united for groundbreaking criminal justice reform. Last year
column3: I heard through friends the story of Alice Johnson. I was deeply moved. In 1997
column4: Alice was sentenced to life in prison as a first-time non-violent drug offender. Over the next two decades
column6: inspiring others to choose a better path. She had a big impact on that prison population — and far beyond.

column1: Alice’s story underscores the disparities and unfairness that can exist in criminal sentencing — and the need to remedy this injustice. She served almost 22 years and had expected to be in prison for the rest of her life.
In June
column2: I commuted Alice’s sentence — and she is here with us tonight. Alice
column3: thank you for reminding us that we always have the power to shape our own destiny.

column1: When I saw Alice’s beautiful family greet her at the prison gates
column2: hugging and kissing and crying and laughing
column3: I knew I did the right thing.

column1: Inspired by stories like Alice’s
column2: my Administration worked closely with members of both parties to sign the First Step Act into law. This legislation reformed sentencing laws that have wrongly and disproportionately harmed the African-American community. The First Step Act gives non-violent offenders the chance to re-enter society as productive
column3: law-abiding citizens. Now
column4: States across the country are following our lead. America is a Nation that believes in redemption.

column1: We are also joined tonight by Matthew Charles from Tennessee. In 1996
column2: at age 30
column3: Matthew was sentenced to 35 years for selling drugs and related offenses. Over the next two decades
column4: he completed more than 30 Bible studies
column7: Matthew is the very first person to be released from prison under the First Step Act. Matthew
column8: on behalf of all Americans: welcome home.

column1: As we have seen
column2: when we are united
column3: we can make astonishing strides for our country. Now
column4: Republicans and Democrats must join forces again to confront an urgent national crisis.

column1: The Congress has 10 days left to pass a bill that will fund our Government
column2: protect our homeland
column3: and secure our southern border.

column1: Now is the time for the Congress to show the world that America is committed to ending illegal immigration and putting the ruthless coyotes
column2: cartels
column3: drug dealers
column4: and human traffickers out of business.

column1: As we speak
column2: large
column3: organized caravans are on the march to the United States. We have just heard that Mexican cities
column4: in order to remove the illegal immigrants from their communities
column5: are getting trucks and buses to bring them up to our country in areas where there is little border protection. I have ordered another 3
column6: 750 troops to our southern border to prepare for the tremendous onslaught.

column1: This is a moral issue. The lawless state of our southern border is a threat to the safety
column2: security
column3: and financial well‑being of all Americans. We have a moral duty to create an immigration system that protects the lives and jobs of our citizens. This includes our obligation to the millions of immigrants living here today
column4: who followed the rules and respected our laws. Legal immigrants enrich our Nation and strengthen our society in countless ways. I want people to come into our country
column5: but they have to come in legally.

column1: Tonight
column2: I am asking you to defend our very dangerous southern border out of love and devotion to our fellow citizens and to our country.

column1: No issue better illustrates the divide between America’s working class and America’s political class than illegal immigration. Wealthy politicians and donors push for open borders while living their lives behind walls and gates and guards.
Meanwhile
column2: working class Americans are left to pay the price for mass illegal migration — reduced jobs
column3: lower wages
column6: and a depleted social safety net.

column1: Tolerance for illegal immigration is not compassionate — it is cruel. One in three women is sexually assaulted on the long journey north. Smugglers use migrant children as human pawns to exploit our laws and gain access to our country.

Human traffickers and sex traffickers take advantage of the wide open areas between our ports of entry to smuggle thousands of young girls and women into the United States and to sell them into prostitution and modern-day slavery.
Tens of thousands of innocent Americans are killed by lethal drugs that cross our border and flood into our cities — including meth
column2: heroin
column3: cocaine

column1: The savage gang
column2: MS-13
column3: now operates in 20 different American States
column4: and they almost all come through our southern border. Just yesterday
column5: an MS-13 gang member was taken into custody for a fatal shooting on a subway platform in New York City. We are removing these gang members by the thousands
column6: but until we secure our border they’re going to keep streaming back in.

column1: Year after year
column2: countless Americans are murdered by criminal illegal aliens.

column1: I’ve gotten to know many wonderful Angel Moms
column2: Dads
column3: and families – no one should ever have to suffer the horrible heartache they have endured.

column1: Here tonight is Debra Bissell. Just three weeks ago
column2: Debra’s parents
column3: Gerald and Sharon
column4: were burglarized and shot to death in their Reno
column6: home by an illegal alien. They were in their eighties and are survived by four children
column8: and 20 great-grandchildren. Also here tonight are Gerald and Sharon’s granddaughter

column1: To Debra
column2: Heather
column3: Madison
column4: please stand: few can understand your pain. But I will never forget
column5: and I will fight for the memory of Gerald and Sharon
column6: that it should never happen again.

column1: Not one more American life should be lost because our Nation failed to control its very dangerous border.
In the last 2 years
column2: our brave ICE officers made 266
column3: 000 arrests of criminal aliens
column4: including those charged or convicted of nearly 100

column1: We are joined tonight by one of those law enforcement heroes: ICE Special Agent Elvin Hernandez. When Elvin was a boy
column2: he and his family legally immigrated to the United States from the Dominican Republic. At the age of eight
column3: Elvin told his dad he wanted to become a Special Agent. Today
column4: he leads investigations into the scourge of international sex trafficking. Elvin says: “If I can make sure these young girls get their justice
column5: I’ve done my job.” Thanks to his work and that of his colleagues
column6: more than 300 women and girls have been rescued from horror and more than 1
column7: 500 sadistic traffickers have been put behind bars in the last year.

column1: Special Agent Hernandez
column2: please stand: We will always support the brave men and women of Law Enforcement — and I pledge to you tonight that we will never abolish our heroes from ICE.

column1: My Administration has sent to the Congress a commonsense proposal to end the crisis on our southern border.
It includes humanitarian assistance
column2: more law enforcement
column3: drug detection at our ports
column4: closing loopholes that enable child smuggling
column5: and plans for a new physical barrier
column7: to secure the vast areas between our ports of entry. In the past
column8: most of the people in this room voted for a wall — but the proper wall never got built. I’ll get it built.

column1: This is a smart
column2: strategic
column3: see-through steel barrier — not just a simple concrete wall. It will be deployed in the areas identified by border agents as having the greatest need
column4: and as these agents will tell you

column1: San Diego used to have the most illegal border crossings in the country. In response
column2: and at the request of San Diego residents and political leaders
column3: a strong security wall was put in place. This powerful barrier almost completely ended illegal crossings.

column1: The border city of El Paso
column2: Texas
column3: used to have extremely high rates of violent crime — one of the highest in the country
column4: and considered one of our Nation’s most dangerous cities. Now
column5: with a powerful barrier in place
column6: El Paso is one of our safest cities.

column1: Simply put
column2: walls work and walls save lives. So let’s work together
column3: compromise
column4: and reach a deal that will truly make America safe.

column1: As we work to defend our people’s safety
column2: we must also ensure our economic resurgence continues at a rapid pace.

column1: No one has benefitted more from our thriving economy than women
column2: who have filled 58 percent of the new jobs created in the last year. All Americans can be proud that we have more women in the workforce than ever before — and exactly one century after the Congress passed the Constitutional amendment giving women the right to vote
column3: we also have more women serving in the Congress than ever before.

column1: As part of our commitment to improving opportunity for women everywhere
column2: this Thursday we are launching the first ever Government-wide initiative focused on economic empowerment for women in developing countries.

column1: To build on our incredible economic success
column2: one priority is paramount — reversing decades of calamitous trade policies.

column1: We are now making it clear to China that after years of targeting our industries
column2: and stealing our intellectual property
column3: the theft of American jobs and wealth has come to an end.

column1: Therefore
column2: we recently imposed tariffs on $250 billion of Chinese goods — and now our Treasury is receiving billions of dollars a month from a country that never gave us a dime. But I don’t blame China for taking advantage of us — I blame our leaders and representatives for allowing this travesty to happen. I have great respect for President Xi
column3: and we are now working on a new trade deal with China. But it must include real
column4: structural change to end unfair trade practices

column1: Another historic trade blunder was the catastrophe known as NAFTA.
I have met the men and women of Michigan
column2: Ohio
column3: Pennsylvania
column6: and many other States whose dreams were shattered by NAFTA. For years
column7: politicians promised them they would negotiate for a better deal. But no one ever tried — until now.

column1: Our new U.S.-Mexico-Canada Agreement — or USMCA — will replace NAFTA and deliver for American workers: bringing back our manufacturing jobs
column2: expanding American agriculture
column3: protecting intellectual property
column4: and ensuring that more cars are proudly stamped with four beautiful words: made in the USA.

column1: Tonight
column2: I am also asking you to pass the United States Reciprocal Trade Act
column3: so that if another country places an unfair tariff on an American product
column4: we can charge them the exact same tariff on the same product that they sell to us.

column1: Both parties should be able to unite for a great rebuilding of America’s crumbling infrastructure.
I know that the Congress is eager to pass an infrastructure bill — and I am eager to work with you on legislation to deliver new and important infrastructure investment
column2: including investments in the cutting edge industries of the future. This is not an option. This is a necessity.

column1: The next major priority for me
column2: and for all of us
column3: should be to lower the cost of healthcare and prescription drugs — and to protect patients with pre-existing conditions.

column1: Already
column2: as a result of my Administration’s efforts
column3: in 2018 drug prices experienced their single largest decline in 46 years.

column1: But we must do more. It is unacceptable that Americans pay vastly more than people in other countries for the exact same drugs
column2: often made in the exact same place. This is wrong
column3: unfair
column4: and together we can stop it.

column1: I am asking the Congress to pass legislation that finally takes on the problem of global freeloading and delivers fairness and price transparency for American patients. We should also require drug companies
column2: insurance companies
column3: and hospitals to disclose real prices to foster competition and bring costs down.

column1: No force in history has done more to advance the human condition than American freedom. In recent years we have made remarkable progress in the fight against HIV and AIDS. Scientific breakthroughs have brought a once-distant dream within reach. My budget will ask Democrats and Republicans to make the needed commitment to eliminate the HIV epidemic in the United States within 10 years. Together
column2: we will defeat AIDS in America.

column1: Tonight
column2: I am also asking you to join me in another fight that all Americans can get behind: the fight against childhood cancer.

column1: Joining Melania in the gallery this evening is a very brave 10-year-old girl
column2: Grace Eline. Every birthday since she was 4
column3: Grace asked her friends to donate to St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital. She did not know that one day she might be a patient herself. Last year
column4: Grace was diagnosed with brain cancer. Immediately
column5: she began radiation treatment. At the same time
column6: she rallied her community and raised more than $40
column7: 000 for the fight against cancer. When Grace completed treatment last fall
column8: her doctors and nurses cheered with tears in their eyes as she hung up a poster that read: “Last Day of Chemo.” Grace — you are an inspiration to us all.

column1: Many childhood cancers have not seen new therapies in decades. My budget will ask the Congress for $500 million over the next 10 years to fund this critical life-saving research.
To help support working parents
column2: the time has come to pass school choice for America’s children. I am also proud to be the first President to include in my budget a plan for nationwide paid family leave — so that every new parent has the chance to bond with their newborn child.

column1: There could be no greater contrast to the beautiful image of a mother holding her infant child than the chilling displays our Nation saw in recent days. Lawmakers in New York cheered with delight upon the passage of legislation that would allow a baby to be ripped from the mother’s womb moments before birth. These are living
column2: feeling
column3: beautiful babies who will never get the chance to share their love and dreams with the world. And then
column4: we had the case of the Governor of Virginia where he basically stated he would execute a baby after birth.

column1: To defend the dignity of every person
column2: I am asking the Congress to pass legislation to prohibit the late-term abortion of children who can feel pain in the mother’s womb.

column1: Let us work together to build a culture that cherishes innocent life. And let us reaffirm a fundamental truth: all children — born and unborn — are made in the holy image of God.
The final part of my agenda is to protect America’s National Security.
Over the last 2 years
column2: we have begun to fully rebuild the United States Military — with $700 billion last year and $716 billion this year. We are also getting other nations to pay their fair share. For years
column3: the United States was being treated very unfairly by NATO — but now we have secured a $100 billion increase in defense spending from NATO allies.

column1: As part of our military build-up
column2: the United States is developing a state-of-the-art Missile Defense System.

column1: Under my Administration
column2: we will never apologize for advancing America’s interests.

column1: For example
column2: decades ago the United States entered into a treaty with Russia in which we agreed to limit and reduce our missile capabilities. While we followed the agreement to the letter
column3: Russia repeatedly violated its terms. That is why I announced that the United States is officially withdrawing from the Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces Treaty

column1: Perhaps we can negotiate a different agreement
column2: adding China and others
column3: or perhaps we can’t –- in which case
column4: we will outspend and out-innovate all others by far.

column1: As part of a bold new diplomacy
column2: we continue our historic push for peace on the Korean Peninsula. Our hostages have come home
column3: nuclear testing has stopped
column4: and there has not been a missile launch in 15 months. If I had not been elected President of the United States
column7: be in a major war with North Korea with potentially millions of people killed. Much work remains to be done
column8: but my relationship with Kim Jong Un is a good one. And Chairman Kim and I will meet again on February 27 and 28 in Vietnam.

column1: Two weeks ago
column2: the United States officially recognized the legitimate government of Venezuela
column3: and its new interim President

column1: We stand with the Venezuelan people in their noble quest for freedom — and we condemn the brutality of the Maduro regime
column2: whose socialist policies have turned that nation from being the wealthiest in South America into a state of abject poverty and despair.

column1: Here
column2: in the United States
column3: we are alarmed by new calls to adopt socialism in our country. America was founded on liberty and independence –- not government coercion
column5: and control. We are born free
column6: and we will stay free. Tonight
column7: we renew our resolve that America will never be a socialist country.

column1: One of the most complex set of challenges we face is in the Middle East.
Our approach is based on principled realism — not discredited theories that have failed for decades to yield progress. For this reason
column2: my Administration recognized the true capital of Israel — and proudly opened the American Embassy in Jerusalem.

column1: Our brave troops have now been fighting in the Middle East for almost 19 years. In Afghanistan and Iraq
column2: nearly 7
column3: 000 American heroes have given their lives. More than 52
column4: 000 Americans have been badly wounded. We have spent more than $7 trillion in the Middle East.

column1: As a candidate for President
column2: I pledged a new approach. Great nations do not fight endless wars.

column1: When I took office
column2: ISIS controlled more than 20
column3: 000 square miles in Iraq and Syria. Today
column4: we have liberated virtually all of that territory from the grip of these bloodthirsty killers.

column1: Now
column2: as we work with our allies to destroy the remnants of ISIS
column3: it is time to give our brave warriors in Syria a warm welcome home.

column1: I have also accelerated our negotiations to reach a political settlement in Afghanistan. Our troops have fought with unmatched valor — and thanks to their bravery
column2: we are now able to pursue a political solution to this long and bloody conflict.

column1: In Afghanistan
column2: my Administration is holding constructive talks with a number of Afghan groups
column3: including the Taliban. As we make progress in these negotiations
column4: we will be able to reduce our troop presence and focus on counter-terrorism. We do not know whether we will achieve an agreement — but we do know that after two decades of war
column5: the hour has come to at least try for peace.

column1: Above all
column2: friend and foe alike must never doubt this Nation’s power and will to defend our people. Eighteen years ago
column3: terrorists attacked the USS Cole — and last month American forces killed one of the leaders of the attack.

column1: We are honored to be joined tonight by Tom Wibberley
column2: whose son
column3: Navy Seaman Craig Wibberley
column4: was one of the 17 sailors we tragically lost. Tom: we vow to always remember the heroes of the USS Cole.

column1: My Administration has acted decisively to confront the world’s leading state sponsor of terror: the radical regime in Iran.
To ensure this corrupt dictatorship never acquires nuclear weapons
column2: I withdrew the United States from the disastrous Iran nuclear deal. And last fall
column3: we put in place the toughest sanctions ever imposed on a country.

column1: We will not avert our eyes from a regime that chants death to America and threatens genocide against the Jewish people. We must never ignore the vile poison of anti-Semitism
column2: or those who spread its venomous creed. With one voice
column3: we must confront this hatred anywhere and everywhere it occurs.

column1: Just months ago
column2: 11 Jewish-Americans were viciously murdered in an anti-semitic attack on the Tree of Life Synagogue in Pittsburgh. SWAT Officer Timothy Matson raced into the gunfire and was shot seven times chasing down the killer. Timothy has just had his 12th surgery — but he made the trip to be here with us tonight. Officer Matson: we are forever grateful for your courage in the face of evil.

column1: Tonight
column2: we are also joined by Pittsburgh survivor Judah Samet. He arrived at the synagogue as the massacre began. But not only did Judah narrowly escape death last fall — more than seven decades ago
column3: he narrowly survived the Nazi concentration camps. Today is Judah’s 81st birthday. Judah says he can still remember the exact moment
column5: after 10 months in a concentration camp
column6: when he and his family were put on a train
column7: and told they were going to another camp. Suddenly the train screeched to a halt. A soldier appeared. Judah’s family braced for the worst. Then
column8: his father cried out with joy: “It’s the Americans.”

column1: A second Holocaust survivor who is here tonight
column2: Joshua Kaufman
column3: was a prisoner at Dachau Concentration Camp. He remembers watching through a hole in the wall of a cattle car as American soldiers rolled in with tanks. “To me
column5: “the American soldiers were proof that God exists
column6: and they came down from the sky.”

column1: I began this evening by honoring three soldiers who fought on D-Day in the Second World War. One of them was Herman Zeitchik. But there is more to Herman’s story. A year after he stormed the beaches of Normandy
column2: Herman was one of those American soldiers who helped liberate Dachau. He was one of the Americans who helped rescue Joshua from that hell on earth. Almost 75 years later
column3: Herman and Joshua are both together in the gallery tonight — seated side-by-side
column4: here in the home of American freedom. Herman and Joshua: your presence this evening honors and uplifts our entire Nation.

column1: When American soldiers set out beneath the dark skies over the English Channel in the early hours of D-Day
column3: they were just young men of 18 and 19
column4: hurtling on fragile landing craft toward the most momentous battle in the history of war.

column1: They did not know if they would survive the hour. They did not know if they would grow old. But they knew that America had to prevail. Their cause was this Nation
column2: and generations yet unborn.

column1: Why did they do it? They did it for America — they did it for us.
Everything that has come since — our triumph over communism
column2: our giant leaps of science and discovery
column3: our unrivaled progress toward equality and justice — all of it is possible thanks to the blood and tears and courage and vision of the Americans who came before.

column1: Think of this Capitol — think of this very chamber
column2: where lawmakers before you voted to end slavery
column3: to build the railroads and the highways
column6: to face down an evil empire.

column1: Here tonight
column2: we have legislators from across this magnificent republic. You have come from the rocky shores of Maine and the volcanic peaks of Hawaii; from the snowy woods of Wisconsin and the red deserts of Arizona; from the green farms of Kentucky and the golden beaches of California. Together
column3: we represent the most extraordinary Nation in all of history.

column1: What will we do with this moment? How will we be remembered?

I ask the men and women of this Congress: Look at the opportunities before us! Our most thrilling achievements are still ahead. Our most exciting journeys still await. Our biggest victories are still to come. We have not yet begun to dream.
We must choose whether we are defined by our differences — or whether we dare to transcend them.
We must choose whether we will squander our inheritance — or whether we will proudly declare that we are Americans. We do the incredible. We defy the impossible. We conquer the unknown.
This is the time to re-ignite the American imagination. This is the time to search for the tallest summit
column2: and set our sights on the brightest star. This is the time to rekindle the bonds of love and loyalty and memory that link us together as citizens
column3: as neighbors

column1: This is our future — our fate — and our choice to make. I am asking you to choose greatness.
No matter the trials we face
column2: no matter the challenges to come
column3: we must go forward together.

column1: We must keep America first in our hearts. We must keep freedom alive in our souls. And we must always keep faith in America’s destiny — that one Nation
column2: under God
column3: must be the hope and the promise and the light and the glory among all the nations of the world!

column1: Thank you. God Bless You
column2: God Bless America
column3: and good night!"	President Donald J. Trump’s State of the Union Address		[]	['americans'

column15: but some of the social media posts of accused school shooter Nikolas Cruz are getting attention

column1: The posts on the two Instagram pages attributed to Cruz appear fixated on weaponry
column2: not politics

column10: keeping black people in chains and cutting their necks.” According to CNN
column11: he also wrote that he had written a letter to Trump and wrote “I think I am going to kill people.”

column1: The MAGA hat makes an appearance in a profile picture on one of the Instagram pages that Heavy has verified belonged to Cruz
column3: an expelled student who is accused of going on a rampage with an AR-15 weapon. On the page with the MAGA hat
column4: the accused school shooter went by the handle @nikolascruzmakarov; MAGA stands for the slogan “Make America Great Again” and is President Donald Trump’s campaign motto. Makarov is the name of a Russian-made pistol. (You can read tributes to the victims here.)

column1: CNN obtained a video the network said was of the shooter undertaking target practice while wearing a MAGA hat.
Instagram released a statement on the account with the MAGA hat
column2: writing
column3: “This is a terrible tragedy and our hearts go out to the people who have been affected. There is absolutely no place on our platforms for people who commit such horrendous acts. We have found and immediately deleted the shooter’s accounts on Facebook and Instagram.”

column1: President Trump expressed prayers for the victims. “My prayers and condolences to the families of the victims of the terrible Florida shooting. No child

column3: ” Trump wrote on Twitter. “Just spoke to Governor Rick Scott. We are working closely with law enforcement on the terrible Florida school shooting.”

column1: Trump held a press conference on February 15

column3: “Our entire nation with one heavy heart is praying for the victims and their families.” He pledged that the government “was here for you” to the victims’ families. “We are all joined together as one American family
column5: no teacher should ever be in danger in an American school.” The president said that “we hold onto God’s word in scripture.” He said he wanted to speak directly to “America’s children
column7: “I want you to know that you are never alone

To be clear
column2: authorities have not said that politics played any role in the shootings. They have indicated that they are not certain of the motive
column3: and those who knew Cruz described him to various Florida and national media outlets as an odd loner obsessed with guns. His social media pages focus on weaponry
column5: the MAGA hat is one detail in the fuller biography of the accused shooter
column8: help give a picture of the man.

column1: There are unconfirmed allegations that the suspect held extremist views. Jordan Jereb told the Associated Press that Cruz was a member of the white supremacist militia group Republic of Florida and “participated in paramilitary drills in Tallahassee.” Jordan
column2: a leader in the militia that has been described as similar to the Ku Klux Klan
column3: told the AP that Cruz had previous trouble with a female and might have chosen Valentine’s Day for the massacre for that reason. According to Daily Beast
column4: Jereb says a member of the group may have given Cruz a rifle. However
column6: where the group is based now say they can find no link between Nikolas Cruz and the ROF militia group
column7: according to Tallahassee.com. Authorities conducted a gun trace and say that Cruz bought the gun he used.

column1: The ROF leader Jordan Jereb told the Associated Press that Cruz was a member of the ROF and “participated in paramilitary drills in Tallahassee.” He told AP that Cruz had previous trouble with a female and might have chosen Valentine’s Day for the massacre for that reason. “He acted on his own behalf of what he just did and he’s solely responsible for what he just did
column2: ” Jordan Jereb told the AP. ROF has its own YouTube channel. Jereb is a convicted felon. According to the Southern Poverty Law Center
column3: Jereb once “professed his love for Molotov cocktails and shared a video that details an argument for when it’s okay to shoot a police officer.” His Twitter page has now been suspended.

column1: Some people argued on social media that Cruz was actually a registered Democrat based on the voter registration of a Nicolas Cruz in Florida whose birthday is in May 1998. However
column2: the Broward sheriff said in a press conference that the Nikolas Cruz accused of being the school shooter was born in September 1998
column3: not in May (you can watch that comment below). The accused school shooter’s name is spelled Nikolas
column5: although many in the news media initially went with the latter. The New York Times also verified Cruz’s Instagram page. A check of the voter registration database in Florida using the DOB provided in court records for Nikolas Cruz shows he was not registered to vote in that state.

column3: ” and included a series of bomb smilies. The Sheriff said it’s too early to say whether there was a terrorism motive

column1: The world's chocolate supply could melt into a shortage within a few decades

column1: Rising temperatures from climate change threaten to shrink the slim strip of rainforests around the equator where the cacao trees used to make chocolate thrive
column2: according to a 2016 review from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA). And the two West African nations that produce over half of the world's chocolate — Ghana and Ivory Coast — would feel the heat.
rising temperatures will push the suitable cacao cultivation areas uphill
column3: the article found
column4: doubling the altitude needed for prime cacao production in the two nations. In nations like Ghana
