column6: 'http://convention.gop/SMWT-Guide']	https://www.change.org/p/quicken-loans-arena-allow-open-carry-of-firearms-at-the-quicken-loans-arena-during-the-rnc-convention-in-july-2	https://www.change.org/	"RECOGNIZE OUR CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHT TO OPEN CARRY FIREARMS AT THE REPUBLICAN NATIONAL CONVENTION AT THE QUICKEN LOANS ARENA IN JULY 2016

column1: SUMMARY: In July of 2016
column2: the GOP will host its convention at the Quicken Loans Arena in Cleveland
column3: Ohio. Though Ohio is an open carry state
column4: which allows for the open carry of guns
column5: the hosting venue—the Quicken Loans Arena—strictly forbids the carry of firearms on their premises.

column1: According to the policy on their website
column2: ""firearms and other weapons of any kind are strictly forbidden on the premises of Quicken Loans Arena.""

column1: This is a direct affront to the Second Amendment and puts all attendees at risk. As the National Rifle Association has made clear
column2: ""gun-free zones"" such as the Quicken Loans Arena are ""the worst and most dangerous of all lies."" The NRA
column3: our leading defender of gun rights
column4: has also correctly pointed out that ""gun free zones... tell every insane killer in America... (the) safest place to inflict maximum mayhem with minimum risk."" (March 4

column1: Cleveland
column2: Ohio is consistently ranked as one of the top ten most dangerous cities in America. By forcing attendees to leave their firearms at home
column3: the RNC and Quicken Loans Arena are putting tens of thousands of people at risk both inside and outside of the convention site.

column1: This doesn't even begin to factor in the possibility of an ISIS terrorist attack on the arena during the convention. Without the right to protect themselves
column2: those at the Quicken Loans Arena will be sitting ducks
column3: utterly helpless against evil-doers
column4: criminals or others who wish to threaten the American way of life.

column1: All three remaining Republican candidates have spoken out on the issue and are unified in their opposition to Barack HUSSEIN Obama's ""gun-free zones.""

Donald Trump said ""I will get rid of gun-free zones on schools—you have—and on military bases on my first day. It gets signed my first day...you know what a gun-free zone is to a sicko? That's bait."" (Jan. 8. 2016)
Ted Cruz has accurately pointed out ""shooting after shooting after shooting happens in so called gun-free zones."" He continued
column2: ""look
column3: if you're a lunatic ain't nothing better then having a bunch of targets you know that are going to be unarmed."" (Dec. 4

column1: And Ohio Governor John Kasich has been a leader in this movement to eliminate deadly ""gun-free zones"" starting with his brave decision to fight the Democrats and end ""gun-free zones"" at National Guard facilities in Ohio. (Dec. 18

We are all too familiar with the mass carnage that can occur when citizens are denied their basic God-given rights to carry handguns or assault weapons in public. EVERY AMERICAN HAS THE RIGHT TO PROTECT AND DEFEND THEIR FAMILY. With this irresponsible and hypocritical act of selecting a ""gun-free zone"" for the convention
column2: the RNC has placed its members
column3: delegates
column4: candidates and all US citizens in grave danger.

column1: We must take a stand. We cannot allow the national nominating convention of the party of Lincoln and Reagan to be hijacked by weakness and political correctness. The policies of the Quicken Loans Arena do not supersede the rights given to us by our Creator in the U.S. Constitution.
THEREFORE
column2: WE ARE CALLING TODAY FOR THE FOLLOWING FIVE POINTS OF ACTION:

column1: 1. From the Quicken Loans Arena in Cleveland: A suspension of their policy preventing the open carry of firearms on the premises of the arena from July 18-21
column2: 2016 to coincide with the Republican National Convention.

column1: 2. From the National Rifle Association: An immediate condemnation of the egregious affront to the Second Amendment of the United States Constitution constituted by the ""gun-free zone"" loophole to the state law.
3. From Ohio Governor John Kasich: A concerted effort to use his executive authority to override the ""gun-free zone"" loophole being exploited by the Quicken Loans Arena in Cleveland
column2: Ohio.

column1: 4. From Reince Priebus and the Republican National Committee: An explanation of how a venue so unfriendly to Second Amendment rights was chosen for the Republican Convention. Further
column2: we demand a contingency plan to relocate the convention to another location should the Quicken Loans Arena refuse to honor the constitutional rights of the RNC guests to open carry firearms during the convention.

column1: 5. From all Republican candidates for President: You have been brave in raising awareness about the immense dangers posed by ""gun-free zones."" In order to ensure the safety of your supporters
column2: delegates and all attendees at the convention in July
column3: you must call upon the RNC to rectify this affront to our Second Amendment freedoms and insist upon a suspension of the Quicken Loans Arena's unconstitutional ""gun-free zone"" loophole. Every American is endowed with a God-given Constitutional right to carry a gun wherever and whenever they please."	Petition · Quicken Loans Arena: Allow Open Carry of Firearms at the Quicken Loans Arena during the RNC Convention in July. · Change.org		[]	['carry'

column1: I understand the sorrow of failed pregnancies. The pain of the family featured in that article is real. I have held in my hands my own stillborn child. My heart breaks for those with failed pregnancies or those unable to have children.

But now the mother is unable to carry children due to complications and they have these ""extra"" embryos frozen. They don't know what to do about them. Unfreeze them? Let them die? Keep them frozen? column1: —Sandra Boynton
CHOCOLATE: The Consuming Passion
Strawberries dipped in chocolate. Photo by Flickr user kristina.
For chocolate lovers
column2: there is simply no substitute

column4: cocoa (Theobroma cacao) trees might outnumber apple trees in American yards. They would certainly outnumber any plants that produced vegetables.

column1: Unfortunately
column2: cacao trees don't thrive in the temperate climate of the continental United States. Chocolate grows best in the places where it would quickly melt in your hands. Over the next several decades
column3: those places may grow warmer
column5: and less suitable to cacao cultivation. But with planning and adaptation
column6: cacao farmers can keep producing our favorite treat.

column1: The geography of chocolate
Cacao can only grow within about 20° north and south of the equator—south of the Mediterranean home of carob
column2: in fact. Cacao trees only prosper under specific conditions
column3: including fairly uniform temperatures
column7: and protection from wind. In short

column1: Chocolate is now grown around the globe—typically within 10° north and south of the equator. The world's leading producers are Côte d’Ivoire
column2: Ghana
column3: and Indonesia. Côte d'Ivoire and Ghana produce over half of the world's chocolate. But research highlighted in the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) Climate Change 2014: Impacts
column7: those countries will experience a 3.8°F (2.1°C) increase in temperature by 2050
column8: and a marked reduction in suitable cultivation area.

column1: It’s not the heat
column2: it’s the (lack of) humidity

column1: Another staple of American consumption
column2: coffee
column3: suffers direct harm from rising temperatures
column4: but chocolate is different. Rising temperatures alone won’t necessarily hurt cacao production. Cacao cultivation areas in Malaysia
column6: already endure a warmer climate than in West Africa without any obvious negative effect.

column1: Cacao blossoms in the New York Botanical Garden
column2: Bronx. Photo by Flickr user Kerry Woods.

column1: The danger to chocolate comes from an increase in evapotranspiration
column2: especially since the higher temperatures projected for West Africa by 2050 are unlikely to be accompanied by an increase in rainfall
column3: according to business-as-usual carbon dioxide emissions scenarios. In other words
column4: as higher temperatures squeeze more water out of soil and plants
column5: it's unlikely that rainfall will increase enough to offset the moisture loss.

column1: Some of the research highlighted by the IPCC 2014 report is a 2013 study headed by Peter Läderach. Läderach authored a 2011 paper giving a pretty dire forecast for cacao cultivation; the 2013 study reaches slightly less worrisome conclusions
column2: though challenges to West Africa cacao growers remain.

column1: An uphill battle

column2: rising temperatures will push the suitable cacao cultivation areas uphill. The IPCC reported that Côte d'Ivoire and Ghana’s optimal altitude for cacao cultivation is expected to rise from 350–800 feet (100–250 meters) to 1

column1: These maps show suitability for cacao cultivation at present (left) and projected for 2050 (right). Image adapted from Läderach et al. 2013.

Läderach and his team report that areas expected to show improved cultivation conditions are often hilly terrain. One example is Ghana’s Atewa Range. It’s a forest preserve where cultivation isn’t permitted. Cacao-growing countries may have to choose which priority matters more: growing a product to meet a global demand
column2: or preserving natural habitat.

column1: In fact
column2: Läderach and coauthors found that
column3: of the 294 locations examined in the study
column4: only 10.5% showed increasing suitability for cacao production; the remaining 89.5% were likely to become less suitable by 2050. The authors continued
column5: “These changes in climatic suitability are predicted to take place over a time period of almost 40 years
column6: so they will mostly impact the next rather than the current generation of cocoa trees and farmers. In other words

column1: Helping chocolate cope with climate change

One adaptation strategy could be providing cacao growers with selectively bred seeds that have superior drought resistance. Another strategy involves a traditional cacao cultivation method that takes advantage of the conditions under which cacao naturally grows.
Cacao harvesting in Colombia. Photo by the U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID).
Known in Brazil as cabruca
column2: this approach involves retaining
column3: or in some cases replanting
column5: which provide cacao trees with shade. (Like Northern European tourists in the Mediterranean
column6: cacao trees benefit enormously from shade.) This approach could help decrease both temperature and evapotranspiration.

column1: The taller trees also provide protection from wind and soil erosion
column2: and nutrient-rich leaf litter. Cacao trees cultivated in this approach appear less vulnerable to pests
column3: and the soil better retains its ability to support cacao over the long term.

column1: Cabruca offers one more advantage: Carbon that would otherwise be released into the atmosphere when forests are cleared isn't. It remains stored in the trees. A study conducted in southern Cameroon and published in 2009 found that cacao forests in that region store on average 243 metric tons per hectare (about 2.5 acres). (For comparison
column3: the World Bank reported
column4: U.S. citizens released about 17.0 metric tons of carbon dioxide per person per year.) Another study
column5: conducted in Brazil and published in 2014
column6: concluded that judicious cabruca practices could double cacao production in a climate-friendly manner.

column1: Chocolate promotes science literacy among children by forming dinosaurs. Photo by Flickr user Daniele Civello.
So while you may not be able to grow your own chocolate in your own back yard
column2: you can still enjoy this most delectable of treats
column3: delivered from exotic lands. If cacao growers are able to plan for the future
column4: that will be good news for your taste buds and our planet.

https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/coil-mattresses-cause-cancer-amplifying-radio-waves/	coiled mattresses cause cancer by amplifying radio waves.	false	['joseph mercola']	2016/12/21	Alex Kasprak	['https://blogs.scientificamerican.com/guest-blog/left-sided-cancer-blame-your-bed-and-tv/']	https://blogs.scientificamerican.com/guest-blog/left-sided-cancer-blame-your-bed-and-tv/	https://blogs.scientificamerican.com/	"Curiously
column2: the cancer rate is 10 percent higher in the left breast than in the right. This left-side bias holds true for both men and women and it also applies to the skin cancer melanoma. Researchers Örjan Hallberg of Hallberg Independent Research in Sweden and Ollie Johansson of The Karolinska Institute in Sweden
column3: writing in the June issue of the journal Pathophysiology
column4: suggest a surprising explanation that not only points to a common cause for both cancers
column5: it may change your sleeping habits.

column1: For unknown reasons the rates of breast cancer and melanoma have both increased steadily in the last 30 years. Exposure to the sun elevates the risk of melanoma
column2: but the sun's intensity has not changed in the last three decades. Stranger still
column3: melanoma most commonly affects the hip
column5: which are areas of the body protected from the sun. What is responsible for the left-side dominance and increasing incidence of these cancers?

column1: An intriguing clue comes from the Far East. In Japan there is no correlation between the rates of melanoma and breast cancer as there is in the West
column2: and there is no left-side prevalence for either disease. Moreover
column3: the rate of breast cancer in Japan is significantly lower than in the West; only 3 percent of what is seen in Sweden
column4: for example. The rate of prostate cancer in Japan is only 10 percent of that in the U.K. and U.S.

column1: The researchers suggest an explanation based on differences in sleeping habits in Japan and Western countries. Previous research has shown that both men and women prefer to sleep on their right sides. The reasons for this general preference are unclear
column2: but sleeping on the right side may reduce the weight stress on the heart
column3: and the heartbeat is not as loud as when sleeping on the left. Still
column4: there is no reason to suspect that people in Japan sleep in positions that are any different from those in the West. The beds in Japan
column6: are different. The futons used for sleeping in Japan are mattresses placed directly on the bedroom floor
column7: in contrast to the elevated box springs and mattress of beds used in the West. A link between bedroom furniture and cancer seems absurd

column1: The first line of evidence they cite comes from a 2007 study in Sweden conducted between 1989 and 1993 that revealed a strong link between the incidence of melanoma and the number of FM and TV transmission towers covering the area where the individuals lived. Despite epidemiological correlations like this one suggesting the possibility that electromagnetic radiation from FM and TV broadcasts stations could suppress the immune system and promote cancer
column2: the strength of these electromagnetic fields is so feeble it has been difficult to imagine any biological basis for the correlation.

column1: Consider
column2: however
column3: that even a TV set cannot respond to broadcast transmissions unless the weak electromagnetic waves are captured and amplified by an appropriately designed antenna. Antennas are simply metal objects of appropriate length sized to match the wavelength of a specific frequency of electromagnetic radiation. Just as saxophones are made in different sizes to resonate with and amplify particular wavelengths of sound
column4: electromagnetic waves are selectively amplified by metal objects that are the same
column5: half or one quarter of the wavelength of an electromagnetic wave of a specific frequency. Electromagnetic waves resonate on a half-wavelength antenna to create a standing wave with a peak at the middle of the antenna and a node at each end
column6: just as when a string stretched between two points is plucked at the center. In the U.S. bed frames and box springs are made of metal
column7: and the length of a bed is exactly half the wavelength of FM and TV transmissions that have been broadcasting since the late 1940s. In Japan most beds are not made of metal
column8: and the TV broadcast system does not use the 87- to 108-megahertz frequency used in Western countries.

column1: Thus
column2: as we sleep on our coil-spring mattresses
column3: we are in effect sleeping on an antenna that amplifies the intensity of the broadcast FM/TV radiation. Asleep on these antennas
column4: our bodies are exposed to the amplified electromagnetic radiation for a third of our life spans. As we slumber on a metal coil-spring mattress
column5: a wave of electromagnetic radiation envelops our bodies so that the maximum strength of the field develops 75 centimeters above the mattress in the middle of our bodies. When sleeping on the right side
column6: the body's left side will thereby be exposed to field strength about twice as strong as what the right side absorbs.

column1: If this study is correct
column2: the solution is simple: Replace the metal in our beds with a nonmetallic mattress or orient your bed
column3: like an antenna
column4: away from the direction of the local FM/TV transmission tower. Call it high-tech feng shui if you like
column5: but if this new study has not identified the cause of left-side cancer

column7: is Editor-in-Chief of the journal Neuron Glia Biology and member of the editorial board of several other journals in the field of neuroscience. He is the author of the new book The Other Brain (Simon and Schuster)
column8: about cells in the brain (glia) that do not communicate using electricity. His hobbies include building guitars
column10: and scuba diving. He lives in Silver Spring

To assume that a political revolution can survive without the supporting base of a popular reformation is to ask for the impossible in politics. Men don't like to step abruptly out of the security of familiar experience; they need a bridge to cross from their own experience to a new way. The possibility of destruction is always implicit in the act of creation. Thus the greatest enemy of individual freedom is the individual himself. From the beginning the weakness as well as the strength of the democratic ideal has been the people. Prologue xxv People cannot be free unless they are willing to sacrifice some of their interests to guarantee the freedom of others. The price of democracy is the ongoing pursuit of the common good by all of the people. One hundred and thirty-five years ago Tocqueville* gravely warned that unless individual citizens were regularly involved in the action of governing themselves

Saul Alinsky The Purpose The life of man upon earth is a warfare... —Job 7:1 WHAT FOLLOWS IS for those who want to change the world from what it is to what they believe it should be. The Prince was written by Machiavelli for the Haves on how to hold power. Rules for Radicals is written for the Have-Nots on how to take it away. In this book we are concerned with how to create mass organizations to seize power and give it to the people; to realize the democratic dream of equality
column288: equal and full opportunities for education
column291: and the creation of those circumstances in which man can have the chance to live by values that give meaning to life. We are talking about a mass power organization which will change the world into a place where all men and women walk erect

column293: ""Better to die on your feet than to live on your knees."" This means revolution. The significant changes in history have been made by revolutions. There are people who say that it is not revolution
column295: that brings about change — but evolution is simply the term used by nonparticipants to denote a Rules for Radicals 4 particular sequence of revolutions as they synthesized into a specific major social change. In this book I propose certain general observations
column297: and concepts of the mechanics of mass movements and the various stages of the cycle of action and reaction in revolution. This is not an ideological book except insofar as argument for change
column298: rather than for the status quo
column299: can be called an ideology; different people
column301: in different situations and different times will construct their own solutions and symbols of salvation for those times. This book will not contain any panacea or dogma; I detest and fear dogma. I know that all revolutions must have ideologies to spur them on. That in the heat of conflict these ideologies tend to be smelted into rigid dogmas claiming exclusive possession of the truth
column303: is tragic. Dogma is the enemy of human freedom. Dogma must be watched for and apprehended at every turn and twist of the revolutionary movement. The human spirit glows from that small inner light of doubt whether we are right
column304: while those who believe with complete certainty that they possess the right are dark inside and darken the world outside with cruelty

Of Means and Ends We cannot think first and act afterwards. column702: ""Does the end justify the means?"" is meaningless as it stands; the real and only question regarding the ethics of means and ends is

column708: one does not always enjoy the luxury of a decision that is consistent both with one's individual conscience and the good of mankind. The choice must always be for the latter. Action is for mass salvation and not for the individual's personal salvation. He who sacrifices the mass good for his personal conscience has a peculiar conception of ""personal salvation""; he doesn't care enough for people to be ""corrupted"" for them. The men who pile up the heaps of discussion and literature on the ethics of means and ends — which with rare exception is conspicuous for its sterility — rarely write about their own experiences in the perpetual struggle of life and change. These non-doers were the ones who chose not to fight the Nazis in the only way they could have been fought; they were the ones who drew their window blinds to shut out the shameful spectacle of Jews and political prisoners being dragged through the streets; they were the ones who privately deplored the horror of it all — and did nothing. column1: in a little Texas town
column2: and the boy went to work everyday protecting that little town. He was a police officer

column4: and became a soldier in the National Guard. Life was good
column6: but something was missing. They began to pray for a baby. Time went on
column8: and months to years. 7 years to be exact. And then the news came. That boy and that girl were having a boy of their own. This is the part of the story where you come in...

column1: On September 15
column3: at 34 weeks
column4: while her husband Sean was serving our country in Afghanistan
column5: Heather Brown went to the hospital with back pain and a headache. After arriving at the hospital
column6: Heather began having seizures caused by a massive brain bleed. The baby
column8: was taken by emergency C-section. Heather slipped into a coma. The baby was rushed to a neighboring hospital with a NICU.

column1: It took 72 hours to bring our first Brown home from Afghanistan. The longest 3 days of his life. Flights that were hours on end with no communication. Not knowing how his wife and son were doing. Upon arrival at Tyler Pounds Field
column2: Sean was given a police escort to the hospital
column3: where his tiny newborn son was. That guy may be little
column4: but he is strong like his daddy and the doctors and nurses say he is going to be okay
column6: this little Brown will come home too.

column1: After seeing his son
column2: Sean went to his wife's side
column3: where he has been constantly for the last month. Heather is still in a coma
column4: and the doctor's tell us she may never come out. But we know our God is in the business of miracles. We believe through the power of prayer
column6: and we believe this Brown is coming home

column4: 'president-elect trump']	2016/11/10	Alex Kasprak	['https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/trump-picks-top-climate-skeptic-to-lead-epa-transition/']	https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/trump-picks-top-climate-skeptic-to-lead-epa-transition/	https://www.scientificamerican.com/	"Donald Trump has selected one of the best-known climate skeptics to lead his U.S. EPA transition team
column5: according to two sources close to the campaign.

column1: Myron Ebell
column2: director of the Center for Energy and Environment at the conservative Competitive Enterprise Institute
column3: is spearheading Trump’s transition plans for EPA

column1: The Trump team has also lined up leaders for its Energy Department and Interior Department teams. Republican energy lobbyist Mike McKenna is heading the DOE team; former Interior Department solicitor David Bernhardt is leading the effort for that agency
column2: according to sources close to the campaign.

column1: Ebell is a well-known and polarizing figure in the energy and environment realm. His participation in the EPA transition signals that the Trump team is looking to drastically reshape the climate policies the agency has pursued under the Obama administration. Ebell’s role is likely to infuriate environmentalists and Democrats but buoy critics of Obama’s climate rules.
Ebell
column2: who was dubbed an “elegant nerd” and a “policy wonk” by Vanity Fair
column3: is known for his prolific writings that question what he calls climate change “alarmism.” He appears frequently in the media and before Congress. He’s also chairman of the Cooler Heads Coalition
column4: a group of nonprofits that “question global warming alarmism and oppose energy-rationing policies.”

column1: Ebell appears to relish criticism from the left.
In a biography submitted when he testified before Congress
column2: he listed among his recognitions that he had been featured in a Greenpeace “Field Guide to Climate Criminals
column3: ” dubbed a “misleader” on global warming by Rolling Stone and was the subject of a motion to censure in the British House of Commons after Ebell criticized the United Kingdom’s chief scientific adviser for his views on global warming.

column1: More recently
column2: Ebell has called the Obama administration’s Clean Power Plan for greenhouse gases illegal and said that Obama joining the Paris climate treaty “is clearly an unconstitutional usurpation of the Senate’s authority.”

column1: He told Vanity Fair in 2007
column2: “There has been a little bit of warming ... but it’s been very modest and well within the range for natural variability
column3: and whether it’s caused by human beings or not

column1: Ebell’s views appear to square with Trump’s when it comes to EPA’s agenda. Trump has called global warming “bullshit” and he has said he would “cancel” the Paris global warming accord and roll back President Obama’s executive actions on climate change (ClimateWire
column2: May 27).

column1: Leading the Trump DOE team: GOP hired gun McKenna.

The president of MWR Strategies is well known in Republican energy circles. He was director of policy and external affairs for the Virginia Department of Environmental Quality under then-Gov. George Allen (R) and was an external relations specialist at the Energy Department during the George H.W. Bush administration.
His lobbying clients in 2016 include Koch Companies Public Sector LLC
column2: Southern Company Services
column3: Dow Chemical Co. and Competitive Power Ventures Inc.

column1: And heading Interior’s transition effort is Bernhardt
column2: co-chairman of the Natural Resources Department at the law firm Brownstein Hyatt Farber Schreck.

column1: He served as Interior’s solicitor during the George W. Bush administration after holding several other high-ranking jobs at the department.
In addition to the EPA
column2: Interior and DOE team leaders

column1: Following the election

https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/titanic-pcp-chowder/	"dozens of people on the set of the film ""titanic"" were sickened after eating seafood chowder that had been spiked with the drug pcp on the final day of shooting."	mostly true	['historical pictures']	2019/05/01	Dan Evon	['https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/ypaq3g/remembering-when-everyone-filming-titanic-got-spiked-with-pcp']	https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/ypaq3g/remembering-when-everyone-filming-titanic-got-spiked-with-pcp	https://www.vice.com/	"It was the cream of insider Hollywood scoops of 1996—the cast and crew of Titanic had been poisoned with PCP-spiked clam chowder. Even Bill Paxton and James Cameron. But Leonardo DiCaprio and Kate Winslet were spared
column2: as neither had any scenes on the Canadian set.

column1: It all went down on the last night of filming in Nova Scotia. Five weeks of working up north was nearly over and the whole crew was about to decamp to the larger set down in Mexico. Everyone was in high spirits; the mood festive.
Then at around midnight
column2: which was lunch hour for a filming schedule that started at dusk and went until dawn
column3: the crew was called together for one last meal. Even James Cameron descended from his office to toast a successful wrap. The catering team turned out an impressive spread
column4: crowned by a big batch of creamy clam chowder. People were lining up for seconds and thirds. And then it was back to work.

column1: Marilyn McAvoy was one such crew member. A standby painter on the set
column2: she used her background in fine art to paint forgeries
column3: illustrate Jack's sketchbook
column4: and age props. Now an artist in her own right
column5: she talks to VICE about what it was like to get extremely and accidentally high on the night of the PCP-chowder incident.

column1: All images by Ben Thomson
VICE: Hey Marilyn
column2: so tell me
column3: what was that chowder like?

column1: Marilyn McAvoy: The chowder was unbelievable. People were going back for second bowls. I really thought about going back because it was so good. And I think that was part of the problem: People ate a lot more than usual because it was so delicious.
What else do you remember about that night?
There was no indication that there was anything strange happening... until the meal. By the time we got back from eating
column2: after about 30 minutes
column3: that's when I started noticing something was wrong. Everyone seemed confused. Everyone was having trouble getting their work done.

column1: What were you doing at the time?
I needed some stuff upstairs as well as some other equipment down in another area. And I remember just walking around trying to figure out the best way to get my supplies. Things just seemed fuzzy.
How did the rest of the crew react?
While I was trying to figure out what was going on
column2: everyone else seemed to be going outside. They were all gathering outside of the giant doors of the building we were working in.

column1: I also heard later on that as soon as James Cameron realized something had been put in the chowder
column2: he ran up to his room and forced himself to throw up.

column1: When did everyone realize what had happened?
It was actually kind of comical. It was like that game kids play
column2: Red Rover: There were the people who were ok
column3: who hadn't gotten any effects yet
column4: and the people who were getting high. And there were these two lines apart from each other
column5: with some people in the ""good"" line slowly trickling into the ""bad"" line. It was at about this point that people realized that everyone who had eaten the chowder was experiencing the effects of some sort of hallucinogen.

column1: So what happened next?
The crew vans came and picked everybody up and took us to the Dartmouth General Hospital. En masse
column2: we went through these hospital doors at 1 AM in the morning. They did not know what to do with us. It became pretty chaotic. Some people were having a really hard time. I think maybe the people who had more experience with drugs were having flashbacks and bad trips.

column1: How did it affect you?
For me
column2: the whole situation was pretty surreal. But in terms of effects
column3: it was kind of like a combination of being high on marijuana and being drunk; I was functioning
column4: I was reading magazines. It was like a dream.

column1: What was your experience with hallucinogens before this?
None. So when it started happening
column2: I was pretty scared because I had no experience to base [this high] on. We didn't know then what it had been spiked with. But because it was such an unexpected thing to have happened
column3: I didn't have time at the moment to fully take in how dangerous something like this could have been.

column1: How did the hospital deal with all of you?
Well
column2: we were there all night. Eventually
column3: we all got put in these cubicles with the curtains around us
column4: but no one wanted to stay in their cubicles. Everyone was out in the aisles and jumping into other people's cubicles. People had a lot of energy. Some were in wheelchairs
column5: flying down the hallways. I mean
column6: everyone was high! So they gave us this drink that had charcoal in it
column7: to remove the toxins. By sunup
column8: we had started to come down. People were playing hacky sack. Everyone just wanted to get home.

column1: What was the aftermath like?
Well
column2: we had to go home and get right to sleep and then back to work that night to finish the shooting that had been interrupted. It was very strange. In terms of what had happened
column3: there were some investigations. Nothing was ever officially determined
column4: as far as I know. Among the crew
column5: there were rumors that it had been a disgruntled chef that had been let go
column6: but nothing ever came of that.

column1: It seems like since it happened at the end of the shoot
column2: there wasn't much time for paranoia to brew among the crew.

column1: Yeah
column2: that's true. I never thought about that. I probably would have started bringing my own lunch. Because it was
column3: while funny
column6: it would have led to a very mistrustful situation.

column1: Did this whole thing affect your attitude towards drug-taking
column2: illegal or otherwise?

column1: No
column2: not really. Although it made me realize how fragile
column3: and how delicate
column4: these things can be. Had I gone back for that second bowl
column5: I might have had an entirely different kind of experience.

column5: after a bizarre traffic stop.	false	['Not Necessarily The News']		David Mikkelson	['https://web.archive.org/web/20111118101724/http://thedailycricket.com/2008/06/23/bizzare-arrest-on-rt-95/']	https://web.archive.org/web/20111118101724/http://thedailycricket.com/2008/06/23/bizzare-arrest-on-rt-95/	https://web.archive.org/	"Three people remain in custody after being arrested on Saturday morning following a traffic stop in Canton. In what was described by Lt. Paul Sullivan as “the most bizarre traffic stop” that he has seen in his 23 years on the force
column6: Canton police responded to a report of a disabled vehicle traveling on Route 95. They came across the vehicle shortly after 2 a.m. traveling in the high-speed lane on the southbound side.

column1: “We spotted the green Hyundai Elantra traveling at approximately five miles-per-hour in the passing lane with a huge shower of sparks coming from the rear of the vehicle. As we got closer we noticed that the rear end of the vehicle was dragging on the ground due to the fact that there were no rear tires or axle on the vehicle
column2: ” said Lt. Sullivan of the Canton Police. “After the vehicle pulled over
column3: we approached it and found that the driver was not only drinking a can of beer
column4: but that he was not wearing any pants and that he had urinated on himself.”

column1: After not one
column2: but two
column3: brief foot chases

column1: “There were also two female passengers in the back seat
column2: ” stated Lt. Sullivan. “One of the females was asleep
column3: partially clad. The other was extremely hysterical. At that time
column4: we believed that she might have been under the influence of PCP
column5: due to the fact that she claimed there were mice biting at her and climbing on her.”

column1: Because of the size of the two women
column2: police were unable to pull the women out of the rear doors of the vehicle. After members of the Canton Rescue Squad cut the roof off the vehicle
column3: and with the help of a crane supplied by Shaugnessy Crane
column4: the women were lifted out of the car. Police estimate the weight of each woman was between 300 and 450 pounds.

column1: Shortly after being extracted from the vehicle
column2: the two women began arguing with each other and blows were thrown. At that point
column3: police arrested 17-year-old Tina “Pebbles” Zonfrelli of Foxboro and 56-year-old Donna Dyers of Lynn.

column1: “We followed the drag marks and found that the axle and tires had separated from the vehicle some four miles back. The axle
column2: wheels and tires were found in the parking lot of the Ancient Mariner Lounge located in Foxboro
column3: ” stated Canton police officer James C. West. “At this time we believe that the three individuals had patronized the Mariner Lounge for the better part of the day
column5: they decided to continue the party at Mr. Fasher’s apartment.”

column1: Upon entering the vehicle
column2: the combined weight of the occupants caused the axle and wheels to separate from the vehicle.

column1: “It is unbelievable that an individual could drive over four miles and not realize that there were no rear tires on the car
column2: ” says West.

column1: During the search of the vehicle
column2: police came up with an unexpected find.

column1: “The interior of the vehicle was very messy. There were beer cans
column2: food wrappers
column3: rib bones
column4: and other rubbish in the car. Under the driver’s seat we found a nest of mice. I guess she did see a mouse

column1: Police charged Fasher with driving while intoxicated
column2: indecent exposure
column3: urinating in public
column5: failure to stay in marked lanes
column14: transporting lab animals without proper permits and contributing to the delinquency of a minor.

column1: “We’ve been after this guy for quite some time
column2: ” said West. “Mr. Fasher is well known to us. He is a renowned transvestite
column3: and he’s been arrested a number of times for prostitution. In June of 1998
column4: he was arrested six times in one week. In fact
column5: three of those arrests occurred on one day.”

column1: Fasher faces a number of complaints from business owners in Canton and charges have been filed against him by a number of citizens in the community. Four people have filed civil-damage lawsuits against him after their private property was damaged by Fasher. One person has alleged that he had sex with her prize-winning French poodle in her backyard.
Jimmy Chan
column2: owner of Golden China restaurant claims that he assaulted an employee and caused damages to his establishment.

column1: “He drink all morning
column2: ” said Chan. “He get crazy. I tell him no more beer for you and he throw Pu-Pu platter at waitress. He a very bad man. He broke very expensive mirror!”

column1: James Marathas
column2: owner of Marathas Carpets
column3: alleges that he found Fasher sleeping in his store when he opened up for business one morning three weeks ago.

column1: “He broke in through the back door and passed out right here
column2: ” pointing out the spot

Fact or fiction? You be the judge. I'll never forget stumbling upon the wrinkled old photo that looked like something out of an old monster movie. The picture could have been titled
column2: ""The Catfish That Could Have Eaten Hardin County
column3: Tennessee."" It was in the mid-1990s
column4: and I was working on a story about the National Catfish Derby
column5: an annual catfishing derby and festival held on the Tennessee River. The derby president was the first to show me the black and white photo. ""What do you think?"" said the derby prez
column6: Jay Barker. I looked at the photo and then at Barker
column7: who was grinning mischievously like the Cheshire cat. ""Interesting
column8: I said. ""Very interesting."" Whether the photo and the talk it has generated are fact or fishy fiction doesn't matter. The mystery is part of the tale itself  a tale that has more twists and turns than a hooked catfish. And
column10: Barker has long known the stories would get plenty of news play and help promote the event.  Many people don't believe the photo is real
column11: and that is all right. But my mother told me it was
column12: and she had no reason to lie.   Faye Callens Barker told me he first learned of the photo from Betty Coleman
column14: Tenn. She found it while gathering old photos for the Hardin County Historical Society. Since then
column15: people have told Barker the photo was taken in the Hardin County community of Cerro Gordo in 1914. Barker also has been told the man standing alongside the catfish was Warren McConnell and that a copy of the picture hung for many years in Pitts General Store. The catfish has been estimated
column16: by those who believe in the photo's authenticity
column17: to weigh from 500 to 800 pounds. I interviewed the late Faye Callens
column21: handed down the photo to him. He said his mother had worked as a bookkeeper at Pitts General Store
column22: and she told him the photo was genuine; a man named Green Bailey caught the fish on a trotline. Indeed Bailey's name is inscribed on the photo along with the date and place where the photo was taken
column23: ""Cerro Gordo 1914."" Callens also said he visited Bailey's sister several years ago
column24: and she told him her brother did catch the big fish. ""Many people don't believe the photo is real
column26: Callens said. ""But my mother told me it was
column27: and she had no reason to lie."" There is the rub. To call a fisherman a liar is one thing. But to say so about his mother is enough to get filleted
column28: and fast.  Some people say it's fake
column29: but others firmly believe the catfish was actually caught.   Jay Barker
column30: president of Tennessee's National Catfish Derby As I continued to investigate
column32: I found many other stories attached to the old photo. One was that the late Joe B. Pitts
column34: actually caught the fish. Another story claimed that the fish was caught during a dry summer after it became landlocked in shallow water (before dams regulated water levels on the Tennessee River). Then
column36: there is the fishy side of the story. Barker said some Savannah residents have told him the photo was a fake. Many believe the catfish actually weighed 50-80 pounds and was placed on a child's wagon to be photographed as an optical illusion. To make the gag complete
column37: a cardboard cutout of a man from a cigarette ad was placed on the wagon. Perhaps this is the real truth behind this fish tale
column38: because Barker also has a copy of another photo of the same man and fish taken from a different angle. The man is posed exactly the same as he is in the other photo  one hand on his thigh and the other on his hip
column39: as he stoops to admire the fish. The only difference is this photo was taken from the front of the wagon rather than from the side. ""Some people say it's fake
column40: but others firmly believe the catfish was actually caught
column41: Barker said. What does Barker believe? He'd never admit the old photo is too fishy. After all
column42: can you get too fishy in a place that bills itself as the ""Catfish Capitol of the World""? ""Personally
column44: and it shows without a doubt why we're (Hardin County) the Catfish Capitol of the World
column45: Barker proclaimed. (Perhaps it is no coincidence this promotions man has the last name ""Barker"".) Besides
column46: he pointed out that there definitely are some big catfish swimming in the Hardin County waters of the Tennessee River
column47: especially below Pickwick Dam. ""Probably are some catfish out there that are this big
column48: but anglers just aren't rigged with tackle strong enough to land them
column49: he said. What would happen if a cat as big as the one depicted in the old photo was caught during the county's annual National Catfish Derby? ""I'd try to find a swimming pool big enough to put it in
column50: Barker laughed. ""A fish that big would be a tourist attraction all by itself."" At one time the famed photo had been made into a postcard used to promote the National Catfish Derby. To learn more about the National Catfish Derby

column1: Easter Island Statue Project Conservation Initiative Preliminary Report
July-August 2011
Project Target Statues
The target statues from the inception of this project are RR-001-156 and RR-001-157
column2: both of which are located within Quarry 2 of Rano Raraku. RR-001-158 is adjacent to Quarry 2 on the eastward side and was selected by the conservators as a study control. All of these designations are given on EISP Map Sheet 1 (Van Tilburg and Arévalo Pakarati 2009). Rano Raraku
column3: the quarry in which fully 95% of the known 1
column4: 042 monolithic sculptural objects documented to date by this project were carved
column5: is a unit of the Corporación Nacional Forestal (CONAF; www.conaf.cl) and

column1: Easter Island Statue Project
The Easter Island Statue Project (EISP) is a private research program and archive created by Jo Anne Van Tilburg
column2: Principle Investigator and EISP founder and director
column3: with Cristián Arévalo Pakarati
column4: Rapa Nui artist and co-director of EISP. The profound and immediate need for conservation actions on the moai became apparent over the course of more than 20 years of subjective observation and field experience acquired by us during our island-wide archaeological survey
column5: which was conducted in association with our Chilean and Rapa Nui colleagues.

column1: The Easter Island Statue Project office is located at 225 Arizona Avenue
column2: Studio 500
column3: Santa Monica
column5: 90401. The EISP field office is located at the Mana Gallery

column1: EISP and this AIA funded project are devoted to six discrete but intricately interwoven activities that are also AIA goals:
excavation
conservation
data collection and management
preservation and stewardship advocacy
community outreach
student opportunities and education
The excavation and conservation teams included in this project are made up almost exclusively of local members of the Rapa Nui community. To date
column2: this project has

column1: created research and design opportunities for interested members of our field teams and the Rapa Nui community
column2: as well as UCLA students and volunteers

column1: supported the stewardship of the archaeological record by providing all field generated data to relevant or collaborating Chilean and Rapa Nui agencies
employed 40 Rapa Nui people from the ages of 15 to 75
column2: including distinguished elders and budding scholars

column1: sustained a modest portion of the local economy.
Preliminary Statement

This report is the fourth in an unpublished and selectively distributed series documenting the implementation of the first legally permitted excavations in Rano Raraku quarry since those conducted by Thor Heyerdahl and the Norwegian Archaeological Expedition to Easter Island
column2: 1954-55. All previous reports were provided to the agencies above and
column3: as such
column4: are matters of public record. In addition
column5: each one was filed on www.eisp.org at the end of each season and is widely available in that format to the interested public. Photographs and other data beyond that provided here are also available at www.eisp.org.

column1: Each EISP report describes project participants
column2: methods
column3: goals and results and is a preliminary draft document. However
column4: the report series as a whole contains our initial research proposal and gives the complete history and implementation context of the project (see below). All of the reports are archived by the Easter Island Statue Project (EISP) and copies are provided or available to our funders as well as to all relevant Chilean agencies. To date
column5: Van Tilburg has presented the project and results at two AIA conferences and one UCLA event. Abstracts or details of these presentations are available on the web sites of these organizations.

column1: Excavation

The excavations described here are integral to the conservation actions planned and undertaken by this project on statues RR-001-156 and RR-001-157. They have very specific research goals and are required in order to
record previously unrecorded
column2: unique petroglyphs

column1: preserve the petroglyphs
document statue details
compare statue details and petroglyphs with existing records of other similar features throughout the island
compare the same details with BM-LON-001 in the British Museum
establish previously unreported excavation levels
establish previously unknown photographic levels
establish previously unknown surface destruction
retrieve and document stone tools for study and storage.
Environmental Monitoring
The conceptualization
column2: implementation
column3: and evaluation of conservation actions are the responsibilities of our colleagues Christian Fischer and Moníca Bahamondez P. in consultation with EISP and its data. As previous reports indicate
column4: these actions include ambient environmental monitoring and environmental data collection as well as highly specific statue condition monitoring. The latter activity is unique to this pilot project and integral to the excavation plan. Data collection is carried out with the assistance of Rapa Nui scientist Tahira Edmunds
column5: whose bi-weekly site visits allow her to download and send data to UCLA for analysis. Her visits are also part of our site monitoring plan.

column1: Conservation Treatment

Statue stone condition data collection prior to and after excavation and specific types of conservation treatments are inherent in our pilot plan and crucial to our ability to generalize such actions to other statues in the interior of Rano Raraku. It is important to note here that the initially planned two-stage treatment plan was amended as a result of unfortunate vandalism to the site and illegal removal of the equipment in April
column2: 2010. That vandalism
column3: and the underlying social processes contributing to it
column4: were neither caused nor created by this project. As befits the pilot project framework
column5: a full assessment and evaluation of conservation actions will take place at the end of the data analysis phase
column6: which we anticipate to coincide with backfilling of RR-001-156 in 2012.

column1: Reports for three previous conservation seasons successfully carried out to date were generated and have been given under separate cover by our collaborators Dr. Christian Fischer
column2: the Cotsen Institute of Archaeology at UCLA and Monica Bahamondez P.
column3: Director
column4: Centro Nacional de Conservación y Restauración (CNCR). These reports with edifying illustrations are also posted at www.eisp.org.

column1: Excavation Data Collection and Management

DATASHARE is a significant component of the Easter Island Statue Project and of this AIA funded Conservation Initiative. DATASHARE grew out of the original archive generated by personal field work between 1982 and 1986 (Van Tilburg 1986). However
column2: its on-line potential was only recognized as a direct consequence of our Rano Raraku mapping project (Van Tilburg and Arévalo Pakarati 2009)
column3: which generated a mass of new data from 2000 to 2005. Our map is thus the organizing strategy for our entire data collection. Copies of our unpublished but copyrighted map
column4: along with two volumes of our original Rano Raraku data
column5: were provided to all Chilean authorities and today usefully facilitate the management of Rano Raraku by CONAF. Other full paper copies of our Rano Raraku portion of DATASHARE are held by all of the Chilean and Rapa Nui agencies copied here (Van Tilburg and Arévalo Pakarati 2009). The full on-line availability of DATASHARE requires further fundraising activity and its final content and scope is obviously dependent upon funding.

column1: Excavation Collections Summary
DATASHARE contains
column2: in addition to the records described above
column3: a full and comprehensive record of the excavations we are conducting and the artifacts and eco-facts collected. Our series of linked reports includes an artifact database and an image database. Objects are collected in two ways: either within bags or as discrete objects. To date
column4: two objects have been or are now being transferred to the local Museo Antropológico P. Sebastián Englert. These are a basalt stone with an incised curvilinear design (vaka; RR-001-157-478) and 800 g of concentrated red pigment (kie’a; RR-001-156-653; see below). Our identification system is sorted by the following traceable markers:

column1: unit designation (the statue numbers as they appear on our EISP map;
squares(as they appear on our grid diagrams
levels within squares (recorded as cm)
30 materials and object type categories
To date our collections include

column1: Excavation Season IV Preliminary Report
Goals
The goals for this field season are to
finalize the stratigraphic drawings for RR-001-157
complete photo documentation of RR-001-157
backfill RR-001-157
transfer the inventoried level bags collected for RR-001-157 to the EISP field office for cataloging
transfer selected objects to the island museum for curation
inventory the tools (toki) collected this field season and store them
carry on with the excavation of RR-001-156
create an observational record of conservation actions taken during the recent (May) Conservation Field Season
transfer this season’s toki records to Rafael Paoa Rapu for continuation of his XRF study
arrange for chemical and other analyses of selected objects
continue site monitoring
continue conservation data collection
schedule Excavation Season V (October-November 2011)

column1: Daily Schedule
8:30 Meet and breakfast
9:30 Arrive Rano Raraku
