column1: Return to Main Page
Reed Introduces Legislation to Register Handguns
Thursday
column2: February 24

column1: Groups Supporting Handgun Registration
Summary
How would it work?
Sign an on-line petition supporting handgun registration
WASHINGTON
column2: DC -- Stating that ""the police should not be limited in their ability to track down criminals
column3: Senator Jack Reed (D- RI) today introduced legislation to require the registration of all handguns. The Handgun Safety and Registration Act is meant to reduce illegal gun trafficking by providing for more efficient tracing of handguns used in crimes and tougher penalties for those who sell guns to illegal purchasers. The law will create an on-line database of all registered handguns which can be easily accessed by federal
column4: state and local law enforcement agencies.

column1: Reed's goal is to reduce the number of handguns that end up in the possession of criminals. The bill would require registration of all handguns
column2: including those currently in private possession
column3: and would make it a felony for any person to transfer a handgun to another individual without prior law enforcement approval. Background checks would be performed on all primary and secondary transfers of handguns
column6: Internet sales and all private sales.

column1: Reed stated
column2: ""This bill will limit criminals' access to guns. Background checks will finally be performed on all handgun sales. Before a handgun owner sells a gun without registering it
column3: they will be forced to think hard about the crime they are about to commit and the ten years they may spend in prison.""

column1: Reed's legislation has been endorsed by Handgun Control
column2: Inc.
column3: the Violence Policy Center
column5: the Coalition to Stop Gun Violence and Physicians for Social Responsibility.

column1: The legislation was introduced in response to law enforcement officials' complaints that the methods available for tracing handguns used in crimes are extremely inefficient and provide criminals an advantage over the police.
Currently when a gun is recovered after a crime
column2: a state or local law enforcement agency must contact the Bureau of Alcohol Tobacco and Firearms (ATF) with the name of the manufacturer and the serial number of the handgun. The ATF in turn contacts the manufacturer
column3: which provides the name of the wholesale or retail dealer to whom the handgun was sold. ATF then contacts the dealer to obtain the name of the individual or another retail dealer who purchased the handgun. This often leads to a dead end. If the individual handgun owner has sold the gun to another person in a private sale
column4: there is no way for law enforcement to follow the path of the handgun.

column1: Reed's legislation would make the process more efficient for local law enforcement officials by providing access to a national on-line database of registered weapons.
Reed stated
column2: ""Without restricting in any way the possession or sale of hunting rifles or shotguns used by law-abiding sportsmen
column3: this legislation will give law enforcement officials the tools to conduct faster and more reliable tracing of handguns used in crime
column4: and prevent handguns from falling into criminal hands in the first place.""

column1: The legislation will add handguns to the successful federal weapons registration system already in place under the 1934 National Firearms Act (NFA). The NFA requires registration of all machine guns
column2: short-barrel shotguns and short-barrel rifles
column3: silencers
column6: and other specialized weapons. The NFA is administered by the Department of the Treasury's Bureau of Alcohol

column1: The legislation will face significant opposition from gun control opponents.
I am under no illusion
column2: Reed stated
column3: ""that this legislation will be approved by this Congress or next Congress. Movement on gun control always has been a long and labored process. It was not until 1968
column4: five years after the assassination of John F. Kennedy with a mail-order rifle
column5: that Congress limited that type of gun sale and set up a dealer licensing system. By then
column6: Robert F. Kennedy and Martin Luther King Jr. had been assassinated by gunmen. The 1968 Gun Control Act was the first major gun control legislation in 30 years. But we must begin the process to create a law that Americans overwhelmingly believe is necessary.""

column1: A Time/CNN poll in July of 1999 found that 76 percent of Americans support having the federal government require that each handgun be registered.
A summary of the legislation is attached.
-End-
Groups Supporting Senator Reed's
Handgun Safety and Registration Act
[Back to the Top]
Mary Leigh Bleck
column2: President
column3: Million Mom March

column1: This will help stem the flood of handguns into the illegal market
column2: where kids and criminals have easy access to them. We thank you for your courage and leadership in helping to reform America's guns laws
column3: and we look forward tow orking with you on this historic effort.""

column1: Mrs. Sarah Brady
column2: Chair
column3: Handgun Control

column1: It's about time Congress considers legislation like the Handgun Safety and Registration Act of 2000 to require the registration of handguns in this country. For far too long in America
column2: too many gun crimes have gone unsolved and murderers are getting away with murder because law enforcement doesn't have a clear paper trail to follow. Requiring handguns to be registered - like we register cars - would help law enforcement officers do their jobs
column3: solving crimes.""

column1: I commend Senator Reed for sponsoring the Handgun Safety and Registration Act and hope that Congress will listen to what the majority of law enforcement groups and Americans are saying and quickly pass this important legislation.""
Mark Pertschuk
column2: Legislative Director of the Coalition to Stop Gun Violence

column1: Firearms registration and licensing is the single most important thing Congress can do to protect children from gun violence. Senator Reed should be congratulated for his courage and his vision on this critical issue.""
Kristen Rand
column2: Director of Federal Policy at the Violence Policy Center

column1: Senator Reed's legislation brings a complicated and cumbersome handgun tracing system out of the dark ages and into the 21st Century with instant on-line access. By utilizing an existing registration system
column2: this proposal would prove to be the most cost effective and efficient system to register America's arsenal of 60 million handguns. We must match the level of sophistication of crimes in this country with a modernized tracking system.""

column1: Arinn Dixon
column2: Associate Director
column3: Physicians for Social Responsibility

column1: Physicians for Social Responsibility applauds Senator Reed's critical efforts toward preventing gun violence in this country and emphatically endorses the provisions outlined in the ""Handgun Safety and Registration Act."" His actions show the American public that lawmakers are concerned enough about our nation's epidemic of gun violence to take significant
column2: preventative action.""

column1: [Back to the Top]
Summary of the Handgun Safety and Registration Act of 2000
[Back to the Top]
Adds handguns to the list of weapons registered by the Secretary of the Treasury
column2: Bureau of Alcohol
column3: Tobacco

column1: Requires all handguns
column2: including those currently in private possession
column3: to be registered with ATF within one year of enactment. If a handgun is transferred to another individual during the one-year transition period
column4: the bill requires the handgun to be registered prior to the transfer. [Subsection 2(f)]

column1: Imposes federal law enforcement background checks on all handgun transfers
column2: including both primary and secondary transfers. For all NFA weapons
column3: ATF conducts background checks through the National Crime Information Center (NCIC)
column5: and the National Law Enforcement Tracking System (NLETS).

column1: To ensure compliance with the Handgun Safety and Registration Act
column2: the bill requires the Secretary to take measures to inform the public of the requirements of the Act
column3: such as public service announcements. [Subsection 2(h)]

column1: Requires ATF to share handgun registration data with local
column2: state
column3: and federal law enforcement officials to enhance tracing capabilities (exempts handgun registration information from the disclosure restrictions of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986
column4: of which the NFA is a part). [Subsection 2(e)]

column1: Imposes a tax of $5 on handgun registration and transfers
column2: rather than the $200 tax imposed on most NFA weapons. [Subsections 2(b) and 2(f)(1)]

column1: Imposes a $50 tax on the making of a handgun
column2: rather than the $200 tax imposed on the making of most NFA weapons. [Subsection 2(c)]

column1: Permits the continued importation of handguns by excluding handguns from the general prohibition on importation of NFA firearms under section 5844 of the NFA.
[Subsection 2(d)]

Only required participation by state and local law enforcement is the Chief Law Enforcement Officer's completion of the ""Law Enforcement Certification"" portion of ATF registration or transfer form (as currently required for all NFA weapons). State and local law enforcement agencies are not required to administer the registration program or send forms to ATF. On a voluntary basis
column2: they may choose to provide ATF registration documents to the public.

column1: To further ensure that registration and transfer forms are readily available to the public
column2: the bill requires ATF to post forms on the Internet in a downloadable format
column3: and to make forms available to state and local law enforcement agencies
column5: and regional offices of ATF and other Treasury Department bureaus. [Subsection 2(g)]

column1: Authorizes such appropriations as may be necessary to enable ATF to administer the new handgun registration and background check provisions in the bill. [Subsection 2(i)] [Back to the Top]
How would it work?
[Back to the Top]
The handgun owner (the registrant) obtains an ATF registration form and FBI fingerprint form FD-258
column2: either from his or her local Chief Law Enforcement Officer
column3: by mail from ATF
column5: or from a regional ATF/Treasury Department facility.

column1: The registrant fills out the registration form and affixes a 2x2 inch photograph of himself taken within the past year.
The registrant takes the form to his or her Chief Law Enforcement Officer
column2: who completes the ""Law Enforcement Certification"" portion of the form.

column1: The registrant completes FBI fingerprint card Form FD-258. Fingerprints must be taken by a person qualified to do so and must be clear
column2: unsmudged and classifiable.

column1: A check or money order for $5 is made payable to ATF by the registrant.
The registrant sends all completed forms
column2: accompanying materials
column3: and tax payment to:

column1: Bureau of Alcohol
column2: Tobacco and Firearms

column1: P.O. Box 73201
Chicago
If application is approved
column2: the original of the form with the canceled stamp affixed
column3: showing approval
column4: will be returned to the applicant. Otherwise
column5: the tax will be refunded and ATF will contact the registrant regarding abandonment of the handgun.

column1: Transferring a handgun
Transfer procedures are similar to the registration process described above
column2: except that the transferee completes the reverse of the transfer form
column3: has the Chief Law Enforcement Officer complete the ""Law Enforcement Certification
column4: and attaches photos and fingerprint data."	Gun Safety: Reed Introduces Legislation to Register Handguns		[]	['register'

The 1968 Gun Control Act was the first major gun control legislation in 30 years.
Requiring handguns to be registered - like we register cars - would help law enforcement officers do their jobs
column2: solving crimes.""

column7: 'http://archive.is/XfPt3']	https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2016_clown_sightings	https://en.wikipedia.org/	"Rash of random appearances of malevolent clowns

column1: The 2016 Clown Sightings were reports of people disguised as evil clowns in incongruous settings
column2: such as near forests and schools. The incidents were reported in the United States
column3: Canada
column4: and subsequently in other countries and territories from August 2016.[1][2][3][4][5] The sightings were first reported in Green Bay
column5: Wisconsin in what turned out to be a marketing stunt for a horror film. The phenomenon later spread to many other cities in the US
column6: most notably South Carolina where a 9-year-old boy told his mother that two suspicious males dressed as clowns tried to lure him into the nearby woods.[6] By mid-October 2016
column7: clown sightings and attacks had been reported in nearly all U.S. states
column8: 9 out of 13 provinces and territories of Canada

column1: Prior to the spate of incidents in 2016
column2: numerous sightings of people dressed as clowns in odd or incongruous settings have occurred throughout the world since 2013. The proliferation of videos and images of these precursor sightings spread through social media posts and viral sharing of the content
column3: most notably from DM Pranks

column1: Scope
column2: timeline and effects of sightings [ edit ]

column1: Precursor sightings [ edit ]
One possible precursor event was the 2013 sightings of a ""creepy clown"" in Northampton
column2: England. The Northampton clown sightings
column3: which were in the town during September and October 2013
column4: were the work of three local filmmakers Alex Powell
column6: and Luke Ubanski.[7] The clown shared similar looks to Pennywise the Dancing Clown from Stephen King's book It. The trio started a Facebook page for the so-called ""Northampton clown"" and were using the appearances to drive traffic to the page.[7]

column1: In March 2014
column2: Matteo Moroni from Perugia
column3: Italy
column4: owner of the YouTube channel DM Pranks
column5: began dressing up as an evil clown and terrifying unsuspecting passersby
column6: with his videos racking up hundreds of millions of views.[8] A rash of sightings appeared in California in October 2014
column8: and primarily occurred in the Wasco
column10: area with photos appearing on social media.[9]

column1: A person in clown attire was spotted in a cemetery in Chicago
column2: Illinois
column3: in July 2015. This occurrence involved two residents who spotted the ""creepy clown"" scaling the gate at the Rosehill Cemetery late at night. After the clown entered the cemetery
column4: they turned to face the residents and began waving slowly as they made a video recording. After waving for a few seconds
column5: the clown ran into a dark wooded area and was not seen again. Police investigation of the sighting did not lead to any arrests.[10]

column1: 2016 sightings and effects [ edit ]
The 2016 clown phenomenon began in Green Bay
column2: Wisconsin in early August. Five pictures of a creepy clown roaming a vacant parking lot under a bridge in downtown Green Bay at night started going viral on August 1
column3: 2016.[11] A Facebook page was created shortly after claiming the clown was named ""Gags."" In the days that followed
column4: the pictures ended up being discussed on numerous news outlets including Fox News
column5: USA Today and The Young Turks. Suspicions of the character being related to a horror film were confirmed when a Wisconsin filmmaker announced the pictures were a marketing stunt for a then unreleased short film titled ""Gags."" A feature film was produced based on the short film and premiered in 2018 with a wide release planned for September 2019.

column1: After the Wisconsin incident
column2: numerous other incidents started popping up across the United States
column3: most notably in Greenville
column4: South Carolina at the end of August 2016. In early October 2016
column5: further incidents were reported in Canada and the first occurrences in the United Kingdom and Australia. British communities were described as ""horrified"" and pressure had been placed on police resources.[12]

column1: Throughout this time
column2: Internet social media sites received numerous postings related to the phenomenon. The World Clown Association president Randy Christensen took a stance against the current trend of people dressing up as clowns to frighten people.[13] Circuses[14] and other clown-related businesses were affected.[15] In October 2016
column3: McDonald's decided that Ronald McDonald would keep a lower profile as a result of the incidents.[16] A sociologist has called 2016 ""a bad time to be a professional clown"".[17] The killer clown craze has been linked to a significant increase in sales of clown suits in and near Glasgow
column5: some Floridians decided to go armed while trick-or-treating.[19]

column1: Warnings [ edit ]
On October 12
column2: the Russian Embassy in London issued a warning for Russian and British citizens because of the clown scare.[20]

column1: On October 13
column2: Fijian police warned people against involvement in the events.[21]

column1: Clown costume bans and withdrawals [ edit ]
Several New Zealand shops have withdrawn clown costumes from their shelves.[22] The East Side Union High School District
column2: the West Milford school district
column3: Ohio school district
column5: [23] issued a blanket ban on all clown costumes and clown masks in addition to previously existing policies and restrictions. Target has pulled clown masks from its website and stores as a result of the scare
column6: [24][25][26] as has Canadian Tire. The village of Memramcook
column7: New Brunswick asked residents not to dress up as clowns on Halloween.[27] Employees of theme parks were instructed to remove any horror costumes and make-up before leaving work.[28]

column1: Threatened ""clown purge"" and aftermath [ edit ]
By October 25
column3: several news outlets reported on an alleged clown-initiated ""purge"" or ""attack""
column4: which supposedly was to take place on Halloween Eve of 2016.[29][30][31] While there were no widespread ""purge"" attacks as threatened
column5: a family from Florida were attacked on October 31
column6: 2016 by a group of approximately 20 people in clown masks (and masks styled after The Purge movie). No arrests were made.[32][33]

column1: The sightings inspired the upcoming horror film titled Behind the Sightings
column2: directed by Tony Cadwell.[34][35]

column1: Incidents [ edit ]
Australia [ edit ]
On October 7
column2: several of these sightings were reported in Campbelltown
column3: New South Wales. Four images of sightings in the city were uploaded onto the Internet; one showed a clown being knocked to the ground.[36] Since October 7
column4: there have been multiple sightings across major Australian cities

column1: On October 8
column2: at around 9:30 PM
column3: two 12-year-old girls were with a parent buying ice cream when they were attacked by a creepy clown. While attacking the girls
column4: the clown tried to steal one girl's phone.[38]

column1: Brazil [ edit ]
In October
column2: a sighting was recorded in Curitiba.[39][40]

column1: The incidents in Brazil and worldwide led to professional clowns protesting in Rio Grande do Sul in late October.[41]
Canada [ edit ]
Alberta [ edit ]
On October 5
column2: in Edmonton
column3: Harry Ainlay High School was put into lock down due to clown scares on social media.[42] The following day
column4: other incidents in the city were reported at a Catholic school and junior high schools.[43][44][45] As well
column5: two incidents of sightings occurred in Fort Saskatchewan
column6: a city direct northeast of Edmonton.[46] Later
column7: a 15-year-old youth admitted dressing up as one of the clowns to RCMP in Fort Saskatchewan.[47]

column1: Elsewhere in the province
column2: the Calgary Police Service received messages from several Calgarians regarding images depicting people dressed as clowns in the city.[48]

column1: British Columbia [ edit ]
On October 6
column2: two teenaged boys dressed as clowns were placed under arrest
column3: following a threat which made schools in the Prince George area be locked down. The teenagers
column5: were arrested at a high school in the area.[49]

column1: New Brunswick [ edit ]
Police are investigating several encounters with creepy clowns in New Brunswick communities. A person dressed as a clown was seen trying to jump out in front of cars in Ripples.[50]
Newfoundland and Labrador [ edit ]
A complaint about a ""creepy clown"" sighting was received by local authorities
column2: prompting an investigation in Gander
column3: central Newfoundland.[51][52]

column1: Nova Scotia [ edit ]
In early October
column2: people dressed as clowns were sighted in Halifax
column3: Hammonds Plains

column1: Police responded to a sighting at Halifax West High School.[54][55] People dressed as clowns in Glace Bay have also interfered with traffic.[56] Police in Clark's Harbour arrested a 24-year-old man wearing a clown mask. Witnesses reported that he grabbed at the clothing of a young boy.[57]
Nunavut [ edit ]
In the first half of October
column2: there were several reports of people dressed as clowns in the hamlet of Rankin Inlet
column3: Nunavut.[58]

column1: Ontario [ edit ]
In early October
column2: people dressed as clowns were spotted chasing children during dismissal at Pope Francis Catholic School
column3: an elementary school in Toronto. Police detained two 15-year-olds in connection with the incident. It is believed they are former students of the school and they were filming their activities for a YouTube video. Police have said that the suspects did not touch the students.[59] In addition
column4: the Toronto Catholic District School Board spokesperson John Yan said that a group named ""Clowns in the 6"" have specifically named different high schools in Toronto as targets for potential clown attacks.[60]

column1: On October 6
column3: a group of people dressed as clowns made a message on an Instagram account saying: ""We are coming to London
column4: Ontario's high schools and surrounding areas. We are going to kidnap students and behead teachers
column5: we're not clowning around.""[61] The account gained attention in the city of London as well as Saint Thomas and surrounding towns and municipalities. A few days later
column6: a student at Mother Teresa Catholic Secondary School in North London was approached by a man wearing a clown costume. The man sprinted at her
column7: coming close to the school itself. Numerous students captured photos on the social media application Snapchat
column8: as the man ran from the property. Clarke Road Secondary School and H.B. Beal Secondary School were both put under lock-downs during the following days. During the height of this ""clown epidemic""
column9: London District Catholic School Board banned students from wearing clown costumes during Halloween celebrations that year.

column1: Quebec [ edit ]
On August 9
column2: people dressed as clowns were reported to have been chasing children in Gatineau
column3: Quebec.[62]

column1: On October 2
column2: a video surfaced of a person dressed as a clown in the middle of a dirt road in Quebec
column3: with a chainsaw that chased after a car on foot.[63] On October 14
column5: a teenager was chased by a clown with a baseball bat; he called the police
column6: but the culprit was never found.[64]

column1: Chile [ edit ]
In October
column2: a male dressed as a clown was filmed walking around with a baseball bat in Rancagua
column3: Cachapoal Province
column4: pursuing the recorder and his group of friends.[65]

column1: Croatia [ edit ]
Sightings in Croatia begun on October 16 in Osijek
column2: then followed in other cities
column3: such as Karlovac and Trilj. Some teenagers allegedly beat a person dressed as a clown in Osijek and on October 21
column4: the first three people dressed as clowns were arrested in Karlovac. On October 22
column5: another person dressed as a clown was arrested[66] in Varaždin. Croatian minister of interior affairs Vlaho Orepić said in an interview for RTL TV[67] that Croatian police would deal with that issue and ensure safety of citizens.

column1: Denmark [ edit ]
Police districts across the country have received 22 reports of sightings in total by October 17
On October 12
column3: a man was driving home from a football match when he spotted an axe-wielding male dressed as a clown standing in the middle of the road. The man nearly hit the clown
column4: who was later revealed to be a 13-year-old boy.[69]

column1: On October 14

On October 18
column2: there were two sightings of people dressed as clowns in Tuusula. First
column3: around 10 people dressed as clowns jumped out of a grey van at the play yard of the school. They started to hunt down three kids who escaped to an underpass
column4: where another clown was waiting with a chainsaw. Later

column7: who was jogging with his dog. The dog bit one and the man punched another of the clowns. However
column8: the clowns managed to escape. The man made a police report of the incident
column9: and the police did not find the suspects. There were also sightings of people dressed as clowns in Turku

On October 15
column2: at 2:00 AM in Wesel

column1: On October 21

column3: leaving him with bruises. Another in the same town threatened a 15-year-old with a knife. In nearby Greifswald
column4: two separate reports involved a clown wielding a chain saw. Two other incidents in Greifswald involved young children being scared by someone dressed as a clown.[73][74]

column3: there had been 30 reports of incidents involving attacks

column1: Ireland [ edit ]
There were many reports of incidents regarding people dressed as clowns
column2: but no arrests were made.[77]

column1: On 10 October 2016
column2: organizers of a Halloween haunted house attraction apologised after three people dressed as evil clowns and carrying imitation chainsaws frightened students in the grounds of Newpark Comprehensive School in Blackrock
column3: Dublin.[78] The clowns were said to be publicising the attraction and unaware that the grounds were private property.[78] The attraction's spokesperson said it was ""'in no way linked' to the 'creepy clown' craze sweeping across the UK and US"".[78] After the incident police said they are taking the clown craze seriously and reports will be investigated.[77] After the statement it was reported that a clown with an axe broke into a home in County Kildare
column4: and scared a child.[79] There were reports of clowns jumping out of bushes to scare schoolchildren.[80] In mid October Dundalk police issued a warning saying ""A number of people have been hurt as part of this craze and we are advising people not to take part in it"" and that ""It could be considered a breach of the Public Order Act or the Offences Against the Person Act.""[81]

column3: a suburb of Mexico City
column4: possibly due to being beaten to death by a group of people after the clowns were scaring people.[84] This turned out to be false. The news sites reporting the incident used a photo of two clowns murdered in Guatemala in March 2015.[85][86]

Killer clowns"" have been jumping out of bushes to scare pedestrians in Perth and Dundee.[12]

column1: Critical analysis [ edit ]
Explanations include that some clown sightings were promotional stunts for Rob Zombie's 31 or Andrés Muschietti's 2017 film adaptation of Stephen King's novel It
column2: both of which feature one or more characters dressed as clowns.[278][279]

column1: Author and folklorist Benjamin Radford
column2: who wrote the non-fiction book Bad Clowns
column3: said that the craze could be an example of the ""snowball effect""
column4: where rumor and legitimate concerns mix with the human penchant for a good story.[280]

column1: The Verge dismissed the sightings as a case of mass hysteria
column2: stating that a fear of clowns (which is common in children and adults) may be an underlying cause.[281] Vox likewise claimed that ""The Great Clown Panic of 2016 has been perpetuated by pretty much everyone except actual clowns.""[282]

As Levi’s signature jeans gained popularity amongst a wider set in the middle of the last century
column9: the pants came to symbolize American freedom. As Stanford Historian Niall Ferguson points out in his book
column10: Civilization: The West and the Rest
column12: the American pants were so desirable behind the Iron Curtain that citizens would break any number of laws to obtain them. At one point the company even celebrated America’s armed heritage in a circa 1950 advertising brochure
column13: “Levi’s Gallery of Western Guns & Gunfighters.” It’s with some irony then that Levi’s has abandoned this rugged image to team up with a billionaire oligarch in an effort to empower the government to trample upon the fundamental rights of the American people.

column1: On September 4th
column2: Levi’s CEO Chip Bergh announced that the San Francisco-based clothing manufacturer (which also owns Dockers) would openly advocate for gun control. As part of this campaign
column3: the company will donate more than $1 million to radical anti-gun groups
column4: including Michael Bloomberg front-group Everytown for Gun Safety and Giffords
column5: formerly Americans for Responsible Solutions and the Legal Community Against Violence. The company will also match employee donations to these groups and is encouraging its staff to devote their time to anti-gun activism.

column1: Further
column2: Bergh stated that the company has joined the Everytown Business Leaders for Gun Safety. The business wing of Bloomberg’s outfit is dedicated to leveraging member companies’ “market footprint… employee networks
column3: [and] public communications platforms” to diminish Americans’ Second Amendment rights.

column1: In a repulsive insult to the nation’s 100 million gun owners
column2: Bergh likened Levi’s campaign to restrict the rights of law-abiding Americans to previous company efforts aimed at combatting pre-Civil Rights Era racial bigotry.

column1: Among gun owners
column2: Levi’s intemperate foray into the world of gun control politics has been met with the disgust it deserves. However
column3: it shouldn’t be met with surprise.

column1: Since the late 1990s
column2: Levi’s has used its name and resources to attack gun rights. In 1999
column3: the company gave $100

column1: PAX was founded in 1998 by Dan Gross
column2: who went on to become president of the Brady Campaign to Prevent Gun Violence. PAX would go on to change its name to the Center to Prevent Youth Violence and later merge with the Brady Campaign.

column1: Much like Bloomberg’s Everytown
column2: PAX placed an emphasis on attracting corporate partners to their gun control efforts. As part of Levi’s relationship with PAX
column3: in 1999 the apparel company teamed up with the band Goo Goo Dolls to attract support for the anti-gun group during the Levi’s Fuse ’99 summer concert tour. Concert goers
column5: were encouraged to sign the PAX Youth Petition. Moreover
column6: the denim company donated a percentage of all Levi’s Fuse ’99 t-shirt proceeds to the gun control group.

column1: The PAX Youth Petition endorsed a variety of severe gun control measures that have repeatedly been rejected by the American public through their elected representatives. The document called for the “licensing and registration of guns
column2: like automobiles.” The petition also demanded the “elimination of assault weapons and other weapons of war.” As the 1994 Clinton “Assault Weapons” ban was in place at the time of the petition
column3: this imprecise demand appeared to call for prohibiting the sale of the remaining lawful semi-automatic firearms
column4: confiscation of the firearms grandfathered under the ban

column1: Given the majority of Levi’s 165-year history
column2: Bergh’s decision to use a formerly-quintessential American company to attack a quintessential American right is a particularly sad episode in the current surge in corporate virtue-signaling. We can only assume that Levi’s accountants have determined that resulting skinny jeans sales will be enough to offset the permanent damage to their once-cherished brand." column1: https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/dc-comics-jesus-christ/	dc comics is publishing a series depicting jesus christ living with a superhero.	true	['']	2019/01/11	Arturo Garcia	['https://www.theverge.com/2017/6/24/15865528/preacher-garth-ennis-amc-vertigo-comics-dominic-cooper-ruth-negga'
column2: 'https://www.bleedingcool.com/2019/01/09/fox-news-jesus-august/'
column3: 'https://www.bleedingcool.com/2018/08/25/jesus-superhero-mark-russell/'
column5: Bleeding Cool contributor Mike Sangregorio interviewed Mark Russell about his upcoming DC Comics comic book Second Coming with Richard Pace. Which features Jesus Christ returning to Earth and rooming with Superman analogue Sun-Man. It's clearly a satire.

column1: Today
column2: Fox News seems to have come across the interview and made it a news story. The comic book was announced last year. DC Comics hasn't done any PR blasts about it. So how does this kind of thing happen?

column1: It seems to have begun at my old stomping ground Comic Book Resources. With a title 'Of Course DC Is Bringing Jesus to Comics'
column2: writer Anthony Couto summed up a recent history of DC Comics tackling religious themes – though they miss the big one that would have been relevant to this story. Namely Swamp Thing by Rick Veitch featuring Jesus Christ in a comic that was greenlit by editor Karen Berger and partially drawn before it was spiked by her boss
column3: Paul Levitz. This led Veitch to leave DC
column4: stopped Neil Gaiman taking over the book and for the critically acclaimed series to enter the critical doldrums for quite some time.

column1: Anyway
column2: this article was then picked up by Christian Headlines
column3: in an article by Michael Foust
column4: which linked to the earlier Bleeding Cool interview to garner quotes that Russell gave that might seen as satirical against Christianity. Such as

column1: He goes by a megachurch and they have a billboard of this Tom Brady-looking Jesus Christ throwing a football and he doesn't even recognize himself which is a metaphor for him not recognizing what's been done with the religion that bears his name.
But not
Sun-Man has to deal with things like his grandmother succumbing to dementia or that he can't adopt
column2: because he's technically not a human being
column3: and his wife wants a baby. These are the sorts of problems that superpowers are utterly helpless against. Jesus brings this very different view on how power can be used.

column1: And said that the comic contradicted scripture. That was on Monday.
On Tuesday
column2: CBN News offering 'A Christian Perspective'
column3: had Emily Jones churn the story but did not mention or link to Christian Headlines or CBR
column4: though clearly used the former's take on the story. They did however mention and linkto Bleeding Cool's interview. They called it 'closer to blasphemous than biblical.'

column1: On the same day the Preston Business Review
column2: writer unknown. swiped the story from CBN
column3: without crediting or linking
column4: repeating their line about blasphemy line
column5: mentioning – but not linking – to Bleeding Cool. The same with WND.

column1: Today the right-wing site Newsbusters's Matt Philbin picked up on the story
column2: using all the same quotes but crediting no one but Bleeding Cool's interview. From last August. And adding lots more invective.

column1: From there it was a hop and a skip to Fox News for an article by Caleb Parke. Who credited and linked to no one but Bleeding Cool
column2: with the headline 'DC to release controversial Second Comic Of Jesus'. The invective was stripped back
column3: but you could see the journey.

column1: Controversial to whom? After all
column2: no one in the media seemed to notice Bleeding Cool's interview with Mark Russell about the comic until three days ago
column3: and that was only because of another comic book website
column4: trying to fill a slow news day…

column1: I wonder where this story will go now?
UPDATE: I should have guessed. Breitbart.
Second Coming will be published in March.
SECOND COMING #1 (MR)
(W) Mark Russell (A) Richard Pace (CA) Amanda Conner
Witness the return of Jesus Christ
column2: as He is sent on a most holy mission by God to learn what it takes to be the true messiah of mankind by becoming roommates with the world's favorite savior: the all-powerful super hero Sun-Man
column3: the Last Son of Krispex! But when Christ returns to Earth
column4: he's shocked to discover what has become of his gospel-and now
column5: he aims to set the record straight. In Shops: Mar 06
column6: 2019 SRP: $3.99"	When Fox News Suddenly Notices an Article About Jesus You Ran in August	2019-01-09 00:00:00	[]	['fox'

column4: 'https://www.change.org/p/release-orcas-and-beluga-whales-from-the-whale-jail-in-srednyaya-bay']	https://www.change.org/p/release-orcas-and-beluga-whales-from-the-whale-jail-in-srednyaya-bay	https://www.change.org/	"Русский/ English / Polish/ Deutsch/ Italian / French / Spanish

column1: Situation
More than 100 whales - orcas and belugas - are being held in tiny enclosures on Russia's Pacific Coast in the city of Nakhodka.
This is the largest number of sea creatures to ever be held in small temporary enclosures. Some of them have been there since July.
Marine mammal experts claim that those animals were being sold to Chinese aquariums
column2: despite the fact that legally they are only supposed to be used for scientific and educational work. In China there are thousands of millions of dollars to be made on these whales.

column1: There are currently 11 orcas
column2: 5 baby walrus and 90 baby belugas held in these enclosures.15 of the belugas are yearlings that are completely dependent on the mothers for survival. Yearlings need to be in constant tactile contact with a parent - in case of danger their mother will fight to the death to keep them alive. Capturing whales this young is banned in Russia.

column1: The export of these marine mammals has finally been stopped but the problem now is that these animals are stuck in ""whale prison"" whilst the authorities try to find the perpetrators and work out the right procedural decision to take. Independent experts are seriously worried that the animals will die if they are kept in these conditions much longer. Whale babies who have not received enough mother's milk will not survive the winter.
Solution
These Orca's need to be released into their natural habitat. The belugas need to be transferred to responsible people that will feed them
column2: rehabilitate them and release them into their natural habitat when they are ready."	Petition · Release orcas and beluga whales from the “whale jail” in Srednyaya Bay · Change.org		[]	['bay'

column7: Captured marine mammals in a holding facility in Srednyaya Bay
column10: Russian Far East. Russian officials say that nearly 100 illegally captured whales could be returned to the wild during the summer. Russian Natural Resources Minister Dmitry Kobylkin says summer offers the most favorable conditions for release. (Whale Watching Russia via AP)

column1: In this handout photo released by Whale Watching Russia on Wednesday
column2: Jan. 13
column4: Captured marine mammals in a holding facility in Srednyaya Bay
column7: Russian Far East. Russian officials say that nearly 100 illegally captured whales could be returned to the wild during the summer. Russian Natural Resources Minister Dmitry Kobylkin says summer offers the most favorable conditions for release. (Whale Watching Russia via AP)

column1: MOSCOW (AP) — Russian officials have invited a French ocean explorer to offer advice on how to safely release nearly 100 illegally captured whales
column2: voicing hope that the animals could be let into the wild during summer.

column1: Jean-Michel Cousteau of the Ocean Futures Society arrived Friday in Russia’s Far East on a mission to inspect the mammals and help create conditions for them to be released. Cousteau
column2: son of famous oceanographer Jacques Cousteau
column3: has voiced concern about the animals’ condition and offered his help to the Russian government.

column1: ADVERTISEMENT
The whales’ condition has drawn international concern
column2: and President Vladimir Putin has ordered authorities to investigate the case and release the animals. Russian prosecutors have brought criminal charges against four companies keeping the whales.

column1: Whales are worth a fortune on the black market
column2: and local environmental activists suspected that they were captured for sale to amusements parks in China. Russian law only allows for the capture of whales for “scientific” purposes.

column1: Regional Gov. Oleg Kozhemyako met with Cousteau in Vladivostok
column2: voicing hope that his experience will help “get a full picture on how to allow the animals to readapt to living in the wild.”

column1: Before flying to the Far East
column2: Cousteau met with Russian Natural Resources Minister Dmitry Kobylkin in Moscow on Thursday. Kobylkin said summer offers the most favorable conditions for releasing 97 belugas and orcas.

column1: “We couldn’t release the animals in the winter
column2: it would have simply killed them
column3: ” Kobylkin said. “We can and must do this work in the coming summer.”

column1: He emphasized that Russia would like to rely on international expertise to ensure the safe release of the mammals.
“We want to do it as openly as possible
column2: ” Kobylkin added.

column1: Russian scientists estimate that the rehabilitation effort will cost about 300 million rubles (about $4.6 million).

Activists first raised the alarm late last fall when 101 belugas and orcas were captured and placed in a marine containment facility that environmentalists have dubbed a “whale prison” near the far eastern port of Nakhodka.
Local prosecutors have said that several of the mammals have escaped
column2: but environmentalists said four animals likely died because of cramped conditions and low temperatures."	Russia plans to free almost 100 captured whales	2019-04-05 13:22:54+00:00	['Vladimir Isachenkov']	['russian'

column1: https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/cave-rescue-trump-meet/	boys rescued after being trapped in a cave for weeks preferred to return there rather than meet with president trump.	false	['burrard street journal']	2018/07/16	David Mikkelson	['http://archive.is/OuDPv'
column2: 'https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-44791998']	https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-44791998	https://www.bbc.com/	"On 23 June
column3: 12 boys went exploring in Thailand's Chiang Rai province with their football coach - and ended up trapped deep inside a cave underneath a mountain. The BBC's Helier Cheung and Tessa Wong were at the scene as a dramatic rescue bid gripped the world.

column1: What happened over those two weeks is a remarkable story of friendship
column2: human endurance - and the lengths some people will go to save someone else's child.

column1: Here our reporters tell the full story of the Wild Boars.
The birthday party that went wrong
It all began with a birthday.
On Saturday 23 June
column2: Peerapat ""Night"" Sompiangjai turned 17 - a milestone most young people around the world would want to celebrate in style.

column1: His family had prepared a bright yellow SpongeBob SquarePants birthday cake and several colourfully wrapped presents at their home in a rural village in Mae Sai district.
Image copyright AFP
But Night wasn't rushing home that day. He was out with his friends
column2: the other members of local youth football team the Wild Boars
column3: and their assistant coach

column1: When their football practice ended
column2: they raced through the rice paddies on their bicycles and up into the forested hills that lately had been blanketed in rain.

column1: Their destination: the Tham Luang cave
column2: a favourite haunt for the boys
column3: who loved exploring the nooks and crannies of the mountain range towering over Mae Sai.

column1: Image copyright Facebook/Nopparat Kanthawong Image caption A photo the boys posted to Facebook shortly before they went in the cave
Once at the mouth of Tham Luang
column2: they stashed their bikes and bags by the cave entrance.

column1: The team and their young coach had often ventured deep into Tham Luang
column2: sometimes as far as 8km
column3: for initiation rites where they would write the names of new team members on a cave wall.

column1: In high spirits
column2: they clambered into the cave with just their torches. They didn't need much else - after all
column3: they were only planning to be there for an hour.

column1: They would not emerge until two weeks later.
Back at Night's home
column2: his family began to worry. His birthday cake sat untouched.

column1: Where were the Wild Boars?
Image copyright Getty Images
Snaking for 10km beneath the cloud-swathed mountain range that separates Thailand and Myanmar is Tham Luang
column2: the fourth biggest Thai cave system.

column1: Named after a mountain shaped like a reclining woman
column2: its full name is Tham Luang Khun Nam Nang Non - ""the great cave and water source of the sleeping lady mountain"". Rich in folklore
column3: it is a popular destination for day-trippers - and adventurous children.

column1: It has its dangers - people have gone missing in Tham Luang before. And once monsoon season starts in July
column2: the cave goes from innocuous to extremely dangerous.

column1: The cave can flood up to 5m (16ft) during the rainy season
column2: and should only be entered between November and April.

column1: The water is moving
column2: it's muddy and there is almost no visibility
column3: local guide Joshua Morris told the BBC.

column1: And once the cave floods - it's risky even for experienced divers.
Almost everyone in Mae Sai knows this. So when the parents of the Wild Boars began to worry about their missing boys
column2: they headed straight to the cave. The boys' plans to visit Tham Luang had been discussed in a group chat on a messaging app with other friends.

column1: They found the bikes
column2: the bags
column3: and some football shoes outside. They raised the alarm.

column1: Image copyright AFP
Deep in the cave
column2: the Wild Boars found themselves in trouble. It had been raining for the last few days
column3: and all that water falling on the mountain had to go somewhere.

column1: That somewhere was the Tham Luang cave system
column2: which was fast filling up.

column1: One initial account from the boys suggests they were caught off-guard by a flash flood. They needed to get out
column2: but instead had no choice but to scramble even deeper into the cave.

column1: The Wild Boars eventually found themselves marooned on a small rocky shelf about 4km from the cave entrance
column2: past a normally dry point known as Pattaya Beach which by now was flooded.

column1: Swallowed up by an unforgiving mountain and surrounded by darkness
column2: the boys and the coach lost all sense of time. Fear
column3: perhaps even terror
column4: would no doubt have crept in.

column1: But they were nothing but determined to survive. The group used rocks to dig 5m deeper into the shelf
column2: to create a cavern where they could huddle together and keep warm.

column1: Coach Ake
column2: a former monk
column3: taught the boys meditation techniques - to help them stay calm and use as little air as possible - and told them to lie still to conserve their strength.

column1: But an extraordinary set of circumstances also worked in their favour.
They apparently had no food - but they did have a supply of drinkable water in the form of moisture dripping from the cave walls.
It was dark
column2: but they had their torches. There was also enough air for a while - because the porous limestone and cracks in the rocks meant air could come through.

column1: They had the right conditions to survive - at least for a little while. And most importantly
column2: the Wild Boars had one another.

column1: Now came the hardest bit - hoping for rescue.
Media playback is unsupported on your device Media caption What's it like in a Chiang Rai cave?
Outside the cave
column2: a full-blown rescue operation was quickly unfolding.

column1: Authorities called in the elite Thai Navy Seals
column2: the national police
column3: and other rescue teams. Local volunteers also pitched in.

column1: Initial investigations found footprints at one of the chambers in the cave - but no other sign the boys were still alive.
Image copyright AFP
The Wild Boars were somewhere in the twisted depths of Tham Luang - but where exactly? And more importantly - how could rescuers get to them?
Exploring the cave was a challenge - most of the Navy divers had little cave diving experience. And the weather was merciless - heavy rainfall meant the water level was still rising
column2: flooding chambers and cutting off rescuers from parts of the cave.

column1: Engineers desperately tried to pump water out of the cave - but struggled
column2: at least at first.

column1: At the start
column2: ""no one really had any idea what to do""
column3: one volunteer said. Officials brought whatever equipment they could think of - small water pumps
column5: knives and shovels - but much of it was apparently unsuitable.

column1: They even tried drilling into the mountainside
column2: desperate to find cracks into the cave system which they could squeeze into
column3: and used drones with thermal sensors to try to locate the boys.

column1: Media playback is unsupported on your device Media caption The BBC joined search teams around the caves
Rescuers also turned to the villagers for local knowledge. The Thai Navy Seals found a boy
column2: a Wild Boar member who happened to have skipped the cave expedition. He recalled a place in the complex they'd visited before - called Pattaya Beach.

column1: Could the missing 13 be there?
Amid the flurry of rescue operations
column2: a small group kept vigil at the mouth of the cave.

column1: Image copyright AFP
These were the boys' families
column2: worriedly offering prayers for their lives. Among them was Tum Kantawong
column3: the godmother of Coach Ake.

column1: Every day she went up the mountain
column2: carrying fruits
column3: incense and candles. ""It was to show respect to the spirit that protects the cave. I asked her to protect the 13 kids

column1: Media playback is unsupported on your device Media caption A country in prayer
The group gradually expanded to include concerned teachers from the schools the Wild Boars attended.
We wanted to be the first to welcome the boys when they came out
column2: said school administrator Ampin Saenta
column3: who is so close to one boy

column1: Classmates of the Wild Boars held group prayers
column2: sang songs of encouragement into the cave
column3: folded paper cranes
column4: and posted messages of hope on school noticeboards.

column1: Villagers rallied together
column2: donating money and hundreds of packages of food to the relatives of the boys and their coach.

column1: That sense of community soon began to spread
column2: as the story gained the nation's attention. Volunteers from other parts of Thailand flew in
column3: while Thai social media lit up with expressions of love and support.

column1: But it was about to get even bigger.
Image copyright Getty Images
Image copyright Getty Images
The first international rescuers arrived on Thursday 28 June.
These were US air force rescue specialists
column2: and cave divers from the UK
column3: Belgium
column6: and many other countries. Some had volunteered
column7: and some were called in by Thai authorities.

column1: Others were roped in when it became clear just how monumental the search effort would be.
Over the next few days
column2: they and the Thai divers would fight a constant battle with the elements. They had to swim against a strong current
column3: and were often forced back by rising floodwaters.

column1: On Sunday 1 July - just over a week after the boys went missing - the rescuers made some progress. They reached a large cavern that would be later dubbed ""chamber three"" and serve as a key base for the divers.
It also happened to be the birthday of Note - one of the ""Thai cave boys""
column2: as they were now dubbed by the media. All
column3: however
column4: were still lost to the world.

column1: But not for long. The very next day
column2: two British divers made an incredible discovery.

column1: 'Thirteen? Brilliant!'
John Volanthen and Rick Stanton had been braving Tham Luang's narrow
column2: murky passageways for several days
column3: laying out guide ropes and searching for signs of life.

column1: On Monday
column2: the two men finally reached Pattaya Beach. But there was nothing.

column1: They continued onwards into the darkness. Then
column2: a few hundred metres further
column3: they found an air pocket.

column1: Wherever there is air space we surface
column2: we shout
column3: we smell
column4: John told the BBC. It's a standard procedure for such rescue operations.

column1: We smelt the children before we saw or heard them.""
Soon
column2: the light from John's torch illuminated an electrifying sight - the boys emerged from the darkness
column3: coming down the ledge towards him.

column1: Media playback is unsupported on your device Media caption The moment divers discover the missing boys
Rick started counting the boys
column2: while John asked: ""How many of you?""

column1: Thirteen!"" came the reply in English.
Thirteen? Brilliant!""
Next to John
column2: Rick couldn't quite believe what he was seeing. ""They're all alive!""

column1: The lost Wild Boars had been found.
The two divers spent some time with the boys - trying to boost their morale. Then
column2: they left lights with the boys
column3: and promised to return later with food.

column1: The extraordinary encounter was recorded on the divers' cameras - and swiftly posted online. The jubilation was instant
column2: and worldwide.

column1: Wracked with worry for much of the past week
column2: the Wild Boars' parents were ecstatic to see their children had miraculously survived. They looked thin
column3: but were otherwise in relatively good shape.

column1: Media playback is unsupported on your device Media caption Families of the boys celebrated after finding out their loved ones were alive
The boys and their coach were quickly joined by a military medic and Navy SEAL divers who would stay with them for the rest of the ordeal.
After nine days in the darkness
column2: the Wild Boars once again saw light. They longed for proper food
column3: and begged for pad krapao
column4: a rice dish with meat stir fried with basil.

column1: But doctor's orders were that they be put on a special diet of medicated liquid food
column2: and mineral water with added vitamins.

column1: A third boy
column2: Dom
column3: spent his birthday in the cave.

column1: Rescuers set to work in figuring out how to extract 13 people - some of whom couldn't swim - from a winding
column2: flooded 4km-long stretch of caves that even experienced divers would struggle with.

column1: Time is not on our side because they're expecting heavy rains within three days
column2: diver Ben Reymenants told the BBC at the time.

column1: Now the real hard work comes.""
A volunteer army
The astonishing discovery of the children deep in a mountain cave catapulted tiny Mae Sai into the international spotlight.
Overnight
column2: journalists from all around the world descended on the district
column3: as even more rescue volunteers from around the world poured in.

column1: A small makeshift town mushroomed at the rural country park by the cave entrance.
Food stalls were set up - some staffed by members of the Thai royal kitchen - serving free drinks
column2: hot noodles
column3: chicken rice

column1: No job was too small to do.

The country park toilets were dirty and stretched beyond capacity - so people began cleaning them. Workers needed to get up and down the mountain - so drivers offered free lifts. Rescuers were covered in mud - so a local laundromat cleaned their clothes every night.
Media playback is unsupported on your device Media caption Thailand cave rescue: Meet the volunteer helpers
Spirits were high
column2: but then a fatal accident devastated the community.

column1: A hero dies
Former Navy Seal diver Saman Gunan was one of many volunteers who had rushed to help in the rescue.
On 6 July
column2: while on a routine run to deliver air tanks to the boys
column3: he lost consciousness after running out of air for himself. His dive buddy pulled him out and tried to revive him.

column1: But Saman could not be saved. He was only 38 years old.
Media playback is unsupported on your device Media caption Wife and father remember 'hero' Thai diver: ""He loved helping others""
His funeral took place later that day. Buddhist monks murmured prayers for Saman as incense burned.
His wife
column2: Waleeporn Gunan
column3: said: ""Saman once said we never know when we're going to die… so we need to cherish every day.""

column1: The death hit home the danger of the rescue mission
column2: and the risks facing the boys. Saman was a fit and healthy diver who had also represented Thailand in triathlons.

column1: Ratdao Chantapoon
column2: the mother of cave boy Note
column3: was said to have told a friend: ""The Navy Seal had practised for so long
column5: but also died. How about a boy who has never dived before?""

column1: There was another thing to worry about too - despite efforts to replenish the air
column2: oxygen levels in the chamber had fallen to 15%
column3: lower than the usual 21%.

column1: Time was running out.
Rescuers had identified three possible options:
Training the boys to dive through flooded areas of the cave - a process so ripe with potential for disaster it was widely considered a last resort
Pumping water from the cave and waiting for water levels to recede naturally - but this could take up to four months
Finding or drilling alternative passages into the cave
The divers started practising with some local boys at a swimming pool - figuring out how to transport a child safely underwater.
Other solutions
column2: such as an offer of a kid-sized submarine designed by tech entrepreneur Elon Musk's engineers
column3: would be rejected as unsuitable.

column1: The rescue team faced conditions so difficult that even simple tasks - setting up air and phone lines in the cave - seemed impossible at first because of the labyrinthine layout of the cave.
Finally
column2: late on 6 July
column3: rescuers set up an oxygen supply. And in the end the boys communicated with their parents the old-fashioned way - by writing letters.

column1: The letters
column2: made public by the Thai Navy Seals
column3: were deeply moving.

column1: Scrawling hearts and smiley faces on note paper
column2: the boys told their parents again and again that they loved them and not to worry.

column1: They listed the food they wanted to eat - fried chicken and pork crackling. One even cracked a joke: ""Teacher
column2: please don't give us too much homework!""

column1: I'm really sorry to the parents
column2: said Coach Ake in his letter. But instead of a tongue-lashing
column3: he received only love.

column1: Coach Ake
column2: I really thank you for taking care of all the kids
column3: and keeping them safe

column1: D-Day
Image copyright AFP
Sunday 7 July. Two weeks had passed since the boys went missing.
Out of the blue
column2: the Thai authorities announced they were pulling out the boys - now.

column1: There is no other day that we are more ready than today
column2: Narongsak Osotthanakorn
column3: the head of the rescue operations

column1: Journalists and volunteers were asked to leave the cave rescue site - and a brisk
column2: steely mood overtook the camp.

column1: Media playback is unsupported on your device Media caption Rescue teams begin the operation to extract the boys from the cave
Why the snap decision? The rain that had pelted Mae Sai incessantly had petered out in recent days
column2: giving rescuers a rare break.

column1: Locals had also told the Thai Navy Seals that by around 10 July every year
column2: the Tham Luang cave system would be completely flooded.

column1: It was time to launch what would later be described as a ""superhuman"" rescue effort
column2: one that involved nearly 100 Thai and foreign divers.

column1: The journey was split into two sections.
The first - from the boys' rocky ledge to chamber three - was more difficult. Rescuers made their way for hours through pitch dark waters that were bone-chilling cold
column2: feeling their way with guide ropes. At times they had to navigate sections so ridiculously narrow that they could only just about fit a body through.

column1: Each boy was given a full-face air mask to ensure they could breathe
column2: and clipped to a diver. Another diver accompanied them.

column1: A cylinder was strapped to the front of each child
column2: while a handle was attached to their backs - and they were held face down to ensure water would run away from their faces.

column1: John
column2: the British rescue diver
column3: likened the equipment to ""a shopping bag"" that allowed them to manoeuvre the boys around obstacles.

column1: At the narrow sections
column2: rescuers had to unstrap their air tanks in order to squeeze through
column3: while also pulling along their precious cargo.

column1: It would have been terrifying for experienced divers
column2: let alone for children who were not strong swimmers. The Thai government says the boys and the coach were given anti-anxiety medication to relax - but several sources have told the BBC that they were in fact heavily sedated
column3: and only semi-conscious during the journey - to ensure they would not panic.

column1: Once they reached chamber three
column2: it was time for the second phase. This took another few hours.

column1: Each boy was secured in a stretcher
column2: and carried by a team of at least five men. At one point they had to place the stretcher on a raft and pull it across a chin-high pool of water.

column1: Image copyright AFP/Royal Thai Navy
Rescuers had to winch the boys up a steep slope using a pulley system. In some rocky areas they formed a human chain
column2: passing the boys hand to hand
column3: while at others they slid them on top of pipes pumping out water.

column1: For diver Ivan Karadzic
column2: the experience was extremely stressful. Stationed at a halfway point in the cave
column3: he was responsible for replacing air tanks and guiding rescue divers through.

column1: He clearly remembers the nerves he felt when the first boy emerged from the darkness and was brought towards him. ""I didn't know if it was a casualty or a kid
column2: he told the BBC.

column1: But when I saw that he was alive and breathing - it felt very good.""
Image copyright Getty Images Image caption Thai students prayed for the rescue mission to be a success
One by one
column2: the Wild Boars were brought out of the darkness of Tham Luang. They were given oxygen before they were swiftly spirited away in ambulances to a hospital in Chiang Rai city.

column1: Rescuers took them out in three batches over as many days
column2: as they needed time in between to replenish air tanks.

column1: But they were cutting it close. By the time the last batch of boys and the coach were out
column2: water levels were starting to rise again
column3: as rapidly as 30cm in one hour
column4: according to senior Navy SEAL Supachai Tanasansakorn.

column1: It was Tuesday 10 July - the day that locals said the cave would become completely flooded.
But while the boys were out
column2: there were still people left on the rocky ledge deep inside Tham Luang - the Navy SEAL divers and medic who had looked after the Wild Boars
column3: as well as Richard Harris
column4: a famed Australian cave diving expert and doctor.

column1: They emerged shortly after the last boy was taken out. It was not a moment too soon
column2: as a pump suddenly stopped working - some said it failed while others said it was switched off.

column1: Floodwaters rushed in
column2: sending workers clearing up the site fleeing.

column1: Hooyah!
It was an astonishing feat - after two agonising weeks the Thai cave boys and their coach were finally out at last
column2: safe and sound.

column1: On Facebook
column2: the Thai Navy Seals posted: ""We are not sure if this is a miracle
column3: science

column1: In Chiang Rai
column2: jubilant crowds lined the streets leading to the hospital
column3: cheering on the ambulances. Car horns blared incessantly in celebration.

column1: Image copyright Reuters
Thai social media was inundated with posts hashtagged #ThankYou
column2: #Heroes and #Hooyah
column3: the signature Thai Navy Seal chant.

column1: All around the world
column2: millions of people who had anxiously followed the story celebrated the return of the Wild Boars.

column1: But it was a bittersweet night for one person - Richard Harris. The selfless doctor who cut short his holiday in Thailand to save the boys' lives received the terrible news that his father had just died.
Reunited again
Media playback is unsupported on your device Media caption The boys give peace signs as they recover in hospital
Dressed in gowns and wearing face masks
column2: the Thai cave boys sat up in their hospital beds and waved to the world.

column1: On Wednesday 11 July
column2: the media got its first post-rescue glimpse of the Wild Boars in a Thai Navy Seals video. Some made victory signs at the camera.

column1: Their parents
column2: who had waited so very long to hold their sons again
column3: were not by their side. They were behind a viewing window
column4: some sobbing with joy at the sight of their boys.

column1: The government said it was necessary to quarantine the boys to protect them and others from infection - though this did not stop Prime Minister Prayuth Chan-ocha from visiting in person. The parents did not publicly object to the strict rules.
At the hospital
column2: the boys and coach were put through a series of health checks. Eye shades were a must at first - their eyes
column3: accustomed to two weeks of darkness

column1: Image copyright AFP Image caption The last four Navy SEALs to exit the cave
Hospital authorities said that some had minor lung and eye infections and needed antibiotics. Apart from that
column2: they appeared to be on the mend.

column1: Eventually
column2: parents were finally allowed to briefly see the boys
column3: although they had to maintain a 2m distance
column4: and don hospital gowns and masks.

column1: Some of the boys have even been able to start eating normal food again
column2: after days of craving chocolate and their favourite snacks.

column1: Media playback is unsupported on your device Media caption Rear Adm. Arpakorn Yuukongkaew
column2: head of the Thai navy seals: ""There was only a tiny bit of hope""

column1: As for the rescuers
column2: they are still digesting the unprecedented feat they pulled off.

column1: We didn't think the mission would be this successful

column1: BY THE PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA
A PROCLAMATION
For generations
column2: the story of American progress has been shaped by the inextinguishable beliefs that change is always possible and a brighter future lies ahead. With tremendous strength and abiding resolve
column3: our ancestors -- some of whom were brought to this land in chains -- have woven their resilient dignity into the fabric of our Nation and taught us that we are not trapped by the mistakes of history. It was these truths that found expression as foot soldiers and Freedom Riders sat in and stood up
column4: marched and agitated for justice and equality. This audacious movement gave birth to a new era of civil and voting rights
column6: we renewed our commitment to an ideal at the heart of our founding: no matter who you are
column9: or the circumstances of your birth
column10: you deserve every opportunity to achieve your God-given potential.

column1: As we mark National African American History Month
column2: we celebrate giants of the civil rights movement and countless other men and women whose names are etched in the hearts of their loved ones and the cornerstones of the country they helped to change. We pause to reflect on our progress and our history -- not only to remember
column3: but also to acknowledge our unfinished work. We reject the false notion that our challenges lie only in the past
column4: and we recommit to advancing what has been left undone.

column1: Brave Americans did not struggle and sacrifice to secure fundamental rights for themselves and others only to see those rights denied to their children and grandchildren. Our Nation is still racked with division and poverty. Too many children live in crumbling neighborhoods
column2: cycling through substandard schools and being affected by daily violence in their communities. And Americans of all races have seen their wages and incomes stagnate while inequality continues to hold back hardworking families and entire communities.

column1: But the trajectory of our history gives us hope. Today
column2: we stand on the shoulders of courageous individuals who endured the thumps of billy clubs
column3: the blasts of fire hoses
column4: and the pain of watching dreams be deferred and denied. We honor them by investing in those around us and doing all we can to ensure every American can reach their full potential. Our country is at its best when everyone is treated fairly and has the chance to build the future they seek for themselves and their family. This means providing the opportunity for every person in America

column1: to access a world-class education
column2: safe and affordable housing
column3: and the job training that will prepare them for the careers of tomorrow.

column1: Like the countless
column2: quiet heroes who worked and bled far from the public eye
column3: we know that with enough effort
column6: people who love their country can change it. Together
column7: we can help our Nation live up to its immense promise. This month
column8: let us continue that unending journey toward a more just

column1: NOW
column2: THEREFORE
column3: I
column5: President of the United States of America
column6: by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and the laws of the United States
column7: do hereby proclaim February 2015 as National African American History Month. I call upon public officials
column10: and all the people of the United States to observe this month with appropriate programs

column2: I have hereunto set my hand this thirtieth day of January
column3: in the year of our Lord two thousand fifteen
column4: and of the Independence of the United States of America the two hundred and thirty-ninth.

column12: 'https://www.timeanddate.com/astronomy/moon/distance.html?year=2015&n=137']	https://science.nasa.gov/science-news/news-articles/a-supermoon-trilogy	https://science.nasa.gov/	"Mark your calendars: a series of three supermoons will appear on the celestial stage on December 3

column1: What is a Supermoon? A supermoon is a Moon that is full when it is also at or near its closest point in its orbit around Earth.
Since the Moon’s orbit is elliptical
column2: one side (apogee) is about 30
column3: 000 miles (50
column4: 000 km) farther from Earth than the other (perigee). Nearby perigee full Moons appear about 14% bigger and 30% brighter than full Moons that occur near apogee in the Moon's orbit.

column1: “The supermoons are a great opportunity for people to start looking at the Moon
column2: not just that once but every chance they have!” says Noah Petro
column3: a research scientist from NASA’s Goddard Space Flight Center.

column1: It’s hard for our eyes to distinguish these small changes in size when the Moon is high amidst the vastness of the night sky. But any time you catch a full Moon as it rises or sets
column2: while it’s suspended low on the horizon beaming through the silhouettes of trees or buildings
column3: its apparent size might make you do a double-take. You almost feel as though you could reach out
column5: and drop it into your coffee cup. Even more so if it’s a supermoon.

column1: If you can only catch one episode of the supermoon trilogy
column2: catch the third one. It will be extra special.

column1: First of all
column2: the January 31st supermoon will feature a total lunar eclipse
column3: with totality viewable from western North America across the pacific to Eastern Asia. The Moon’s orbit around our planet is tilted so it usually falls above or below the shadow of the Earth. About twice each year
column4: a full Moon lines up perfectly with the Earth and Sun such that Earth’s shadow totally blocks the Sun’s light
column5: which would normally reflect off the Moon.

column1: “The lunar eclipse on January 31 will be visible during moonset. Folks in the Eastern United States
column2: where the eclipse will be partial
column3: will have to get up in the morning to see it
column4: ” notes Petro. “But it’s another great chance to watch the Moon.”

column1: The Moon will lose its brightness and take on an eerie
column2: fainter-than-normal glow from the scant sunlight that makes its way through Earth’s atmosphere. Often cast in a reddish hue because of the way the atmosphere bends the light
column3: totally eclipsed Moons are sometimes called ‘blood Moons.’

column1: “We’re seeing all of the Earth’s sunrises and sunsets at that moment reflected from the surface of the Moon
column2: ” says Sarah Noble
column3: a Program Scientist at NASA headquarters.

column1: The January 31st supermoon will also be the second full Moon of the month. Some people call the second full Moon in a month a Blue Moon
column2: that makes it a super ‘blue Moon.’ Blue Moons happen every two and a half years
column3: on average. With the total eclipse
column4: it’ll be a royal spectacle indeed: a ‘super blue blood’ Moon.

column1: Sometimes the celestial rhythms sync up just right to wow us. Heed your calendar reminders. On the three dates marked
column2: step out into the moonset or moonrise and look up for a trilogy of sky watching treats!

column1: To learn more about the many wonders of the Moon
column2: go to moon.nasa.gov.

column1: For more on the many skywatching events to be found throughout the year
column2: visit science.nasa.gov"	Science Mission Directorate		[]	['earths'
